“We have sought a solution to the problem of haphazard parking, and are sure that this government will take measures to improve the situation in our area. We have faith in our CM,” said Kailash Kumar, a resident of Patparganj.

“My children’s school has seen a major facelift in the past few years. No government earlier thought about improving schools and education sector. This government has worked for the poor and it is my responsibility to vote for them,” said Vicky Gaba from Trilokpuri.

When asked about the problem of potholes, residents said that they were confident that AAP would get all of them filled soon. “Earlier, the condition of the roads was much worse. It was all mud. Now, at least the roads are walkable. This government has made the place liveable for us, and we will make sure that we bring them to power again. We are sure that they would work for our welfare,” said Shashi from Kondli village.

Title: Youth gets 14-year RI for marrying minor
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative image

BHOPAL: A Tikamgarh youth was sentenced to 14-year rigorous imprisonment for raping a minor after marrying her at a temple in Indore . Assistant district prosecution officer PP Patel said, “In the sentence pronounced on January 31, a special court for POCSO act did not consider the marriage consent given by the minor and found him guilty of raping her.”

He said that the case dates back to April 2018 when a man in Tikamgarh had lodged a police complaint about his missing daughter. Father of the minor, Patel said, owns a shop and he had told police that the accused would visit his shop quite often. “On April 25 2018 , he reported the matter of the missing girl with Dehat police station”, he said.

Further investigation revealed that Mahendra Kushwah, a resident of Tikamgarh, had eloped with the girl and married her at a temple in Indore. But as the girl is a minor, their physical relationship was treated as a rape, Patel said. The DNA report confirmed the rape.

As the girl is a minor, the court refused to consider her consent for marriage and sentenced the youth to 14 years of rigorous imprisonment and slapped Rs 10,000 fine under section 5/6 of the POCSO act 2012, Patel said.

Title: ‘Fix RTE mapping software’
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Nagpur: As admission season for free seats under the 25% Right To Education (RTE) quota nears, a city-based education activist has demanded that the government first fix the problem related to residential address mapping.

The map interface is integrated into the software and helps applicant parents/guardians to mark their home on Google maps, which is then considered for admissions. This is crucial because in RTE admission, distance is a major criteria as the one who lives the closest to schools gets priority.

Education activist Shahid Sharif said, “The software needs a complete overhaul as many people are facing problem while submitting the form. In the application form when the map interface opens, applicant has to place the balloon on their residence after which the actual distance is calculated automatically.”

Sharif had complained to the education department last year as well but says nothing has been done yet. “If the software is faulty then how can it be taken up for admissions? Every year I have parents complaining about this issue, but nothing happens,” said Sharif.

An education department official who did not wish to be identified said that it can’t be a software-related error. “If there is a glitch then thousands of parents should have been affected. But since the number is so low, it is clear that there is a manual error happening from applicants’ side. While placing the balloon it is possible that it does not drop on exactly the same location as intended thus creating a problem,” said the official.

Once the RTE lottery is done, the software allocates seats to students and parents have to complete the admission formalities based on that. Hardly a few schools check the actual place where the applicant is staying as for them it does not matter if ‘A’ takes admission or ‘B’.

Title: In Okhla, cops find 151 poll stations critical
Content:
Representative Image

NEW DELHI: Several polling booths in Okhla constituency , that has areas like Shaheen Bagh and Jamia Nagar, have been considered critical and vulnerable. A Delhi Police ’s internal report in this regard has been accessed by TOI. While as many as 151 polling stations have been categorised as “critical polling booths,” 135 other areas as “vulnerable and prone to violence.”Police sources say that an area marked “vulnerable” will have six police officers present inside it, instead of usual three. An ACP-rank officer may also be present, depending on the situation.A booth marked “critical” will have four officers present during the polling process. Over 3,000 polling booths have been identified as critical booths in Delhi. In Northeast Delhi’s Seelampur area, 100 polling booths have been identified as critical, but no area as vulnerable. Seelampur had also turned violent in the wake of the anti-CAA protests.“The critical booths, which are also known as sensitive booths, need more attention as political parties can influence voters at these locations with freebies just before the polling day. In case of vulnerable areas, chances of influence and scuffle, previous incidents, and topography play a role. A constant vigil is maintained in such areas,” said a police official.As many as 3,624 polling booths in 70 constituencies have been identified as critical polling stations and 215 as vulnerable areas or pockets.At a non-sensitive booth, a head constable, a constable and a home guard are deployed. At a sensitive booth, the number is increased by four, including an extra head constable and three extra policemen. At a vulnerable booth, one head constable and six more policemen are deployed, apart from the usual number. They are assisted by Central Armed Police Forces.As a precautionary measure, bordering areas of Delhi will be sealed 48 hours prior to polling.“We will be strengthening our deployment in the critical and vulnerable areas where the polling stations are located. All measures have been put in place for a free and fair elections,” said Sharat Sinha, DCP, Election Cell.

Title: In Okhla, cops find 151 poll stations critical
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative Image

NEW DELHI: Several polling booths in Okhla constituency , that has areas like Shaheen Bagh and Jamia Nagar, have been considered critical and vulnerable. A Delhi Police ’s internal report in this regard has been accessed by TOI. While as many as 151 polling stations have been categorised as “critical polling booths,” 135 other areas as “vulnerable and prone to violence.”

Police sources say that an area marked “vulnerable” will have six police officers present inside it, instead of usual three. An ACP-rank officer may also be present, depending on the situation.

A booth marked “critical” will have four officers present during the polling process. Over 3,000 polling booths have been identified as critical booths in Delhi. In Northeast Delhi’s Seelampur area, 100 polling booths have been identified as critical, but no area as vulnerable. Seelampur had also turned violent in the wake of the anti-CAA protests.

“The critical booths, which are also known as sensitive booths, need more attention as political parties can influence voters at these locations with freebies just before the polling day. In case of vulnerable areas, chances of influence and scuffle, previous incidents, and topography play a role. A constant vigil is maintained in such areas,” said a police official.

As many as 3,624 polling booths in 70 constituencies have been identified as critical polling stations and 215 as vulnerable areas or pockets.

At a non-sensitive booth, a head constable, a constable and a home guard are deployed. At a sensitive booth, the number is increased by four, including an extra head constable and three extra policemen. At a vulnerable booth, one head constable and six more policemen are deployed, apart from the usual number. They are assisted by Central Armed Police Forces.

As a precautionary measure, bordering areas of Delhi will be sealed 48 hours prior to polling.

“We will be strengthening our deployment in the critical and vulnerable areas where the polling stations are located. All measures have been put in place for a free and fair elections,” said Sharat Sinha, DCP, Election Cell.

Title: If Kuber wants to give, then you must keep doors open: Economic affairs secretary
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Union finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman with economic affairs secretary Atanu Chakraborty

Title: Anganwadi stir: Sacked workers to approach opposition parties for support
Content: Dehradun: After the state government issued an order regarding the termination of services of 275 anganwadi workers following their protest, the aggrieved workers have now decided to approach the opposition parties to seek support for their agitation which has been going on for almost two months.The sacking order, which was issued last week, stated, “Anganwadi workers’ strike is hampering the work of various schemes, including child nutrition and education, due to which they were issued notices on two different occasions on January 24 and January 27.”The notice further stated, “As the workers failed to respond to the notice, their services have been terminated.”Providing the rationale for sacking the protesting workers, state women and child welfare minister Rekha Arya, said, “We already had several discussions with the anganwadi workers and even assured them that we are working on their demands, but still they continued with their protest. They should have understood that those getting affected by their protest are lactating women, who are dependent on the government scheme. I reiterate that we don’t want to sack anyone and I still urge all the protesting workers to join back their centres.”Terming the government’s decision as “shocking”, president of Uttarakhand anganwadi workers’ union, Rekha Negi said, “Never in the history of the state had any government taken such a stringent action against those who are fighting to get justice”.“From teachers to roadways employees to bank employees, all protest for their rights. But this has happened for the first time that people fighting for genuine rights are being punished like this. If the government thinks they can deter us, they are wrong. This time, either we will get justice or we will lay down our lives,” said Negi adding that the protesting workers will be approaching all the opposition parties to garner support for their struggle.Meanwhile, Congress state vice-president Suryanaknt Dhasmana, who met the anganwadi workers on Sunday, said that his party will support them.“This government has become immune to public dissent. We will be taking their fight to the next level,” Dhasmana added.The state has over 20,000 anganwadi centres in 13 districts, in which 33,850 anganwadi workers, their assistants and helpers, work. Hundreds of anganwadi workers from various districts have been on protest at Dharna Sthal near Parade Ground in Dehradun for 40 days.

Title: Ease of Living Index survey begins
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Nagpur: Smart City’s special purpose vehicle — Nagpur Smart and Sustainable City Development Corporation Limited (NSSCDCL) — has started the Ease of Living Index survey in the city in which citizens can express their experience of services being provided by the Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC), expectations and working of the civic body. The central government’s ministry of housing and urban affairs will decide the ranks of 114 cities, including Nagpur, on the basis of findings of the survey.

Mayor Sandip Joshi has urged people to participate in large numbers in the survey as marks also depend on the number of citizens of the total population that have participated in the survey. “NMC will also get to know the reaction of people towards its working and the standard of services. Feedback from people will help in improving the working and services of the NMC,” he said.

Chief executive officer of NSSCDCL, Ramnath Sonawane, said people have to participate in the survey online. “People have to scan the QR code of the Ease of Living Index Survey-2019 or visit eol2019.org/citizenfeedback. After that, one has to first select Maharashtra state followed by Nagpur city and give their opinion,” he said.

Of the total 114 cities, 12 from the state, including Nagpur, have been selected for the survey.

Title: Jamia Firing: Jamia students refuse to back off
Content:
Many turned up for the protest despite police putting up barricades on the Okhla main road after Sunday's firi... Read More

NEW DELHI: A day after another shooting outside Jamia Millia Islamia , there was a lull in and around the campus on Monday while the police presence was increased with barricades on the Okhla main road .Students, who had called for peace after hundreds of angry locals came out at midnight and started to block traffic, on Monday assembled near gate number 7, where the shots were allegedly fired on Sunday night. On the 53rd day of their protest , students said they would not be scared by such attempts and would continue their protest.After a night of protest at gate 7, there were fewer students and locals at the protest site while the road leading to Jamia was filled with the cops.Meanwhile, students have raised concerns about their security. A member of Jamia’s joint coordination committee, Safoora Zargar, said: “We don’t trust police as the incidents have happened in their presence.” Zargar, along with other girl students, came out of the hostel to protest.Rahul Kapoor, a Jamia PhD student, said, “We are followers of Gandhi. The way he drove the British out, we can also get CAA-NRC withdrawn.”He added that certain political parties “were using Jamia and Shaheen Bagh for their political benefits.” “They didn’t include Muslims in the CAA to create a divide in the country,” Kapoor alleged.The students and locals then read out the Preamble to mark their protest.Jamia administration, meanwhile, began to put up halogen lights on gate number 5 where the alleged shooters were seen by the students on Sunday night.In a CCTV footage accessed by TOI, couple of men could be seen, along with a two-wheeler parked near gate number 5. As they moved away, students of Jamia heard something and the chaos ensued.In Video: Delhi: Jamia students protest outside police station after firing incident

Title: NRI Tax: Indians working overseas won’t be in tax net: CBDT
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

File photo

NEW DELHI: The government on Sunday clarified that the new provision on NRIs was not intended to include in the tax net Indian citizens who are bona fide workers in other countries , setting at rest apprehensions that the new rule may bring those working in the Gulf under the tax ambit.

The Finance Bill 2020 has proposed that an Indian citizen shall be deemed to be a resident in India if he is not liable to be taxed in any country or jurisdiction. The revenue department said this was an anti-abuse provision since it was found that some Indian citizens shifted their stay in low or no-tax jurisdictions to avoid paying tax in India.

“In some sections of media, the new provision is being interpreted to create an impression that those Indians who are bona fide workers in other countries, including in Middle East , and who are not liable to pay tax in these countries will be taxed in India on the income that they have earned there. This interpretation is not correct,” the Central Board of Direct Taxes said in a statement.

“In order to avoid any misinterpretation, it is clarified that in case of an Indian citizen who becomes deemed resident of India under this proposed provision, income earned outside India by him shall not be taxed in India unless it is derived from an Indian business or profession. Necessary clarification, if required, shall be incorporated in the relevant provision of the law,” the statement added.

The Budget had proposed that an Indian citizen not ‘liable to tax’ in any other country or territory shall be deemed to be resident in India. At first glance, it had appeared that India’s diaspora which works in Gulf countries (where there is no tax on individual income) would be badly hit.

However, the Finance Bill added that this would be the case if the individual is not liable to tax in any other country by reason of his domicile, or residence or any other criteria of similar nature.

The Union Budget , unveiled on Saturday, has tightened the screws on those seeking to escape tax by exploiting their non-resident status. While earlier it was possible to be classified as a non-resident by staying out of the country for 183 days — or about six months in a year — this has now been increased to 245 days.

Title: Sewer death: DDA sets up panel, says no work given by it
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Ravi

NEW DELHI: A day after a 22-year-old man died after inhaling toxic fumes while another person fell unconscious while cleaning a sewer line near Delhi Development Authority’s (DDA) Central Business District (CBD) in Shahdara , an inquiry committee was set up by DDA . However, the authority said it hadn’t assigned cleaning of any sewer in the area.

“The inquiry committee, headed by the chief engineer (east), will inquire into the incident,” a DDA spokesperson said. “It is clarified that neither the cleaning work of the sewer line had been assigned to any contractor or agency nor the persons cleaning the sewer line were engaged by DDA,” he added.

“As the sewer line has not yet been handed over to the Delhi Jal Board , therefore, DDA has decided to extend financial assistance to the families of the deceased and injured. DDA expresses its sympathy to the bereaved families of the deceased and injured,” he said.

DDA vice-chairman Tarun Kapoor told TOI that the body is quite concerned about the incident and has a lot of sympathy for the families. “Even though DDA did not assign this work, we will provide financial support to family of the deceased and the injured worker,” he said.

The workers who were cleaning the sewer were not wearing any protective gear and the contractor is currently absconding. The deceased has been identified as Ravi and the injured as Sanjay .

Police said that the sewer line located in the parking lot of CBD grounds was being cleaned by workers since Saturday. A case has been registered. On Monday, PM Narendra Modi addressed an election rally at the ground.

Title: Vendors ‘raid’ NMC zone office, flee with goods seized during NDS drive
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Nagpur: The Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) continued its crackdown on unauthorized roadside vegetable, fruit and meat markets for the second consecutive day on Sunday. Action was taken at 22 such places acting as weekly markets.

Later in the day, a group of vegetable and fruit vendors, supported by an influential politician, raided the NMC’s Mangalwari zone office and took away material seized during the drive on Saturday and Sunday morning.

As per policy framed by mayor Sandip Joshi to ease traffic congestion across the city, municipal commissioner Tukaram Mundhe has launched the drive against unauthorized vendors selling their products on roads and footpaths.

After the incident, Mundhe has now called a meeting with NMC officials, traffic police and special branch to decide further course of action.

During the drive, which kicked off from 8am on Sunday, NMC’s Nuisance Detection Squad (NDS) personnel imposed Rs400 each fine on vendors and hawkers for causing unhygienic conditions and Rs5,000 for using banned plastic bags. The NDS also recovered fine from shopkeepers selling construction material by encroaching footpaths, which was appreciated by local residents.

The civic teams ensured that Sunday weekly markets were not held on roads at Khamla, Jaffar Nagar and a few more areas. Sheds erected by the vendors were removed using JCBs.

Action was also taken against unauthorized markets on WHC Road, Shatabdi Square, Beltarodi Road, Cotton Market, Trisharan Chowk, Manish Nagar T-point, Santra Market, Natraj Talkies, Azamshah Chowk, Satranjpura Square, Badkas Square, Pachpaoli, Jagnath Budhwari, Zade Chowk, Kabir Nagar, Pilli River area, Gol Bazaar, Mangalwari etc.

Officials said vendors should run their businesses only from markets approved by the NMC across the city. “Such unauthorized markets being operated on footpaths and roads lead to traffic congestion as vehicles and the vendors’ set up block almost half of the road,” they said.

Despite the crackdown in the day, a few vendors selling vegetables and fruits were back in the evening in Khamla, Jaffar Nagar, Gokulpeth and continued their business on footpaths and roads.

Many vendors met West Nagpur MLA and city Congress president Vikas Thakre and complained about the “assault on their livelihood”.

Thakre told TOI, “Action against encroachments is understandable, but not on markets which are running at the same place for years. NMC has failed to develop markets in many areas. It should ensure proper place for vendors before taking action. All markets should also have designated parking spaces. City has expanded and it is not possible for all to travel to Kalamna or Cotton Market to get vegetables. The NMC must take care of hundreds of vendors.”

Mundhe is known for stringent action against encroachments on footpaths and roads. He had undertaken similar drives in Navi Mumbai and Nashik etc. Considering his reputation as a no-nonsense officer, the mayor’s policy of ensuring hassle free footpaths and roads for citizens may work well, a few citizens hoped.

The new municipal commissioner is also likely to launch a drive against unauthorized constructions across the city.

Drive is anti-poor: Vendor

Nagpur: Uma Pande, a resident of Rathod Layout, has been dependent on Borgaon Road vegetable market for over two decades. Pande was shocked on Sunday when she didn’t find the sellers setting up stalls by the roadside. “We get all types of vegetables there and at affordable prices. I buy veggies from this market and stock up for the whole week, but today I had to go to Sadar,” she said.

A woman seller said she would suffer substantial loss if the stock remains unsold. “We had been selling vegetables here for over 10 years. We were not informed about the drive. We have never faced any problem while residents too like it to have all vegetables at same place. The drive is anti-poor,” she said.

Asad Hyder, a resident of Anant Nagar, supported the NMC though he too had to go some extra distance to buy vegetables. “The weekly market is good, but people shouldn’t be inconvenienced. Some sellers encroach the road and block traffic. This was going on for years,” he said.

Title: Mah, MP officials in conflict over tigress death
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Nagpur: The Madhya Pradesh and the Maharashtra forest department officials are in conflict after the former charged Deolapar forest range officials under Nagpur division with dumping carcass of a tigress that was found dead in their territory.

On December 11, tigress T-19, known as Sharmilee of Pench (MP) buffer, was found dead in Khandasa forest bordering Deolapar range of Maharashtra. T-19 used to shuffle between forest areas of Deolapar and MP Pench’s buffer. As the death was shrouded in mystery, the MP officials were investigating the case in detail.

Talking to TOI, RS Kori, chief conservator of forests (CCF), Seoni, said, on January 31, the officials picked up temporary forest labourer Dhamsingh Khandate, who worked in Deolapar, for interrogation during which he said that the round officer Salim Razzak Khan had asked him and staff to dump the carcass on the MP side.

Bullock cart of one Laxman Tekam was allegedly used to shift the carcass on the night of December 10. “When we reached the spot on December 11, there were trails of a bullock cart near the carcass. With no strong for cause of death, it was evident that the tigress died at some other spot and later dumped on MP side,” said Kori.

“Though exact cause of T-19 death is unknown, we have sent samples to various labs. From confession of Khandate, we have come to know that the tigress died on Maharashtra side,” Kori added.

CCF P Kalyan Kumar, Nagpur, said, “We have sought all the relevant papers from the MP officials to probe the allegations. Ramtek ACF Sandeep Giri will meet Kori and collect all papers on Monday. There are many gaps in the case which we need to investigate.”

“It is hard to believe the charge as forester Khan was one among the team that effectively monitored a tigress and three cubs in Deolapar range during last summer. We learnt about the allegations through media,” said Kumar.

Deolapar RFO SG Parihar, who was in Nagpur on Sunday to record statements of the team that was present at the spot, denied the charge as baseless. “Why cart owner has not been arrested till date? Why Khan himself has not arrested by taking Maharashtra officials into confidence? The MP officials are passing buck on us,” he said.

Parihar said, “The forest labourer was picked from his house and not arrested near Khawasa as claimed. The MP foresters were trailing him for the last 15-20 days and had visited him twice. It is after nearly two months they are claiming we are involved. When Khandate was arrested, Khan and others had gone to Kurai forest office they were not allowed to meet him. Now he has been renamed to judicial custody.”

Title: Of 3-day extension, a day lost as GSTN portal shut for hrs
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Nagpur: Even though government had extended GST returns deadline from January 31 to February 3, those who rushed to file it on the Budget day were left hassled as the GST Network (GSTN) portal was shut for maintenance.

The order extending the deadline came on the night of January 31. As professionals rushed to file the goods and services tax (GST) returns on Saturday, they found the portal closed for maintenance for over four hours. Though it opened by evening, almost entire day was wasted, said chartered accountants.

“Originally January 31 was the deadline, which was extended late in the night by 3, 5, and 7 days for different states. It was extended by three days for Maharashtra. However, as the server was closed for a considerable time on Saturday, the process was stalled. A number of documents have to be downloaded from the GSTN portal and loss of hours has now pushed back the work,” said chartered accountant Rajeev Damani.

“Messages are doing rounds that only 35% of the returns have been filed so far. For audit reports to be filed, the returns have to be filed first,” said Damani.

The extension was declared on a staggered basis for each state so that sudden load is not created on the server. If each state had the same deadline, the rush would have been more, said an official

As professionals are complaining, officials of GST department said the delay was from the taxpayers’ side also. Majority of the assessees rush to file return only when the deadline nears, clogging the system. As much as 50% of the annual returns have been filed, but audit reports under Form 9C are training. This means there is a delay from the chartered accountants’ side in submitting the audit reports, said an official.

Manish Shukla, chartered accountant, said the delay is also because the system itself does not accept beyond 1.5 lakh returns at a point of time. “The GSTN cannot be accessed once the number of applicants touches 1.5 lakh, and others have to wait in the queue. This delays the process leading to a last minute rush and eventual extension of last date,” he said.

Shukla said a recent circular which restricts the amount of input tax credit (ITC) till it is not reflected in the other party’s returns is also locking up businessmen’s funds. This is because ITC can only be filed in the next quarter after the purchaser files the returns.

Title: Sonia Gandhi health: Congress president Sonia Gandhi in hospital
Content:
Sonia Gandhi (file photo)

NEW DELHI: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi was admitted to Sir Ganga Ram Hospital on Sunday after she complained of a stomach ache and nausea.Sources said the 73-year-old was taken to the hospital at around 7 in the evening. Her children, Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra , also visited her there.“There is nothing to worry about. She is undergoing a few tests. Based on the results, a decision will be taken whether to discharge her or keep her in the hospital until she recovers fully,” said a source. He added that the stomach ache could be due to an infection. The hospital has been Gandhi’s go-to hospital for any health issue. She has been admitted to the hospital several times over the past few years for regular health check-ups and once, in 2017, she was admitted there for shoulder surgery, said a senior doctor.She did not attend Union Budget presentation in Parliament on Saturday. She had attended the first day of the Budget session on Friday and had led the party’s protests against Citizenship (Amendment) Act in Parliament.In Video: Sonia Gandhi admitted to Gangaram hospital in Delhi

Title: Low turnout of migratory birds at lakes disappoints birders
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Pic by Manka Behl

Nagpur: A few years ago, bird watchers in the region used to flock to water bodies and spend hours watching the winter migrants. But they are a disappointed lot this year due to drastic fall in their numbers.

Even as it is time to return for these avians, many hotspots have been devoid of the birds, which used to frequent the locations every year. Migratory birds would arrive in large numbers and water bodies would remain well populated with water birds as well as birders observing them.

“Over a period of last three years there has been a steep decline in the number of birds. The centre of attraction — the bar headed geese (BHG) — were seen in large numbers till recently, and their count used to be over 600. However, not more than 100 have been recorded this season,” says bird expert Nitin Marathe.

Marathe adds, “The low count of birds is following our visits to Saiki, Paradgaon, Khapri, Kolarmet, Sasegaon, Wadgaon, Wadegaon, Telhara, Dahegaon, Chargaon, Undri, and Mangli lakes in 40km vicinity of Nagpur over last month.”

“It is not only BHGs that have a low count, decline of ducks like red crested pochards is much more. At Vena lake, the count six years ago was over 5,000. This year I recorded mere seven. The only solace is Dahegaon lake in Mihan, where sizeable 50 pochards were recorded after a gap of two years,” says avid bird watcher Mayuresh Joshi.

Northern Shovellers, Northern Pintail ducks, Gadwal, Garganey, Coots, Common Pochards, Tufted ducks arrive in good numbers in this area but their presence too has declined.

“Small birds such as Wagtails, Plovers, Pratincoles, Barn Swallows, Blue Throat, Kestrel, Harrier are also showing a decline in numbers, though warblers, Black Red Start, Lesser White Throat have arrived as usual,” says Marathe.

Veteran bird expert Gopal Thosar, who is still engaged in bird watching, expressed serious concern over decline in number of birds. “One of the reasons must be loss in original breeding grounds in countries from where they arrive. This needs to be studied,” Thosar says.

Maharashtra State Biodiversity Board (MSBB) board member Jayant Wadatkar of Amravati admits, “The low count of birds is increasing. Due to prolonged rains, water bodies in the region are full. Birds avoid such lakes due to non-availability of food here. Decline of migratory birds is a global issue.”

“Water bodies are full due to late rains leaving less shore for the birds to rest. Besides, spurt in mining of silt, murrum, metal etc on shores of Chargaon and Saiki is causing disturbance. This seem to be one of the big reasons for decline,” says young birder Pushkar Kulkarni.

Bird watcher Narendra Nikhare said increase in fishing activity has led to decline in number of migratory birds since last few years. The BHGs are seen in lesser numbers. “Geese are predominantly vegans and forage on tender chana (gram) shoots but farmers have been cultivating more of cotton and tur. “Change in crop pattern is one of the reasons for decline,” he adds.

Threats To Avians

* Farming on lake beds at Khapri & Chandrabhaga lakes

* Resorts, layouts, edifices coming up close to the lake area at Wadad, Matkazari, Surabardi, Wadgaon (Ranwara), Khapri

* Farm houses near Chandrabhaga

* Fishing, bricks kilns, excavation at Vena

* Telhara lake going to the dogs due to industrial activity

* Farmers switching from soyabean and chana to cotton and tur to get better yields

Title: Bhandara dy collector permits bullock cart race, backtracks
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

ddd

Nagpur: In a blatant violation of the Supreme Court orders and later supported by Bombay High Court, the Bhandara deputy collector permitted bullock carts’ race known as ‘shankarpat’ in local parlance in Lakhandur in Bhandara district.

The race was inaugurated in Masal village by none other than assembly speaker and Congress MLA from Sakoli, Nana Patole in the presence of a huge crowd. Repeated attempts to contact Patole proved futile. His videos addressing the gathering and pictures from the site went viral on social media on Sunday.

The apex court in its observations has already said that conducting bullock cart races, which are not anatomically designed, subject animals to pain and suffering. The Bombay High Court, too, supported the view while hearing a PIL filed by Ajay Marathe in 2017.

Despite the Supreme Court ban, Bhandara deputy collector Bodwad issued permission for the race on January 31 under political pressure. The permission was issued when district collector MJ Pradip Chandren and additional collector Vilas Thakre were on leave. Bodwad did not respond to calls.

On January 31, Masal deputy sarpanch Rupesh Govinda Pillewan had applied for permission from the collector’s office on the condition that the organizers will follow all the rules proposed in the Maharashtra Prevention of Cruelty of Animals (conduct of bullock cart race) Rules, 2017.

These rules intended not to cause pain and suffering to animals during the race. However, then Chief Justice Dr Manjulla Chellur & Justice NM Jamdar in their order issued on October 11, 2017, had said, “The rules framed by the state government will not take away observations of the apex court which stated that till the PIL is disposed of on merit, no races should be conducted within the state of Maharashtra and no such permission should be granted by any of the authorities, even after notifying the rules.”

However, the deputy collector seems to be unaware of the PIL in the Bombay High Court and issued permission with certain conditions for the race in a single day. The two-day race was opened by Patole on Sunday.

When Bodwad learnt about the Bombay High Court order, he cancelled the permission on Sunday late afternoon by issuing a letter to the deputy sarpanch. But by the time permission was cancelled, all the arrangements were made and Patole was delivering his inaugural speech. Surprisingly, despite the cancellation letter being issued on February 1, the event took place on February 2.

“We posted a tehsildar to ensure that the event is cancelled,” said a top revenue department official. Till filing of this report it was not confirmed whether the race was called off.

Title: Kapsi murder: Hearing stretches late into night
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

NAGPUR: The hearing for the police custody remand (PCR) of three arrested persons in the Pankaj Giramkar murder case before the judicial magistrate first class (JMFC) extended beyond 11.30pm on Monday. The decision was still to be pronounced while going to the press.

It’s learnt that defence counsel Ritesh Kalra came up with a series of allegations against the police for high-handedness and illegal detention, compelling the court to order a medical examination of the arrested persons — Amarsingh Thakur , Manoj Tiwari and Shubham Dongre — with immediate effect.

The trio, along with Baba Khan, who is on the run, murdered and buried Giramkar and his bike in a 10-feet deep trench in Kapsi on Nagpur-Bhandara Road over an illicit relationship. Pardi police wanted the remand of the trio for a detailed interrogation and also to collect more evidence from the spot.

Advocate Kalra alleged that the three accused were rounded up on January 31 after which a confession was extracted through custodial torture.

Thakur, Tiwari and Dongre were brought back to the court after medical examination following which arguments resumed once again. The prosecution also challenged Kalra’s allegations with their argument that the custodial interrogation was required in the case of the heinous murder.

Title: Maharashtra panel to probe ‘phone tap’ of NCP, Congress netas
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Maharashta home minister Anil Deshmukh

MUMBAI: Home minister Anil Deshmukh on Sunday set up a two member committee comprising additional chief secretary Shrikant Singh and Joint Commissioner (Intelligence) Amitesh Kumar to probe into allegations of phone tapping of leading politicians, particularly Congress and NCP during the 2019 Lok Sabha and assembly elections.

“Home minister Anil Deshmukh has directed the additional chief secretary (home) Sanjay Kumar to immediately set up the committee comprising Shrikant Singh and Amitesh Kumar. The probe must be completed within six weeks, the committee has been given liberty to induct officers and technical experts as per the requirement,’’ a senior bureaucrat told TOI.

The bureaucrat said ever since Deshmukh took over the reins of the home department, he has been receiving complaints from political parties and prominent leaders regarding misuse of phone tapping by the previous government, which appears to be very serious. “It was brought to the notice of the Home minister that the powers of gathering call data records and phone tapping was grossly misused during the previous government for political gains and vested interest. The abuse of power has serious implications with respect to national security and right to freedom and privacy as enshrined in the constitution of India,’’ he said.

Under such circumstances, the government felt that a comprehensive and broad based probe was essential. “The inquiry should cover not only legal documents, but also take support of technical experts to decipher if unofficial surveillance has been carried out by tracing the foot-print in the servers of various telecom companies through physical verification and visit,’’ the bureaucrat said.

Title: Practise magical exercise to help economy: Rahul to PM
Content:
Rahul Gandhi (file photo)

Dear PM, Please try your magical exercise routine a few more times. You never know, it might just start the econom… https://t.co/WMYwSqARf8 — Rahul Gandhi (@RahulGandhi) 1580632657000

NEW DELHI: A day after slamming the government over a long budget speech which he said was short on delivery, Congress’s Rahul Gandhi tweeted a video of PM Narendra Modi exercising and suggested he should “practice his magical exercise” to help the country’s sagging economy.On Saturday, Rahul had criticised the budget and said it contained no strategic idea, nor anything concrete and that it had toed a “hollow” approach that was “all talk and nothing happening”.Tweeting a video of Modi doing yoga — the one shared by the PM to kickstart the Fitness Challenge — Rahul said Modi should practice his “magical exercise” routine to jumpstart the economy. “Dear PM, Please try your magical exercise routine a few more times. You never know, it might just start the economy,” he said on Twitter.Finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman has announced a slew of measures to boost economic growth but Congress said the government was in complete denial of the economy facing a “grave macroeconomic challenge”. It also claimed the government had given up on reviving the economy, accelerating growth and creating jobs.Congress’s youth wing, Indian Youth Congress , which has lately been visible in its protests against the government on its economic policies and for its stand on the controversial Citizenship Amendment Act, released a video of young men and women — each wearing masks of different members of the Union cabinet — playing marbles on the road. The video, titled Modi’s government’s ‘Kancha-maar budget’ accused the council of ministers of having done little else than play with the lives of India’s youth.Slamming the Centre for being an “event management government”, IYC president Srinivas V said, “The government made tall promises of running bullet trains. But instead of delivering on promises and being concerned for the future of India’s youth and unemployed, they’re only playing games at their expense.”

Title: Delhi: 22-year-old dies cleaning sewer, another injured
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

The deceased has been identified as Ravi

NEW DELHI: A 22-year-old man died after inhaling toxic fumes while another person fell unconscious while they were cleaning a sewer line in east Delhi's Karkardooma on Sunday afternoon. The workers were not wearing any protective gear. The contractor of the workers is currently absconding.

Police have registered a case. According to police, a sewer line located in the parking lot of CBD grounds was being cleaned by workers since Saturday.

PM Narendra Modi is likely to address an election rally here on Monday. The deceased has been identified as Ravi and the injured as Sanjay (35).

The contractor, Shanky, had forced five workers to clean the clogged sewer. Since the sewer was 15-feet deep and they did not have any safety gears, the workers had refused to go in, but the contractor forced them to enter it. As per police officials, Ravi entered the sewer first using a rope but inhaled toxic gases. When he did not come out after a few minutes, Sanjay entered the sewer to look for him. When even he did not return, the remaining workers were scared to enter.

Police and the fire department were informed, who then rescued the two and took them to Hedgewar hospital, where Ravi was declared brought dead and Sanjay was referred to Lok Nayak Hospital, where he has been put on a ventilator and his condition is stated to be critical. The sewer line was closed for some days and a private contractor was asked to get it cleaned. Shanky then called Ravi, Sanjay, Monu, Deepak and Rajeev from New Sanjay Amar Colony to clean the sewer. He told them they would get Rs 350 each for the work.

Five of them worked on Saturday as well but the sewer could not be cleaned. The contractor then forced them to go inside and clean it. Around 12.30pm on Sunday, Ravi entered the sewer but fell unconscious inside. Sanjay entered later and he did not return as well. The remaining workers panicked and informed the locals and the police. Fire officials then went inside with oxygen cylinders and rescued the two. None of them had any masks or any safety gear. Shanky later fled after the labourers called police.

Initial probe revealed that Shanky did not pay them for working on Saturday, which is why they worked on Sunday. The deceased resided with his family in D block of New Sanjay Amar Colony. His family was looking for wedding prospects for him.

Title: 8-year-old, father run over by train in Kalyan
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Arshad Khan and Aisha

KALYAN: A 40-year-old Kalyan vegetable vendor and his eight-year-old daughter returning home after a trip to Mumbai to see the RBI headquarters to prepare for a school project, were run over by a train late Saturday.

Arshad Khan and Aisha were hit by an oncoming local after they got down from their train at a signal between Kopar and Kalyan stations as she wanted to answer nature’s call.

“Aisha and her twin brother Arsh, class II students, were to make a project on RBI. So, Arshad took his wife Fatima, 10-year-old son Aimar and the twins to Fort to see the RBI headquarters and also to pick up material for their school project,” Arshad’s brother Mubin Khan said. “Arshad had promised to take them out for dinner, but he never made it home.”

Family, at stn, was waiting for man, daughter

Kalyan GRP sources said when the train stopped at a signal near Patripul bridge, Aisha told her parents she wanted to go to the bathroom. Arshad picked up his daughter and jumped onto the tracks. As the train started, Fatima called up her husband and told him to walk to Kalyan station where they would be waiting for him.

After getting off at Kalyan, Fatima called Arshad on his phone, but he did not take the calls. She panicked and called up her relatives, who, in turn, alerted the Kalyan GRP. The railway police informed them that they had found bodies of a man and a girl on the tracks.

The relatives rushed there and identified the bodies. Preliminary probe suggests that they were hit by an oncoming train, said an officer. “Fatima is worried about her sons’ future as Arshad, who ran a shop in Laxmi Market, was the sole breadwinner,” said Mubin.

Title: Expelled AIADMK MP Sasikala Pushpa joins BJP
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Sasikala Pushpa joins the BJP in presence of BJP general secretary P Muralidhar Rao (C) and senior BJP leader ... Read More

CHENNAI: AIADMK Rajya Sabha MP Sasikala Pushpa joined the BJP in the presence of party national secretary P Muralidhar Rao, in-charge of Tamil Nadu , and former Union minister Pon Radhakrishnan in New Delhi on Sunday.

Even though she was expelled from the party in 2016 after an altercation with DMK Rajya Sabha MP Trichy Siva, Sasikala Pushpa remains an AIADMK MP as per Parliament records. While her present term in the Upper House ends on April 2, 2020, the AIADMK can still issue a notice for disqualifying her as per provisions of anti-defection law.

"While she was expelled from the party, AIADMK did not officially inform the Rajya Sabha chairman's office, as the party then did not want its number of MPs in Parliament to go below 50. Even after the 2019 Lok Sabha polls, her status continued to remain as party MP," said a senior AIADMK partyman, seeking anonymity. "One has to see, whether she will now sit along with BJP members or continue to occupy her seat among AIADMK Rajya Sabha MPs," he said. In August 2016, former AIADMK general secretary J Jayalalithaa expelled Sasikala Pushpa from the party saying she had "brought disrepute" to the organization. The MP had publicly slapped DMK MP Siva at the Delhi airport. She said Siva had criticized her leader Jayalalithaa. Two days later, however, she declared in the Rajya Sabha that her leader had slapped her and sought protection for herself. "Sasikala Pushpa should have joined the BJP almost 18 months ago, but the move was held back then. While AIADMK could still issue her a notice, with hardly two months to complete her term, it would matter little in terms of political gains," the source added.

But, BJP sees big political gains by inducting her into the party now. "Sasikala Pushpa, who was a former Mayor of Tuticorin and former secretary of AIADMK women's wing, will strengthen BJP in the southern part of Tamil Nadu," said Pon Radhakrishnan, welcoming her into the BJP.

"Sasikala Pushpa is an aggressive and vocal leader from Tamil Nadu, where BJP is gaining strength day by day and several leaders from other parties are joining the party. We have an ideological and political fight with the DMK and Congress in Tamil Nadu. Sasikala Pushpa joining the BJP will strengthen the party and its ability to fight the next assembly elections in Tamil Nadu," Rao said. "Prime Minister Modiji is a global leader and I have been inspired by his leadership, as well as the leadership of Amit Shahji. BJP president Naddaji has given me this opportunity to join the BJP, which is having a great future in Tamil Nadu. In 2021, BJP will come to power in Tamil Nadu and I will work hard for the same," Sasikala Pushpa told TOI. "Schemes for women empowerment, the eradication of fishermen issue, the announcement of Kulasekarapattinam, which comes in my district, to soon become a rocket launch pad and initiatives of Pon Radhakrishanji that resulted in the flow of Rs 28,000 crore worth of investments in southern districts of Tamil Nadu - have all made me join the party," she added, while declining to comment on her status as an AIADMK MP.

Title: Mumbai: Maternal uncle gets 12 years RI for impregnating 13-year-old
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative image

Title: Inspired by TV series, 2 teens abduct two-year-old in Delhi
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative image

NEW DELHI: Inspired by a kidnapping they saw on a crime series on television, two 19-year-old youths decided to execute a similar crime to make big money. The youths abducted a two-year-old boy but were nabbed while collecting the ransom.

The boy was abducted on Thursday in west Delhi's Ranhola. He was playing outside his house when the youths lured him with sweets and took him to west Delhi's Hastsal.

Police was alerted by the family after the kidnappers called the child's father, demanding Rs 5 lakh to return the boy. After carrying out negotiations under the supervision of police, the family agreed to pay the ransom. The accused, desperate to get the money, were making too many calls and thus gave away their precise location.

As the youths arrived to collect the money, the cops surrounded them. The child was traced to an open plot nearby. As soon as he was secured, police arrested the kidnappers. "They were identified as Rahul and Kuldeep, residents of Mohan Garden. The mobile phone and SIM card bought on stolen documents to make the ransom calls were seized." said A Koan, DCP (outer).

Police said that Rahul is studying BA and Kuldeep is pursuing BCom from a Delhi college. They have been produced before the court and sent to Tihar in judicial custody.

Title: Tamil Nadu: SSI murder case transferred to National Investigation Agency
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

One of the two men who gunned down SSI Wilson

CHENNAI: The murder case of special sub-inspector Y Wilson was transferred to the National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Saturday, as officials believe that the suspects had a much larger network than expected and there was a need for expertise to apprehend all of them.

So far, police have arrested 22 suspects in the case.

An NIA official confirmed that the case had been transferred to NIA. SSI Wilson was found dead on January 8. Police arrested two prime accused, Abdul Shamim and Thoufique, from Udupi railway station on January 14.

During initial inquiries by police, the duo claimed that they killed Wilson to avenge the arrests of their leader, Khaja Moideen, and aides Syed Abdul Nawas and Abdul Samad in Delhi. The duo said they stabbed Wilson when he was alone at a police checkpost at Kaliyakavilai off Kanyakumari-Thiruvanathapuram bypass road on January 8.

Subsequently, police retrieved the guns and knives used by the duo to kill Wilson from a sewage drain in Kerala. Tamil Nadu police took the two men to Kaliyakavilai checkpost, Ratnagiri and Udupi, where they had stayed in hideouts.

In December last year, officials of the Tamil Nadu 'Q' branch had arrested Pachaiyappan, Rajesh and Liyakath Ali based on their suspicious movements and "indulging in radical activities". Police then arrested Mohamed Haneef Khan, 29, Imran Khan, 32, and Mohamed Zaid, 24, from Bengaluru. Subsequently, police arrested Al-Hind Trust coordinator Khaja Moideen, A Syed Ali Nawas, Abdul Samad, from Delhi and Jaffar Ali in Vadodara in Gujarat on January 8.

Title: Delhi: Pro-CAA agitation called off, cops keep two groups at bay
Content:
Police began detaining a few men, loading them into buses, but some managed to force their way out, only to be... Read More

NEW DELHI: Saam, daam, dand, bhed (Cajole, pay, punish, threaten) - men who gathered at Shaheen Bagh on Sunday to protest against the road closure said they believed in all these principles. The phrase, which is a part of Chanakya Niti, a text written as an advice to administrators in the Mauryan empire, found resonance with a crowd that sometimes justified and at other times called for anti-CAA protesters to be shot.Nearly 200-odd men closed in on the protest site around 11.30am. However, police held the fort and they were not allowed inside the main protest area. The men, claiming to be residents of areas like Madanpur Khadar, Sarita Vihar and Jasola, shouted slogans like " Desh ke gaddaro ko, goli maaro saalo ko."They were allowed to remain at the site till late afternoon. Towards the evening, police began detaining a few men, loading them into buses, but some managed to force their way out, only to be rounded up again."The men had gathered here to protest against the closure of the roads and wanted to march towards the protest site. The residents said they were facing trouble because of the road closure and requested police to intervene. Fifty-two people were detained and some were later released," said Chinmoy Biswal, DCP (Southeast).The Hindu Sena had called for a protest on Sunday, however, the outfit called off the march in the morning citing "national interest". "The event has been called-off after it was brought to our notice that our earlier press release and video were circulated for the purpose of fear-mongering and to fuel riot-like situation by the anti-India elements organising and supporting the illegal Shaheen Bagh protest ," said Hindu Sena national president Vishnu Gupta.The chants of the Jamia shooter, who opened fire at a student on Thursday, were also repeated by several men. " Hum denge azadi. Afzal (Guru) wali azadi . Burhan (Wani) wali Azadi . Thok ke denge azadi (We will give you freedom. Afzal Guru's freedom, Burhan Wani's freedom," a group of some 20-odd men shouted.The crowd, while chanting slogans of Jai Shri Ram and Vande Mataram, asserted their religious identities, but maintained they were not affiliated to any political group. "I am a Hindu and have come to wake up other Hindus. In 1990, our brothers were killed and thrown out from Kashmir. Their houses were captured. The people sitting at protest also show signs that they will capture the entire city," said Dheeraj Pandey, a resident of south Delhi.Another protester, while justifying the gunman who opened fire at the protest site on Saturday, said the man was "forced" to take action because he was "angry". " Logon mein bahot aakrosh hai (People are very angry)," said Pradeep.Some women also joined the protest around noon and claimed their savings are being spent on cab fares as school buses have refused to come towards their houses. "My kids use the same route to go to school and a distance of half an hour has now turned into a three-hour journey. The school buses don't come here because of traffic. My savings are all being spent on commuting," said Rekha, a resident of Sarita Vihar.In Video: Delhi: Locals march towards Shaheen Bagh, demand removal of blockade

Title: Jamia Firing: Gunshots at Jamia Millia Islamia again, say students
Content:
Crowd gathers outside Jamia Millia Islamia after firing near gate number 5 of the university, by two unidentif... Read More

Students form human chain outside Jamia

NEW DELHI: In the third shooting incident near a site of anti-CAA protests in the capital in the past four days, two unidentified men on a scooty allegedly opened fire outside gate number 5 of the Jamia Millia Islamia late on Sunday night, according to students who raised an SOS call on several social media platforms around 11.40pm. No injuries were reported.A statement issued by the Jamia Coordination Committee (JCC), a group comprising students and alumni of the varsity, said the miscreants were on a red scooty. Police sources said they scanned the location but could not find any empty shell there.There were different versions about the vehicles — some saying said it was a motorcycle, others a scooter. “We will conduct an inquiry into the incident and appropriate action will be taken as per law,” said Kumar Gyanesh, additional DCP South East.Soon after the news of the shooting, hundreds of students gathered at the university gate, shouting slogans of Azadi and Inquilab Zindabad. “If they think this will scare us, I just want to say it won’t. We will continue our fight,” said one of the students. Several women from Shaheen Bagh also joined the protest for a night vigil.Another student Prafool, who claimed to be an eyewitness, told TOI that they were managing traffic like every day when two people on a scooty wearing helmets appeared near gate number 5. “We heard a gunshot around 11.40pm. We tried to chase them but they fled on their vehicle and we couldn’t catch them because our way was blocked by an incoming car,” he said.Jamia Nagar SHO reached the protest site soon after to pacify the students. “Give me some time and I will find out who the accused are. We have installed pickets from both sides and will carry out checking throughout the day,” he told protestors.Danish Shaikh, member of JCC, said that several students saw the assailants and “a few of them took their bikes and scooters and chased after them till the Holy Family Hospital. Police assured us that they will take action in two hours but students are unhappy about the lack of security here.”Angry locals assembled at gate number 5 and chased after a police car raising slogans against them. Many had assembled and formed a human chain near the university stadium. This while students of Jamia continued to call for peace and requested the students who were eye - witnesses to go to the police and help file a police complaintIn Video: Delhi: 2 unidentified persons open fire at anti-CAA protestors near Jamia Millia Islamia

Title: Tamil Nadu: Rifle club members held for hunting
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

The men were cooking in a hut when police chanced upon them

CHENNAI: Police arrested eight people on Sunday for hunting wilflife in a forest area close to Tiruvallur . The men are members of the Chennai Rifle Club , Egmore .

Around 2am on Sunday, a patrol team led by special sub-inspector Surendra Kumar heard noises coming from an abandoned hut at Valasai Vetti Kadu near Manavala Nagar in Tiruvallur. When the policemen ventured in, they found eight men busy cooking. They came across a cache of rifles and ammunition inside the hut. During questioning, the men told police that they were members of the rifle club and had been hunting in the area.

Surendra informed the Manavala Nagar police who arrived at the spot and arrested the men. They were identified as K Sunil Karunakaran, 39, of Kancheepuram, D Babu, 51, of Chintadripet, K Ramesh, of Chitlapakkam, K Arul Kumar, 25, of Valasai Vetti Kadu, N Silambarasan, 30, of Ayanavaram, M Boobalan, 31, of Korattur, M Gnanamurthy, 27, of Mambakkam and O P Thangaraj, 35, of Chengalpet.

Police seized four rifles, pellets, flash lights, seven knives and two cars from the men. The men had licences for the guns. Police registered a case under Arms Act for using licensed weapons to hunt animals and birds. An investigation officer said the team seized half-cooked meat from the hut. Preliminary inquiries revealed that the meat may be that of a peacock. Police have handed over the meat to forest department officials for tests. Further investigations are on.

Title: New Income Tax Slab 2020: New regime will provide relief to those unable to use tax sops: Revenue secretary
Content:
Revenue secretary Ajay Bhushan Pandey (File photo)

The new tax rules have raised several questions. Could you explain how it benefits taxpayers?

So the number of exemptions was a hurdle in simplifying the tax system?

There is a large segment of population in the 30-40 age group, earning around Rs 20 lakh to Rs 40 lakh... this person who has HRA, LTC etc would be worse off...

Could the slabs be increased in a way that a person is not worse? At present, the slab is not attractive enough.

Can more measures to reduce rates be expected?

There is a criticism that there are too many tax slabs.

What about incomes beyond Rs 15 lakh a year?

The expectation is that a no-exemption norm will be adopted totally.

Somehow, efforts to get people who have taxable incomes into the tax net have not met with much success...

There is a view that the state is not giving any support in areas like education or health if all exemptions are given up.

There is a question why long-term capital gain was not touched.

What is the experience with corporation tax cuts?

And the DDT ...

What is the rationale behind increasing the number of days for NRI status?

NEW DELHI: The new tax regime offers an option other than itemised deductions and is in line with tax systems around the world. It may not benefit everyone but allows many unable to claim all exemptions to switch to a better system, revenue secretary Ajay Bhushan Pandey tells Sidhartha , Surojit Gupta and Rajeev Deshpande . Excerpts:Companies give you consolidated salaries, asking you to choose how your salary should be distributed. A lot of people in this segment are likely to gain. Then, a businessman with a turnover of around Rs 2 crore does not have HRA or LTC or various other exemptions. On a turnover of Rs 2 crore, his taxable income is Rs 16 lakh (at a rate of 8%, which will be subject to income tax). He can’t claim all exemptions. In contrast, there might be someone who claims Rs 4.5 lakh exemptions. But there are not many people like that. Many may take only a Rs 1.5 lakh exemption. Many in the 55-60 age bracket, who own a house and do not pay a loan any more, do not get HRA and may not want to contribute to NPS. They will be gainers in the new system. The idea is that in this exemption-riddled regime there were lot of people without requisite savings to save tax, they were at a disadvantage.Read also: 'If Kuber wants to give, then you must keep doors open'The primary purpose of this exercise is to move to a simplified tax regime. And to provide some relief to people who, because of their financial situation, are not able to access all kinds of exemptions.That is correct. Such a person will stay in the old regime.There can be a situation where you make it attractive but you need to see how much revenue the government can forego. This exercise alone is going to cost Rs 40,000 crore. Ideally, we should bring down the tax rate to a level that everyone is benefited. Given fiscal constraints, this is not possible.It depends on the response and how much tax we should be collecting. What should be our tax to GDP ratio? There is also a view that exemptions should not exceed a certain ratio to income. In the old regime, it is inequitous for those who cannot take the exemptions.The number of tax slabs is a progressive model. If you have lesser or gradual tax, you do not feel the pinch. Earlier, there was 5%, 20% and 30%. Most countries in the world, China, Thailand , Malaysia , Philippines , US, Australia, have six-seven slabs. When people are moving from one tax slab to another, they should not get a shock. If the jumps are steep, there would be a tendency to under report income.Beyond Rs 15 lakh, the rates are the same but they benefit too. They pay tax on lower rate on income which is less than Rs 15 lakh.There are systems elsewhere where you take a flat deduction or take itemised deductions. There are alternatives in most countries. The situation here was we were only itemising deductions but there was no flat rate option. In a country of 130 crore people, there are only around 1.5 crore people who are actually paying taxes. Out of that, one has find how many will find it beneficial to switch to the new regime. People may have a choice from the two options which are available. A person may have some constraints that prevent him from taking exemptions. We feel this is a significant section. Could we have reduced rates even more? We have to keep the fiscal space in mind.We know this, data is being collected on property purchases, someone making gains in equity market, an expensive lifestyle, a mismatch between income declared and GST.No, state support is there for so many services. In fact, many receive services without paying any tax at all.The fundamental principle of taxation from the fairness, equity point of view, is that every element of income be taxed. If a salary is being taxed, as is business income, then why should capital gain, another form of income, not be taxed. If someone has sold a property, it is an income and should be taxed. If someone has got gains from stock market, it is also an income. The risk in stock market is no different than that in an MSME. It was introduced in 2018, and people say don’t keep changing rules. It leads to distorting the tax structure, suppose stocks are offered as part of income? Remember, investments in stocks and MFs happen on basis of solid assessments of the economy and policy environment. Our policy for a country of 130 crore cannot have a tax structure like a tax haven.It seems more than 90% will opt for the lower tax.Please see, the taxation earlier was almost 25%. The rate on debt funds was around 30%. Even someone with income less than 5 lakh would be taxed at 20-25%. Someone with higher incomes was also paying at the same rate. Then, people at lower incomes were virtually subsidising the rich. The demand of industry was to go to the classical tax system, and that is what has been done. A majority of people with lesser incomes will pay a lower dividend tax. Foreign investors will gain, dividend will be taxed in the hands of recipients and they will get credit at home.It is not a question of number of individuals, it is a matter of principle. This is an anti-abuse provision. It will not affect a person who is working in the Gulf, for example.

Title: Marine Lines station's new loo will save 4 lakh litres of water a year
Content:
The new toilet block at Marine Lines station

MUMBAI: Western Railway has set up an eco-friendly toilet with waterless urinals and mist-flow taps at Marine Lines station . WR says the move can help save 3-4 lakh litres of water every year.The toilet, on platform No. 1, is designed with wood-concept interiors, prefab cubicles and "Mangalore-style canopy". Constructed at a cost of Rs 12 lakh, it has three urinal pots, and a water closet each in the gents and ladies compounds."Ordinary urinal pots discharge around 600 ml of water at every use. A waterless urinal saves that much every time. Again, an ordinary washbasin tap discharges 8-10 litres per minute, whereas a mist-flow tap uses only 300-400 ml per minute, but with the same effectiveness," said WR's chief public relations officer Ravinder Bhakar. The toilet will be pay-and-use, with Rs 2 for urninal use and Rs 5 for toilet use.How does a water-less urinal work? Bhakar said it has a ceramic bowl with "anionic, hydrophobic and anti-bacterial surface", which keeps it clean. "It has a cartridge made of high-grade plastic and has an anti-bacterial trap assembly. The key component of the cartridge is a silicon trap," he said. "Gravity makes urine drain into the trap, which closes after use and stops the emanation of odour."WR plans to extend the concept to its other stations based on feedback from its commercial department and users.

Title: Telangana: Locals pray as leopard preys on cattle for one year
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Leopard caught in a camera trap

Title: Kolkata: Monday acid test for cops before Lockgate flyover tidal traffic call
Content:
Demolition work in progress in the city

KOLKATA: The city police is planning tidal movement of traffic along the Chitpore Lockgate flyover to serve the peakhour Tallah traffic if the oneway (north-bound) plan fails on Monday.On Sunday, only north-bound traffic was allowed on the flyover.Since majority of commuters (office- or school-bound) travels from north (Sinthee) to south (Shyambazar and further south to Dalhousie) during the morning peaks hours, the plan is to turn traffic on Chitpore flyover from north to south from 6am to 1pm and from south to north between 1pm and 10pm to serve the home-bound traffic.Police officers on Monday will also meet the engineers of Hooghly River Bridge Commissioners (HRBC), the custodian of Lockgate flyover, to gauge whether both-way traffic can be run along the two-lane flyover. Traffic police said that buses are now using the 1.2km flyover connecting Bagbazar in south and Chiria More in north.Traffic police officers said there was heavy rush of southbound traffic along the Chiria More-Dum Dum Road-Northern Avenue-Belgachhia Road-R G Kar Road even on Sunday. Till noon, the route was chock-a-block on the first day after the closure of Tallah Bridge. A good number of commuters was moving along Tallah Bridge in light vehicles and autos.If there is complete collapse of traffic on Monday, we have to think of Plan B and Plan C.Meanwhile, keeping in mind the chaos after the collapse of Majerhat bridge, Kolkata Police is deploying a huge force in the area. The joint commissioner, traffic, Santosh Pandey, and deputy commissioner, Rupesh Kumar, will be monitoring the overall management. Fifteen traffic sergeants have been brought in from various other departments. Seventy additional police personnel and four inspectors, with prior knowledge of managing traffic in this region, will also be posted.Besides, 100 additional police personnel will be deployed to look after law and order situation. Kolkata Police has already notified to do away with on-road parking all along the alternative routes. Special vans will be used to tow away parked vehicles. “We have to ensure faster dispersal of peak-hour traffic. This is why we are trying to keep all the roads free from obstacles,” said an officer.

Title: Centre likely to retain sovereign guarantee for LIC
Content:
(File photo)

NEW DELHI: The government is likely to retain the sovereign guarantee to Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) and protect interests of policyholders as it seeks to list the insurance behemoth with the aim of improving disclosures, unlocking massive value and sharing wealth with investors, a top official said.Department of investment and public asset management secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey told TOI that fears of policyholders being adversely impacted were unfounded. “The regulator (IRDA) is there. It’s a very important company and everything will be taken care of. While the issue has been discussed for long, a political call has been taken this time,” he said.Finance secretary Rajeev Kumar said the Centre intends to retain the sovereign guarantee for LIC, while also leaving the transfer of surplus to policyholder funds for dividends, unchanged at 5%, instead of 10% for other insurance companies. The government will soon move a bill to amend the LIC Act, seeking to allow a public issue of shares, which could be in the range of 5-10%.Pandey said the FM would analyse data linked to LIC and then prepare a roadmap for the listing. He said LIC was a very large institution and any IPO would be of a big size but did not elaborate on its likely proportions. He also did not give a timeline for the listing but other officials said it could take up to a year for the process to go through.The DIPAM secretary said the department’s focus would be on stepping up strategic sales in the next fiscal year. On Air India, he said, “What we want is an airline which will actually grow. Our intention is to have the flag of AI high.” However, he added that the airline business needed nimble managements and several efforts to revive AI had failed.“They are in different stages but in BPCL we are fairly at an advanced stage of coming with an expression of interest. There will be a global invitation of interest soon. We really hope that in the first half of next year, we will conclude many transactions,” Pandey said when asked about the status of strategic stake sale in oil major BPCL, logistics firm Concor, Shipping Corporation of India and national carrier Air India.Pandey said the government had done a fair job in terms of the principle for allocation of debt in sale of AI. “Debt was one of the big issues due to accumulated losses of many years. Any investor who would pick it up has to be sustainable,” he said. Pandey said the airline business was nimble. “It’s no longer that you have a fat margin. It’s no longer a Maharaja business. It’s a business where you have to work hard. Wherever you can save. Maximise revenue.”

Title: Cops unite lost four-year-old with parents at Kolkata book fair
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Four-year-old Shreesha Dey (also inset) with her parents at the book fair

KOLKATA: A four-year-old speech-impaired girl, who had come to Kolkata book fair in Salt Lake with her parents and gone missing on Saturday evening, was tracked down by the cops in half an hour after they shared the missing child's photograph on a cop WhatsApp group. The officers posted at the ground looked for the kid in a "white sweater and pink bunny woollen cap".

Parents of the child - Shreesha Dey - had come running to the office of Publishers and Booksellers Guild around 6.30pm frantically as they sought help from the officials, saying their only child had gone missing.

The parents said they were flipping through some books at a stall when they suddenly realised that their daughter was not by their side and immediately raised an alarm.

"The parents had looked around the nearby book stalls and after failing to locate their child, they approached the authorities for help. The mother was crying and didn't know what to do. We immediately began announcing about the missing child with her description and asked anyone who could spot her to bring her to our office. We also asked the cops to start a search opeartion," said a senior official of the guild.

As the parents, residents of Rajarhat, approached the cops, they asked the couple to calm down and asked for a photograph of the child. The parents shared a photograph of the child on WhatsApp to the officer-in-charge of the control room at the book fair and he immediately shared the photograph on a WhatsApp group that had all police personnel posted at the book fair as members.

"Within moments, all policemen at the book fair had the photograph and details of the girl. Everyone was asked to start searching for the girl on a priority basis and within 35 minutes we were able to track down the child, who was standing at a corner, sobbing. She looked jittery among the crowd near the food stalls," said an official of Bidhannagar Commissionerate.

A constable, who had spotted the girl, reported the senior officers that she looked somewhat different from the one in the photograph but was not speaking a word. He took a photograph of the child and shared it on the group. When the parents were shown the photograph, they identified the child, following which the constable brought her to the police control room and handed her over to her parents.

Title: Pension scheme may see mandatory enrolments
Content:
Finance secretary Rajeev Kumar (File photo: Rajeev Kumar/Twitter)

NEW DELHI: The government is looking at mandatory enrolment of workers in the pension scheme when they join the organised sector workforce, while giving them the flexibility to decide their contribution , as part of fresh efforts to provide a robust social security net for millions of workers, a top government official said.“There will be a system of auto enrolment and an employee can contribute Rs 100 while the employer can also contribute. People who are young today need to save for tomorrow,” finance secretary Rajeev Kumar said. In the Union Budget , the government has announced the plan, which will provide for inter-operability of schemes and provide safeguards for the accumulated corpus.Currently, pension plans are sold by insurance companies, mutual funds as well as companies that operate under the National Pension System regulated by the Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority of India. In addition, the Employees Provident Fund Organisation provides Employees Pension Scheme by transferring a part of the employee’s and employer’s contribution in addition to the Employees State Insurance Corporation .The finance secretary said that the idea was to bring them all under one umbrella so that subscribers did not lose their money in case they switched jobs. Besides, the government views pension sector as a potential source of large fund flow that will also encourage long-term investors to pump money into infrastructure and other sectors.The pension regulatory agency was set up over a decade ago to implement the NPS and provide low cost solutions for retirement savings. But despite tax benefits, the scheme has not taken off although the kitty has expanded to around Rs 4.2 lakh crore.Kumar said the government has taken a series of steps in the Budget to ensure that the cost of financial intermediation comes down through measures such as the proposed bill for netting of financial transactions.There are several steps to enhance liquidity in the system by introducing new tools and strengthening the existing ones.

Title: BMC may not increase budget size, but spend more on infrastructure
Content:
BMC is expected to spend more on big-ticket infrastructure projects, including the Rs 12,000-crore Mumbai Coas... Read More

MUMBAI: The BMC is expected to spend more on big-ticket infrastructure projects, including the Rs 12,000-crore Mumbai Coastal Road and the Rs 4,700-crore Goregaon-Mulund Link Road (GMLR), compared to last year. Missing road links, including the elevated road from Cuffe Parade to Nariman Point, may also receive sizeable allocation with CM Uddhav Thackeray recently having stressed on the need for the same to reduce traffic congestion. Municipal commissioner Praveen Pardeshi will present his first budget on Tuesday.With no rise in income from revenue sources like property tax, no large increase in the budget size can be expected the upcoming financial year.The Rs 30,692-crore BMC budget 2019-20 had made a provision of Rs 1,600 crore for the coastal road project, which had started in December 2018. The 9.98km coastal road will link Marine Drive to the south-end of Bandra-Worli Sea Link. Also, with significant works on GMLR expected to start from this year, a large allocation may be made for the 12.2km eastwest connector. Sources said missing road links, like the Cuffe Parade-Nariman Point elevated road, may also receive an allocation, along with two road over-bridges at Mahalaxmi worth Rs 745 crore—one will connect Dr E Moses Road to Jacob Circle, while a cablestayed bridge will be between Mahalaxmi Racecourse and Jacob Circle. The elevated road and the ROBs will help motorists connect to the proposed coastal road.BMC Budget 2020-21 is also likely to emphasize on involving corporates in improving the city’s aesthetics and cleanliness quotient. A pilot project was recently carried out in GSouth ward, which covers Worli, Mahalaxmi and Lower Parel.
