Title: Uttar Pradesh: Cow sanctuary to produce bio fertilizer, boost organic farming
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

UP’s first Go-Abhyaranya will be set up near the Adwa dam (File photo)

VARANASI: The first Go-Abhyaranya ( cow sanctuary ) of the state, coming up on 27 bigha land surrounded by river, forest and hills in Halia region of Mirzapur district , will produce bio fertilizer. The bio fertilizer will give an impetus to the Yogi Adityanath government's bid of promoting organic farming in the state besides bringing in funds to meet its recurring expenditure.

Talking to TOI on Sunday, Mirzapur district magistrate Sushil Kumar Patel said, "We are bringing up the Go-Abhyaranya on 27 bigha land demarcated for the project in Ajaria village of Halia block. It will accommodate 5,000 cattle."

"The location of the proposed Go-Abhyaranya is ideal for keeping the cattle abandoned by their owners. The 27 bigha land has Adwa river and a barrage, which remains full of water round the year, on one side while there are forest and hills on other two sides. It will be a low-cost project as no major construction is required for it," the DM added.

"Only construction of boundary and some shades will be needed. We will also undertake massive forestation for proper shade and green cover in the Go-Abhyaranya. The total cost would be estimated with the completion of detailed project report," said Patel.

In initial stage, the government will assist the Go-Abhyaranya in arranging fodder for which the stubble being burnt by farmers would be purchased. Farmers will stop burning stubble which increases air pollution, the officer said.

The state government is already promoting organic farming for which bio-fertilizers will be required on large scale, especially in areas on the banks of the Ganga. This Go-Abhyaranya will emerge as a major producer of bio-fertilizers, which will help in generating revenue to meet its expanses in future, the DM said. There are also plans to keep cows of different breeds in the Go-Abhyaranya.

CM Yogi Adityanath had laid the foundation of the proposed Go-Abhyaranya in Mirzapur on January 29.

Title: Chandigarh: C&D waste plant to run in two shifts to churn more
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

The plant operates from 8am to 5pm at the moment

CHANDIGARH: The Chandigarh municipal corporation is all set to run city’s only construction and demolition (C&D) waste plant in two shifts for its optimum utilisation. A decision to this effect has been taken as the civic body expects more C&D waste from Daddumajra dumping site, since legacy waste mining has started disposing of around 5,000 ton of garbage.

Currently, the plant operates from 8am to 5pm, but after the double shift begins, it will run again from 5pm to 11pm.

“We have planned second shift for six months initially to assess the overall functioning of the machines in two shifts. Further decision will be taken after that. It will cost around Rs 38 lakh. As per plan, we need seven employees, lighting arrangement, additional JCB machines, trucks, vehicles and other related infrastructure. Comprehensive details have been worked out in this regard,” said a municipal corporation official.

“The Pune-based private company, which has taken up the work to remove legacy mining from Daddumajra dumping site, will transport C&D waste from Daddumajra to the plant, situated in Industrial Area, Phase II. Therefore, Chandigarh municipal corporation will not bear absolutely no expense on transportation of the waste,” he added.

As per the records of MC engineering department of the, currently the plant is processing around 115-120 metric tons of construction and demolition waste every day in the plant and it is expected to get double the quantity after they start getting waste from Daddumajra site.

“We are expecting to get 225-250 metric ton of C&D waste after the material is transported from legacy mining. Since the quantity of the dump is huge at Daddumajra, we will keep getting the raw material from there to process for longer period,” he said.

After processing the C&D waste, the machines produce recycle aggregates like stones and gravel, and mixes all types of debris to finally throw up concrete and concrete-related materials. Further, from concrete they make tiles, curb channels and paver blocks to be used in works done by the municipal corporation. Besides, the raw material also provides silt, which also gets utilised in filling work in the construction of buildings.

Title: UT offers flats to Punjab legislators at IT Park
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

The UT administration has planned eight residential towers in IT Park

CHANDIGARH: The Chandigarh administration is offering luxurious flats to MLAs from Punjab at the IT Park. The move come following a letter of the Punjab chief minister, who wanted flats for his MLAs in the city.

Since there is no other space left, the UT officer flats at the IT Park have been offered, where residential towers are coming up for the Punjab and Haryana governments and the Chandigarh administration. In all, four towers, with 28 flats in each, has been offered to the MLAs. The PGI has also sent its demand to construct two towers.

After the Punjab and Haryana governments demanded two and three towers, respectively, the UT has given them option for two more towers. Each tower has 28 flats, each flat costing Rs 2 crore, and the UT plans to construct total eight towers.

"We have to construct eight towers, having 28 flats in each tower, at the IT Park for different government bodies. The Haryana government has already demanded three towers, while Punjab has asked for two. Moreover, four towers have been planned for the MLAs and offer has been given to them. There are also chances that both Punjab and Haryana governments may ask for more towers, and at least one tower will be there for the Chandigarh administration," a senior officer of the Chandigarh administration said.

"The cost of each flat will be approximately Rs 2 crore, and every flat will have four rooms and one servant room. This is first of its kind location, where such number of luxurious towers are coming, so every government organisation is showing interest to buy flats in Chandigarh," he added.

Following the demand, now the Chandigarh Housing Board (CHB) has floated a tender to hire a private consultant to prepare the design and drawings of the project, which will be then approved by the Chandigarh administration, and based on that the project will come up. The Chandigarh administration has acquired around 123 acre of land in the IT Park, and besides the said two residential complexes for officers and general public in different plots or chunks of lands, the area has been kept for hospital sites, a five-star hotel and other projects, as the demand arises.

Title: Medical college, skill development centre in Chandauli soon: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Yogi Adityanath

VARANASI: Chief minister Yogi Adityanath launched the state-wide weekly Arogya Mela, at primary health centre in Amdah village of Naxal-affected hilly region Naugarh in Chandauli district on Sunday. The CM also announced that Chandauli district will get a medical college soon besides opening industrial training institute (ITI), skill development training institute and hostels for boys and girls in Naugarh soon.

The Arogya Mela will be held at 4,200 primary health centres across the state every Sunday. "Arogya Mela is a major step under Mukhyamantri Jan Arogya Yojana to provide best possible treatment to each and every citizen of the state. People attending the camp will be examined by doctors and given medicines free of cost. It is a measure to ensure availability of healthcare to the poor and those living in remotest zones," Yogi said. The CM also announced that Chandauli district will get a medical college soon.

Later, addressing the silver jubilee celebrations of Maharshi Valmiki Seva Sansthan in Devkhat village, Yogi said an industrial training institute (ITI) and skill development training institute will also be opened in Naugarh region soon. Yogi unveiled the statue of Maharshi Valmiki and recalled the epic Ramayana authored by him.

Title: Rs 10,000 crore shot for SC, ST welfare schemes in Gujarat
Content:
Representative image

GANDHINAGAR: While movements and counter-movements have risen over scheduled caste and scheduled tribe reservations , the Gujarat government is set to enact a legislation by which sub-plan expenditure of government funds on scheduled castes (SCs) and scheduled tribes (STs) will have to be based on their their share in the population. Thus an estimated Rs 10,000 crore will be available for welfare SCs and STs, if such legislation is implemented.For several years, it has been observed that funds meant for the welfare of SCs and STs have been diverted to other departments. The move for the new legislation has great political significance, given reservations issue.According to a constitutional mandate, every state and the Union government must make its minimum allocation of funds for SCs and STs in proportion to their population in that respective state.Governments can allocate greater budgetary spending but cannot spend less than the proportion of SCs/STs in the general population on schemes for their welfare.The central policy think-tank Niti Aayog also directed states to follow this constitutional provision in budget allocation.However, the Gujarat government, has not been following this and has been allocating smaller budgets under the SC/ST sub plans, a clear violation of constitutional provisions.According to the 2011 census, the SCs make up 7.09% and STs 14.75% of the state's population. For many years straight, the Gujarat government has been allocating smaller budgets than mandatory for SC/ST welfare. The maximum allocation made by the state government so far under the SC sub-plan has been 4.98%, while the maximum allocation made so far under any ST sub-plan has been 13.7% of the total budgetary allocation.A top government official confirmed that the state government plans to introduce legislation to ensure that budget allocation under the SC/ST sub plans are in proportion to their population. "With this decision, spending on the welfare of SCs/STs will grow substantially. Around Rs 10,000 crore will directly go to these communities if such legislation comes into force," the official said.The official admitted that as of now, apart from the tribal development and social justice and empowerment departments, other departments spend paltry amounts of their allocation on the welfare of members of SCs and STs. Also, funds of the social justice and tribal development departments are also being used for activities other than welfare of members of these deprived sections. "If funds are strictly spent according to SC/ST sub-plans, it will benefit these sections more efficiently," the official said.Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh and Telangana have enacted special laws to ensure proper SC/ST sub-plan expenditure.

Title: Mumbai: Cabbie and aide rob passengers, land behind bars
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative image

MUMBAI: A taxi driver and his associate were arrested on Friday for allegedly robbing passengers. Police said Fakira Thakur (45) would pick up passengers from Dadar station at night and stop at an isolated spot where his accomplice, Ganesh Swami (39), would get into the cab. They would lock the passengers in the taxi and rob them.

On January 23, they had robbed businessman Prakash Purohit of Rs 6,000. Based on his complaint, cops traced the cab near Sion circle, and recovered Rs 3,800 from the duo. Police said the doors had been disconnected from the central-locking system so that passengers would not get out.

Title: Lucknow: BSP MLA booked for harassing 25-year-old woman

This story is from February 3, 2020

Title: Surat PI, PSI suspended for negligence
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative image

SURAT: A police inspector and a police sub-inspector were suspended by director general of police Shivanand Jha soon after a raid by state monitoring cell (SMC) on a liquor den operating under the limits of Adajan police station here on Saturday.

It was found during the raid by SMC, which functions under direct supervision of DGP office, that the liquor den has been operating for the past many months without any action by the police station. Police inspector S M Chaudhary and police sub-inspector R K Kabariya were suspended soon after the raid for negligence . Kabariya was in-charge of detection staff of police station.

SMC raided the liquor den on Palanpur Canal Road and seized liquor worth Rs1.73 lakh. Rajesh Rathod and Rushabh Shahni were arrested from the spot. Police seized 942 bottles of IMFL during the raid.

Title: Streatham attacker Sudesh Amman has family in Sri Lanka and was under police surveillance
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

LONDON: A knife-wielding terrorist who was shot dead by police in London on Sunday during a crazed stabbing spree has been named by police as Sudesh Mamoor Faraz Amman , a convicted Islamist terrorist who has extended family in Sri Lanka .

The 20-year-old ISIS and al-Qaeda supporter stabbed two people in south London in broad daylight on a busy high street just before 2 pm in what Metropolitan police quickly declared as an “Islamist-related terrorist incident”.

Amman was jailed in December 2018 aged 18 for Islamist-related terrorist offences at the Old Bailey but was released from prison early just days ago. He is thought to have been living in a South London bail hostel when he carried out the attack.

Wearing a fake explosive vest, he stole a £3.99 10-inch kitchen knife from a convenience store and stabbed two people in Streatham High Road, leaving one man, in his 40s, in a life-threatening condition. Plainclothes police officers who had been following him on foot, shot him dead outside Boots pharmacy with handguns, in scenes reminiscent of an action movie, before hordes of armed police arrived.

Next specialist explosives officers and additional armed officers were called in to deal with the device around his body which was found to be a hoax suicide vest.

Deputy Assistant Commissioner Lucy D'Orsi said “The suspect has not yet been formally identified, however, given the circumstance of the incident, we are confident that he was Sudesh Amman, aged 20. Armed officers, who were part of a proactive counter-terrorism surveillance operation and were following the suspect on foot, were in immediate attendance and shot a male suspect dead at the scene. The suspect had been recently released from prison where he had been serving a sentence for Islamist-related terrorism offences.”

Witnesses also spoke of a police car crashing nearby in the rush to get to the scene.

In December 2018 Amman, then an 18-year-old student at North West London College, living in Harrow, had pleaded guilty to 13 counts of possessing and distributing terrorist documents via Skype and was jailed for three years and four months. He had been arrested in May 2018 by armed police.

The Old Bailey heard that he had tried to radicalise his own family, by sharing Al-Qaeda propaganda in a family WhatsApp group, and sharing bomb-making manuals on Skype, exposing his five younger brothers aged 11 to 15, and extended family in Sri Lanka to jihadist material.

After his arrest, police found bomb-making and knife-fighting manuals on his digital devices, as well as ISIS videos depicting graphic violence.

In online messages, he pledged allegiance to Islamic State, said "the Islamic State is here to stay", and said he considered ISIS to “be the best thing to happen to Islam”.

He also spoke about Muslims in London “being massacred” and “put in conditions worse than concentration camps”, and said, “the Quran gave permission to rape Yazidi women”.

In a raid of his home, where he lived with his mother and brothers, police officers found a black flag, a combat knife, and an air gun.

The court heard he had sent beheadings videos to his girlfriend and advised her to kill her "Kafir" (“non-believer”) parents and that he had fantasised about carrying out terror attacks with knives and acid.

The then head of the Met Police counter-terrorism command Acting Commander Alexis Boon said at the time of his conviction: “His fascination with death in the name of terrorism was clear in a notepad we recovered from his home. Amman had scrawled his ‘life goals’ in the notepad and top of the list, above family activities, was dying a martyr and going to ‘Jannah’ - the afterlife.”

The two victims of Sunday’s attack, a man in his 40s and a woman in her 50s, were rushed to South London hospitals. The man, who witnesses said was stabbed in his stomach, was initially in a life-threatening condition. However, by late Sunday night, D'Orsi said “we are thankful that following his treatment at the hospital, this is no longer the case. “

A woman in her 50s, who witnesses said was stabbed in the back, had non-life threatening injuries and has now been discharged from hospital. Another woman in her 20s has minor injuries - believed to have been caused by glass shattering following the discharge of the police firearm. She continues to receive treatment at the hospital.

Title: Currency notes showered on folk singer in Gujarat's Navsari
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Folk singer Geeta Rabari performing on Saturday night

SURAT: Many among the large audience gathered for 'bhajan sandhya' programme organized by a local temple trust showered currency notes, including dollars, on folk singer Geeta Rabari on Saturday night. The event was organized at Vanzana village of Chikhli taluka of Navsari district.

Raj Rajeswari Meldi Mata Seva Trust had organized the 'bhajan sandhya'. Many people, including non-resident Indians, showered currency notes on the singer. About Rs8 lakh was collected at the event, organizers said, adding that currency notes showered were of Rs10, Rs50, Rs100, Rs500 and Rs2,000 denominations.

Vijay Bapu, trust president and temple's mahant, said, "Nearly 100 dollars were also showered by some NRI devotees of the goddess. We will use this money on the education of children, running a food centre and marrying of tribal girls. It is a tradition in many parts of Gujarat to shower currency notes on singers."

Another such programme will be organized by Saurashtra Leuva Patel Samaj Trust-run Sardar Patel Hospital on Jalalpore Road in Navsari on February 5.

Programme organizer Ashok Gajera said, "Geeta Rabari will sing at this lok dayra. The event is being held to raise funds for the hospital."

Title: Exclusive! Saif Ali Khan on Sara and Kartik Aaryan’s chemistry in ‘Love Aaj Kal’: It is very interesting; people are going to flock to see the movie
Content: After impressing the audience with his stellar performance in 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' as Udaybhan Singh Rathore, Saif Ali Khan is all set to step into the shoes of another negative character. The talented actor will be going face-to-face with Prabhas in Om Raut's upcoming film 'Adipurush'.Saif, who started his career with 'Parampara' in 1993 has gone on to deliver several blockbusters on the silver screen. The versatile actor, who is known for taking up challenging and entertaining roles, has always managed to do justice to his characters. While the news of Saif stepping in as Lankesh in Adipurush' has got fans excited, we take a look at the dark and negative characters which the skilled actor has essayed on the silver screen.

Title: Lucknow: Longest cold spell in 10 years, respite expected this week
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

According to weather experts, icy winds with high chill factor were responsible for cold in January

LUCKNOW: As icy winds show no signs of relenting, the city is witnessing the longest spell of cold with high wind chill factor of winter season, at least in last 10 years.

No relief is likely till Tuesday as weathermen predicted that northwesterly winds coming from snow-fed mountains of Himachal Pradesh will continue to blow in the city.

State Met director JP Gupta said, "Temperatures may rise by a couple of degrees and cold conditions may abate from Wednesday when moist and comparatively warm easterly winds from Bay of Bengal are expected to replace northwesterlies."

According to weather experts, icy winds with high chill factor were responsible for cold in January which also continues in February which usually witnesses pleasant condition with moderate temperature.

Heavy rain in the city in January and moderate to heavy snowfall at regular intervals in the hills, particularly in Himachal Pradesh, are the main reasons behind chill in the wind. Five strong western disturbances that hit the Himalayas in quick successions in January are responsible for high precipitation and snowfall. Normally, January witnesses 2-3 western disturbances. The northwesterly winds brought chill generated after snowfall in the hills to the plains, including Lucknow, which was already reeling under intense cold because of rain. This kept temperature below normal for the better part of January and made people shiver despite bright sunshine during the day.

Normally, intense cold with high wind chill lasts for 10-15 days in January but this year it continues for 40 days with a couple of breaks of 2-3 days.

Title: Bihar: 2 Sitamarhi women running from pillar to post for justice
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Two sisters - Vandana and Jiya - have sought CM Nitish Kumar's intervention to seek justice for the killing of... Read More

PATNA: It came as a rude shock for two young women from Sitamarhi when an IPS officer told them that giving assurances to close relatives of victims of crime is a police 'jumla' (idiom). Fed up with the senior cop's remark, the two sisters - Vandana and Jiya - have sought CM Nitish Kumar's intervention to seek justice for the killing of their father Ashok Kumar.

Ashok, a former mukhiya, was gunned down on Partapur Road under Parsauni police station in Sitamarhi district during a morning walk on October 6, 2019. Two of the six accused - Md Gaffar Nadaf and Md Hasim - of Gisiara were arrested on October 8 with the help of some local residents. However, the main accused, Randhir Singh, is still at large.

When the two sisters reminded Sitamarhi SP Anil Kumar of the promises made by him to arrest the culprits within 24 hours, the latter reportedly told them, "Woh to police 'jumla' tha." Vandana, an MBA, and her younger sister, Jiya, who is pursuing postgraduation , were taken aback. Their repeated pleas to the SP to instruct the investigating office to arrest the main culprit at the earliest went in vain.

A visibly upset Vandana said, "The moment we heard these words from a senior police officer, we lost our hope of getting justice. We then decided to meet DGP Gupteshwar Pandey and additional chief secretary (home) Amir Subhani. We came to Patna in the hope of getting justice."

On January 27, the two sisters met the DGP and narrated their ordeal. According to them, the DGP talked to the Sitamarhi SP over phone and inquired about the murder case. After a pause, the state police chief reportedly told the girls, "I can't do anything." The 'helplessness' of the DGP in ensuring the arrest of the main culprit left the girls shattered.

Sitamarhi SP Anil Kumar said the proclamation notice has already been issued against the remaining accused and the chargesheet submitted against two arrested persons. "Raids are on to nab the remaining accused and security has been provided to the two sisters," he said on Sunday. When asked about the girls' 'jumla' allegation, the SP said: "No comment."

"We have sought an appointment with chief minister Nitish Kumar," the two sisters told this newspaper. Earlier, Vandana had sent her application through an email on December 9, 2019 seeking CM's intervention. They had also sent letters to President Ram Nath Kovind and Prime Minister Narendra Modi on November 9 last year.

Their ordeal didn't stop here. They are being sent lewd messages on their cellphones. "The local police didn't take notice of our complaints. The situation has come to such a passe that the accused is threatening us and other members of the family. He is roaming free in the village. The police, on the other hand, say he is absconding," they lamented.

On January 21, the Patna high court rejected the anticipatory bail application of Randhir, a resident of Belahi under Runnisaidpur police station in Sitamarhi district.

The condition of the slain ex-mukhiya's wife, Ram Kumari Devi , has worsened. Apparently peeved at police's reluctance, she said, "It seems the police officials are waiting for something to happen. We are at our wit's end what to do now and whom to approach for justice."

Title: Kerala's groundwater gets a rain boost
Content:
Groundwater levels in the state have been fluctuating for the last two years, with intense yet erratic rainfal... Read More

KOCHI: Groundwater levels in the state have been fluctuating for the last two years, with intense yet erratic rainfall recharging the water table. For the second consecutive year, groundwater levels rose by as much as 4 metres in some districts, according to data collated by the central ground water board (CGWB).According to the CGWB’s November 2019 report on groundwater levels submitted to the state government, nearly 80% of the annually monitored wells have seen a rise in water levels. Of the total 1,388 monitored wells, 1,333 registered a rise while 52 recorded a fall. A spike of more than 4 metres was reported in isolated pockets of Kasaragod , Kollam, Alappuzha, Malappuram, Palakkad, Thrissur and Pathanamthitta districts while a decline of the same measure was noted in a few locations in Kannur, Malappuram, Thiruvananthapuram and Wayanad.CGWB officials said the comparison of data between the water levels of November 2018 and 2019 showed a rise in the order of 0.01 to 10.79 metres below ground level (mbgl) with a fall in the order of 0.01 to 8.94 mbgl. Among the monitored wells, 79.69% registered a rise, while 19.08% posted a fall.Experts says that more than 60% of the wells dug in the state are not being used or even properly maintained.“With the arrival of piped water, most people just abandoned their wells; which soon got contaminated because of the lack of cleaning activity. The well ecosystem is a robust one. Ideally, these can be revived through what is called point recharging. All one must do is orient or direct the rainwater into them. In one’s own backyard, you can construct small stone bunds or vegetative embarkments to direct the water into the well. The water is saved through the efficiency of infiltration. Even a minor slope of just one centimetre can direct the water elsewhere,” said Sunny George, director, SCMS water institute.The shallow water level was seen in the range of 0-2 mbgl in Alappuzha, the coastal tracts of Ernakulam, Kollam, Thrissur and Kozhikode districts, as well as in the valleys of eastern Idukki, Palakkad, Wayanad and Kozhikode districts. The water level in the midlands ranged from 2-10 mbgl. Interestingly, a water level of more than 20 mbgl was noted in patches in Thiruvananthapuram, Palakkad and Kasaragod districts.A comparison of water levels post monsoon in November 2019 with that of pre monsoon in April 2019 indicated a rise in the range of 0-14.10 metres in most parts of the state, whereas fall in water level was noticed in certain small isolated pockets mainly in Ernakulam, Thrissur, Kottayam, Pathanamthitta and Alappuzha districts. A fall in the water level, in the range of 0-4 metres, was noticed in isolated patches in Alappuzha and Ernakulam, Kannur, Malappuram and Thrissur districts.“There’s a concept of sanitized wells. We need to take an inventory of wells in each local body and sanitize them. We have 46 lakh wells in Kerala , one of the highest in the world. It is like 200 wells per square kilometre, which is something we have completely ignored. These wells can be sanitized and used as recharge points,” George said.

Title: 10 Delhi tourists allege cheating in SoU tickets
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative image

VADODARA: Kevadia police has booked a travel agent for overcharging entry tickets to Statue of Unity. The SoU ticket coordinator noticed the entry ticket during barcode scanning and realized that the charge mentioned on it is more than the regular one.

According to the police, Ehsaan Saiyad got 10 express tickets at the entry of SoU on Sunday. He noticed that the tickets had Rs 1,260 written on them as entry fees whereas the actual entry fee is Rs 1,030 per person. The matter was reported to the cops who asked the tourists about the source of tickets. The tourists said that they had booked it from an agent based in Ahmedabad. During investigations, it came to light that the agent had tampered with the pdf format of the ticket and increased the prices to dupe the tourists. The accused duped them of Rs 2,300. In May 2019, a similar racket was busted when a Mumbai agency overcharged tickets of SoU.

Title: Kochi: Body of pre-term baby found in canal
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Forensic team examines the bucket in which the body was found

KOCHI: The body of a premature baby was found inside a bucket that was floating in Perandoor Canal at Elamakkara in Kochi on Sunday evening.

The bucket was spotted by children playing near the canal on Makkaparambu Theeradesha Road . Elamakkara police said the baby was premature and appeared to have a growth of four months. Police said it was suspected to be either a still born or aborted baby, and someone might have dumped it in bucket and let it float in the canal to get rid of it.

According to police, the body was not decomposed which showed that it was abandoned in the last 24 hours (from Sunday evening). The umbilical cord was also found attached to the body and the bucket had water-like fluid inside it. Sources said a tag was also found inside the bucket which reportedly showed the date 31-01-2020. "Also, on the tag it was written 'daughter of Sandhya'. It is not clear whether the tag belonged to any hospital or not. Police has collected the tag and started the probe," said the source.

Though the bucket was seen floating in the area since afternoon, no one gave attention to it as similar objects were often seen in the canal. But later the water currents brought it to one edge of the canal. When the children saw it, they mistook the body for a doll and picked the bucket. But when they realised it was a body, they called elders in the area and they alerted police.

The body is being shifted to mortuary of Ernakulam General Hospital after completing the inquest formalities. "The police registered a case of unnatural death under section CrPC 174 and launched a probe to identify the parents. Information has been passed to all hospitals to check the details of any delivery," said a police officer.

Title: History-sheeter nabbed with ganja worth Rs 75 lakh in Gujarat
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

The contraband was found stored in a warehouse rented by history-sheeter Damru Pradhan in Surat

SURAT: Special operations group (SOG) of Surat rural police seized around 750kg ganja worth Rs 75 lakh from Kudsad village under the limits of Kim police station on Sunday. In another raid, police seized 18kg ganja from Atodara village.

Police arrested history-sheeter Damru Pradhan from whose possession 750kg ganja was found stored in a warehouse rented by him in GIDC area of Kudsad. The cops recovered the contraband from the closed shop on the basis of specific information. Police are trying to identify all the racketeers.

Police raided a room in Atodara from where 18kg ganja was seized. During the raid, they received information about the ganja stored in Kudsad. A team of SOG and local crime branch (LCB) raided the warehouse and recovered the ganja stacked in plastic bags.

Police investigation revealed that the ganja used to be distributed from the warehouse to retail suppliers who sold it to people in different parts of district and city. Police are inquiring about the ownership of the warehouse which was being used for the past few week. Cops are investigating if the accused supplied ganja from Kudsad to other places in state. The ganja had been brought from Odisha and stored at one place to distribute it in small quantities to consumers/buyers in other parts of Surat.

"Pradhan was arrested in the past for his involvement in Ganja trade. We are trying to identify other accused involved in the racket," said a police officer of rural police.

Police had recovered 967kg ganja worth Rs1 crore from a farm under the limits of Kamrej police station in November 2019.

A room for labourers had been used to store the ganja. The contraband was being supplied to different parts of state from there.

Title: Unemployed teen arrested posing as cop
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative image

VADODARA: An unemployed teenager from Ahmedabad was arrested near Sayajigunj police station on Saturday midnight for posing as a crime branch cop and possessing an air gun, bullets and pellets.

Police said Yash Joshi, 19, was roaming around Dairy Den Circle flaunting his air gun to the eateries stall owners saying that he is from crime branch. He also had arguments with a couple of them after which some of them alerted Sayajigunj police.

On Saturday midnight, a constable noticed Joshi arguing with a security guard at the city bus stand near the police station. Cops in civil clothes approached Joshi who identified himself as crime branch sleuth. When Joshi tried to be arrogant with the cops, cops disclosed their identity and seized his gun.

They found 15 air gun bullets and 25 pellets from his scooter's glove's box. Joshi told cops that liked to roam in public and flaunt that he is a cop. He had lost his job in in restaurant.

Title: Unemployed man hangs self in Para
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative image

LUCKNOW: Depressed over failure to find a job, a 22-year-old man hanged himself at his house in Para , police said.

The deceased, Somil Srivastava, was looking for a job for last one year.

SHO, Para, Triloki Singh said Somil’s parents went to attend a marriage function on Saturday leaving their son at home. When they returned on Sunday, they found Somil hanging from the ceiling fan.

“We reached the spot and sent the body for post-mortem examination,” he said. If the autopsy report shows any foul play, a case will be registered and investigation will be initiated,” he said.

When TOI tried to reach out Somil’s father, Suresh Srivastava, who works in a gas agency, he refused to comment on the matter.

Title: Police set to adopt Uttar Pradesh hostage-taker’s daughter
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

One-year-old Gauri

KANPUR: Two days after the man who held 23 children hostage was killed in a police operation and his wife was lynched by villagers in Farrukhabad , UP Police has come forward to adopt their one-year-old daughter. Kanpur range Inspector General Mohit Agarwal told TOI that police department would bear Gauri ’s educational and all other expenses till she becomes self-reliant.

“I want her to become an IPS officer,” the IG said. “After all legal formalities, she would be adopted and we would send her to a good boarding school. I would keep her under my supervision,” he said. At present, the girl is under treatment at a hospital in Farrukhabad and is being looked after by women constables.

Gauri’s father Subhash Batham had taken 23 children hostage in Katheria village of Farrukhabad and was shot dead during the police operation on Thursday. Her mother Ruby, too, was killed after she was assaulted by angry villagers. Subhash had invited the children on the pretext of celebrating Gauri’s birthday and held them hostage in the basement of his house. Cops found Gauri in the house after her father was gunned down.

Facing four criminal cases, Subhash had served 12-year sentence in a 2002 murder case. He was recently in jail in a theft case and was released on bail one and half months ago. Police say that he had plotted the hostage drama to settle scores with those he accused of framing him in the murder case.

“Subhash and Ruby had married against their families’ wishes. Therefore, neither of the families came to take custody of the child,” the IG said, adding “Therefore, we decided to adopt her.” A police official said though the child is under shock, she is getting normal gradually. “She is being looked after by a team of doctors under strict vigil of police at a hospital. ” he said.

“We will take care of Gauri in such a manner that she never thinks she is an orphan,” the IG added.

Title: Ranjeet Bachchan asked me to take a different morning walk route: Wife
Content:
Police officials at crime spot

LUCKNOW: Kalindi Sharma , wife of slain Hindutva leader Ranjeet Bachchan , claimed her husband was killed because of his right wing leanings and not in a robbery attempt as being claimed by police. Kalindi said they both used to go for morning walk regularly, but since Ranjeet started getting life threats he told her to take a different route and not follow him as he didn’t want to put her in danger.“He told me to take a different route saying I may also come on radar of his enemies since he received many life threats,” Kalindi told TOI on Sunday.Expressing threat to her life, she demanded district administration to help her meet CM Yogi Adityanath and demanded police security, renewal of her arms licence, a government job, financial assistance and a house. “Ranjeet was forming a Hindu Sena (army) and was vocal about making India a ‘Hindu Rashtra’. This had turned him into an eyesore for other hardliners who hatched the plot to kill him. He was getting life threats on social media and through web calls from India and abroad on regular basis for past three years after he formed his own political party — Vishwa Hindu Mahasabha — in 2017 and started taking part in debates on news channels. He also used to get sexually explicit content on his social media account from fake profiles of women trying to honey trap him. They asked about his daily schedule,” she claimed.Kalindi said they used to go together for morning walk since they got married in 2014, but after he floated the party and started getting threats, he asked her to go on a different route as he feared that I may also be targeted by his enemies. The couple lived on the sixth floor of Old Councillors’ Residence (OCR) building at Hussainganj. Their three-year-old son died in 2017.Recalling Ranjeet’s commitment to Hindutva, Kalindi said, “Once he told me, Kuchh bhi ho jaye sindoor mat pochhna, Hindu neta marta hai, vichardhara nahi (Don’t wipe away the vermillion from your forehead even after my death because a Hindu leader can die, Hindutava ideology never dies).”His cousin Aditya and his wife Jyoti had come to visit them on Saturday night. “On Sunday morning at around 5.30am, we left for morning walk like other days. Aditya joined Ranjeet and they went towards Parivartan Chowk via Hazratganj crossing, while I went to Lalbagh,” she said.“At around 7.30am, I was exercising at Lalbagh park, when Jyoti called me to inform that a few cops came to my house and said Ranjeet had been shot. Soon I got a call and police sent a vehicle to take me to Hazratganj police station. However, police took my phone and kept moving from one police outpost to another before taking me to the police station. They kept grilling me with questions about Ranjeet’s friends and enemies on the way,” she said.

Title: Fifteenth Finance Commission bats for higher financial grant for municipal bodies
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

New Delhi: Municipal bodies are likely to recieve at least Rs 29,000 crore grant during 2020-21, which is nearly 40% more than the assistance they received under the current fiscal. This is likely to bring some relief to the municipal bodies which are reeling under huge fund crunch and are failing to deliver.

The Fifteenth Finance Commission in its recommendations for 2020-21 has suggested this. The report was submitted on Saturday. A recent study carried out for the commission had flagged how the increasing dependence of civic bodies on grant from state governments and Centre was proving to be unsustainable.

According to the commission’s recommendations, municipal bodies in Uttar Pradesh would get a maximum of Rs 4,695 crore grant during the next fiscal year as compared to only Rs 2,460 crore. The commission has recommended huge increase in financial assistance to municipalities in Bihar , Assam , Himachal Pradesh , Jharkhand and Chhattisgarh, to name a few.

While it has recommended Rs 2,416 crore grant to Bihar’s civic bodies as compared to only Rs 642 crore during this fiscal, the commission has suggested to increase the financial assistance to municipal bodies in Himachal Pradesh from only Rs 48.4 crore (2019-20) to Rs 207 crore. The commission has recommended reduction in grant to municipal bodies in case of a couple of states including Kerala and Maharashtra .

Title: Delhi polls: AAP asks EC to ban Yogi Adityanath from campaigning, demands FIR
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Yogi Adityanath

NEW DELHI: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Sunday urged the Election Commission to ban UP chief minister Yogi Adityanath from campaigning in Delhi. AAP MP Sanjay Singh also demanded an FIR against Yogi for his alleged provocative remarks during his whirlwind election campaigns.

In a memorandum submitted to EC on Sunday, AAP stated that the UP CM had acted in gross violation of the model code of conduct by "making objectionable statements with the sole intention of spreading religious hatred" by associating chief minister Arvind Kejriwal with the statement of a federal minister of Pakistan. Yogi had also accused the AAP government of "supplying biryani to the Shaheen Bagh protesters".

AAP said Yogi's remarks were "divisive" and "aimed at aggravating existing differences and creating mutual hatred between communities".

The memorandum also pointed out that BJP's actions provoking enmity and spreading hatred on religious lines had resulted in an extremely unsafe situation in Delhi, as seen by the detention of a juvenile for attempting to shoot peaceful protesters at Jamia on January 31.

"To appraise the Election Commission, we had sought an appointment two days ago. Till now, we have received no response. It is very unfortunate that BJP derails the poll discourse in Delhi, but Election Commission is silently watching it," Singh said. "If Yogi's remarks about Kejriwal are right, it should be proven. Otherwise, he should desist from talking such things," he added.

Talking to reporters, Singh said, "If the EC doesn't give time to meet AAP delegates by 12pm on Monday, we will sit on a dharna at the EC office."

The AAP MP said that Yogi had failed in governance and he was not ready to talk about electricity, water, roads, education and health. "He has no positive stories from UP to tell the people of Delhi. Therefore, he tries to divide people on communal lines. How can a chief minister of BJP talk like this?" asked Singh.

Singh said Yogi's remark about "Goli aur Boli" delivered during a public meeting at Narela on Saturday was dangerous. However, Yogi's bullet remarks were made in an altogether different context pertaining to law and order during Kanwar Yatra in UP.

Yogi Adityanath

NEW DELHI: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Sunday urged the Election Commission to ban UP chief minister Yogi Adityanath from campaigning in Delhi. AAP MP Sanjay Singh also demanded an FIR against Yogi for his alleged provocative remarks during his whirlwind election campaigns.In a memorandum submitted to EC on Sunday, AAP stated that the UP CM had acted in gross violation of the model code of conduct by "making objectionable statements with the sole intention of spreading religious hatred" by associating chief minister Arvind Kejriwal with the statement of a federal minister of Pakistan. Yogi had also accused the AAP government of "supplying biryani to the Shaheen Bagh protesters".AAP said Yogi's remarks were "divisive" and "aimed at aggravating existing differences and creating mutual hatred between communities".The memorandum also pointed out that BJP's actions provoking enmity and spreading hatred on religious lines had resulted in an extremely unsafe situation in Delhi, as seen by the detention of a juvenile for attempting to shoot peaceful protesters at Jamia on January 31."To appraise the Election Commission, we had sought an appointment two days ago. Till now, we have received no response. It is very unfortunate that BJP derails the poll discourse in Delhi, but Election Commission is silently watching it," Singh said. "If Yogi's remarks about Kejriwal are right, it should be proven. Otherwise, he should desist from talking such things," he added.Talking to reporters, Singh said, "If the EC doesn't give time to meet AAP delegates by 12pm on Monday, we will sit on a dharna at the EC office."The AAP MP said that Yogi had failed in governance and he was not ready to talk about electricity, water, roads, education and health. "He has no positive stories from UP to tell the people of Delhi. Therefore, he tries to divide people on communal lines. How can a chief minister of BJP talk like this?" asked Singh.Singh said Yogi's remark about "Goli aur Boli" delivered during a public meeting at Narela on Saturday was dangerous. However, Yogi's bullet remarks were made in an altogether different context pertaining to law and order during Kanwar Yatra in UP.

Title: Five held from Jamtara, Deoghar for fraud
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative image

KOLKATA: The detective department sleuths have nabbed five persons from Jamtara and Deoghar in Jharkhand for their involvement in two e-wallet fraud cases lodged with the Shakespeare Sarani and Hare Street last year. The arrests came almost six weeks after gangs from Jharkhand had created mayhem by duping people on the pretext of upgrading their KYC details. The joint CP (crime) Murlidhar Sharma said that four persons were arrested in connection with the fraud case lodged with the Hare Street police station by Pradip Kumar Chaudhury, resident of E M Bypass. He was allegedly duped of Rs 88 lakh.

Vinod Kumar Pandit (22), a resident of Deoghar, landed in the net of Shakespeare Sarani police on January 31. He duped Samir Kumar Sinha of Rs 6.5 lakh.

Title: Maharashtra village is India’s first to pass resolution against CAA, NRC
Content:
Islak, a small village on the outskirts of Ahmednagar town with a population of just 2,000.

AURANGABAD: Islak , a small village on the outskirts of Ahmednagar town with a population of just 2,000 - and not a single Muslim resident - has become the first village in the country to have passed a resolution for non-cooperation with the implementation of the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), National Register of Citizens (NRC) and the National Population Register (NPR).The resolution was passed last week during the gram panchayat meeting on January 26 (Republic Day). The copy of the resolution was signed by the sarpanch and the deputy sarpanch and was forwarded to the district administration.Most of the residents of the village are medium and marginal farmers. Sarpanch Babasaheb Gorange (38) said that some residents were not only landless, but they did not have any documents either. "There are people residing here for generations, but till today, they neither have any document nor any piece of land to prove their existence," he told TOI.When asked about the Muslim population in the village, Gorange said that there was not a single Muslim person in the village and that the resolution had been passed mainly on humanitarian grounds.

Title: How not to become a victim of workplace gossip
Content: A popular Korean proverb says, "Words have no wings but they can fly a thousand miles." And words with no truth can travel even faster, right? Where there are people, there will be gossip and a workplace is one such place where gossip and rumours can spread even faster than wildfire. It doesn't matter whether there is any truth in it or not, rumours and idle gossip is not only disturbing, but it can sometimes even destroy a person's reputation. So, in case your workplace is full of colleagues who enjoy talking behind people's back, here's what you need to do to not become the victim of office gossip.Even if you are friends with your colleagues, always think twice before sharing personal details with him. It's good to have friends in the office but at the same time, you also need to maintain some space. Because you never know someday your trusted colleague might become a competitor and might use vulnerable information that you had shared earlier to attack you.Remember the old proverb that says, "Who gossips with you will gossip about you." Gossiping might seem like a harmless activity at first but once you get involved in it, there is no getting away. That is how gossip spreads, from one mouth to another. So, people who often gossip with you or share interesting news about others with you might end up making you an object of their gossip as well.Refrain from encouraging and entertaining people who talk about others. If you find a workplace friend or colleague talking behind someone's back, very politely excuse yourself. Or ask the person to not engage in such idle talk. It's true that doing so can make you very unpopular but it will also speak volumes about your professionalism and personality. And most importantly, by doing so, you are stopping a rumour from spreading.If you believe that you are surrounded by colleagues who engage in idle talks and this habit is affecting your performance, you can seek intervention from a third person, which in most cases is a representative of the HR department. You can share how such reckless behaviour affects the workplace culture and is not only harmful for the victim but is very detrimental for others as well. The HR professional definitely cannot take any official action against it (hello! no one can trace how a rumour originated or a gossip started, right?) but they can surely help you to handle the situation better.

Title: India's second coronavirus case reported in Kerala's Alappuzha
Content:
Minister KK Shailaja (left) in a discussion with Alappuzha collector M Anjana

ALAPPUZHA/THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: Kerala reported the country’s second novel coronavirus (nCoV) case on Sunday, with a male student of a university in Wuhan admitted to Alappuzha medical college hospital testing positive for the virus.The first case was reported in Thrissur on Thursday and the female medical student is being treated at Thrissur medical college hospital.Health minister K K Shailaja told reporters after a high-level meeting in Alappuzha that the second person tested positive – one among four admitted to the isolation ward at Alappuzha medical college hospital – had reached Kerala on January 24. “Three of those admitted were studying in China while the fourth person is a relative of one of them. We are waiting for test reports of others,” she said.The health department received the test result of the infected person from National Institute of Virology, Pune on Sunday afternoon. Shailaja said there was no need for panic as the condition of both the patients is stable. “They have not developed any serious complications… There is nothing to panic but we need to be vigilant. The department is strictly monitoring the situation so that the virus does not spread from them,” she said.Health dept to screen awareness video in schoolsThe health department has put 1,924 people under observation at their homes besides 75 admitted to isolation wards in various hospitals.Till date, 104 samples of suspect cases have been sent for tests. Of these, 36 results have been received and two tested positive. In Alappuzha, four persons have also been admitted to the general hospital.All those coming from China are under the surveillance of the health department.“The only request to people is that if anyone who has come from China recently has not reported to the nearby health centre so far, they should immediately do so,” she said.The department will screen a video in all educational institutions on Monday to create awareness on coronavirus.Besides government, aided and unaided schools, the video will be screened in CBSE, ICSE, Navodaya and Kendriya Vidyalayas at 2pm on Monday.

Title: Vadodara anti-CAA protest organizers to face action
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Protesters, mostly women and children, had been sitting on a dharna in an open plot at Saudagar Park since Fri... Read More

VADODARA: Organizers of a protest programme against Citizenship Amendment Act ( CAA ) in the minority community dominated Tandalja area are likely to face punitive action as they had not sought permission for the sit-in.

The protesters, mostly women and children, had been sitting on a dharna in an open plot at Saudagar Park since Friday. On Saturday too, they continued with the protests and flashed anti-CAA as well as anti-RSS banners. On Sunday, the pandal was removed from the spot and power connection too was disconnected.

Police said that the pandal removed by the supplier.

"We learnt about the protest that started on Friday and started investigation into it. The organizers hadn't sought any permission from the police. We will book them for organizing gathering and using loudspeakers without any police permission," said Anupam Singh Gahlaut, city police commissioner.

Interestingly, when the cops began looking for the organizers, no one claimed responsibility for the dharna.programme

"The organizers had put the pandal for a day under the pretext of organizing a private programme. The event organizer who had rented them the pandal took it away on Sunday. We had no role in it," a senior police official said.

"They said that it was a voluntary dharna. But our investigations have revealed Sagir Ahmed Ansar, who was recently booked for sharing an inflammatory post against some doctors over CAA issue, was involved in organizing the dharna along with a councillor. Ansari was booked for the post and he is currently on anticipatory bail," a police official said.

When Ansari and others were called to the crime branch to inquire about their role in the protests, they denied having organized it.

Title: Yogi Adityanath: Shaheen Bagh is being organised for causing anarchy and disorder
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

UP CM Yogi Adityanath.

NEW DELHI: UP CM Yogi Adityanath continued his diatribe against chief minister Arvind Kejriwal for the second consecutive day alleging about relations between AAP and Pakistan, while also questioning the real motive behind the protests at Shaheen Bagh.

Yogi arrived almost two hours late in both the public meetings scheduled at Harkesh Nagar and Jaitpur, which are just a few kilometres away from Shaheen Bagh.

"I would have arrived on time, but the Shaheen Bagh sit-in has brought disorder to Delhi. Thousands of people who go to Noida and Greater Noida have been facing salary cuts for not reaching office on time. Shaheen Bagh is being organised with mala fide intentions for causing anarchy and disorder. If you want to obstruct development and allow free rein of pro-Pakistan elements, then remain happy with people like Kejriwal," Yogi said.

The UP CM continued: "When Article 370 was removed to integrate Kashmir, three people felt its pain - Rahul Gandhi, Arvind Kejriwal and Pakistan PM Imran Khan. All of them spoke the same language. Now Pakistan ministers are supporting Kejriwal and these protests. What is the relationship between AAP and Pakistan?"

"They feel pain whenever decisions are made in national interest. The Shaheen Bagh dharna is just an excuse. In reality, they are opposing abrogation of Article 370. They wanted to oppose the Ram temple in Ayodhya. The secret of their anxiety lies in the abolition of triple talaq," Yogi said.

He added, "People have only two options in Delhi elections. One is the Modiji-led leadership on the issues of development, good governance and nationalism. The other is Congress and Kejriwal, who have secessionist intent (vighatankari manovriti) and schemes of destruction made with the intent of supporting anti-India Naxalites."

Besides talking about how he carried out "vasuli" from people who damaged public property in UP, the monk-turned-politician spoke about how he contained the fears of riots during Kanwar Yatra with "bullet persuasion."

"Before 2017, there were many restrictions on kanwariyas. When BJP came to power, I told police that this is a yatra of Shiv bhakts. No obstructions should be placed. We don't do danga-fasad. What is the meaning of the attack on Kanwariyas? Jo hamla karega, to phir boli se nahi usko police ki goli samjhane ka karya kar degi (Those who attack will be stopped with the help of police bullets)," Yogi said.

Alleging that AAP didn't allow the benefits of the Centre's schemes to reach Delhi's poor, Yogi said, "In the past five years, Kejriwal couldn't open new schools, but wine shops (pathshala nahi madhushala) have come up in every mohalla. Kejriwal could not provide clean drinking water, but made Yamuna poisonous. Earlier he used to cough, now he has forced the entire Delhi to cough."

Title: elon musk: Elon Musk remembers his 2006 ‘master plan’; this is what his mother has to say
Content:
A friend just sent me this excerpt from a Tesla blog I wrote 14 years ago https://t.co/Hr8w52ithY — Elon Musk (@elonmusk) 1580324889000

I remember that well🚗🌞🤩🤩 https://t.co/0aPNhcZ9Xj — Maye Musk (@mayemusk) 1580347293000

Tech billionaire Elon Musk recently shared his fourteen-year-old master plan on Twitter . The CEO of electric car maker Tesla shared a photo of his blog from 2006 in which he had outlined a ‘master plan’. The tweet, which lists electric carmaker’s goals, had his mother Maye Musk respond in affirmation.Maye Musk retweeted her son’s tweet, saying, “ I remember that well.”The ‘master plan’ involves a set of three primary and one secondary goal. First is to build a sports car, the second is to utilise the money made from the sports car sales into making an affordable car. And the last part of the plan deals with using money made from the sale of the affordable car to make an even more affordable car. These three were the primary ones. Now, the secondary one is aimed at providing zero emission electric power generation options with the affordable cars that the company would build.The plan was to make affordable cars but Tesla cars cannot be classified as affordable ones. All of the company’s electric car models launched till date have been fairly expensive. With cars like the Model 3 listed on the company website at a starting price of US $39,990 (about Rs 28.59 lakh) and the new Model Y starting from US $52,990 (about Rs 37.88 lakh), the pricing is anything but affordable. Can Tesla step up to the challenge of blending innovation and affordability in the future? Customers for sure would love to see the ‘master plan’ at work.

Title: Alva's Foundation files patent for synthesis of cancer curing molecules
Content: MANGALURU: Research students and faculty of Alva's College and Alva's Institute of Engineering and Technology (AIET), Moodbidri are inching towards a permanent cure for cancer. The research team has synthesized many organic molecules, in which two novel methyl substituted chalcones, that is, (2Z) 1-(5-methylfuran-2-yl)-3-(4-nitrophenyl) prop-2-en-1-one (MFNP) and (2Z) 1-(2, 5-dimethylthiophen-3-yl)-3-(2, 4, 6-trimethoxyphenyl)prop-2-en-1-one (DMTTP) molecules have shown excellent cancer inhibition property.This invention showed that MFNP and DMTTP molecules have high anticancer activity against breast, prostate cancer and leukemia. The research team includes under-graduate student Namratha W N, PhD research students - Sarveshwara H P and Sruthi, faculty Shashidhara Bhat, Jayarama A, Shashikumar, Richard Pinto with a collaborator Sriganesh Prabhu from Tata Institute of Fundamental Research (TIFR), Mumbai.The anti-cancerous property of these molecules was tested at TATA Cancer Institute, Mumbai and has shown good anti-cancer properties for both breast cancer hand blood cancer. Further technical tests are going-on for use of these molecules on humans who are suffering from breast and blood cancer. The research team headed by Richard Pinto says that that these molecules will be potential medicines to cure cancer soon.Alva's Education Foundation that manages the college and AIET filed a patent application (application 201941046359 dated November 14, 2019) for the process of synthesis of these two molecules. This research was funded by Alva's Education Foundation. The team is looking forward to make much more progress in these drugs ensuring to wipe out the grief due to life threatening cancer, Dr M Mohan Alva, chairman of the foundation, said.

Title: Goa: Opposition to corner government in House over Mhadei, law and order
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Chief minister Pramod Sawant will present the state budget for the fiscal year 2020-21 on February 6.

Title: Coronavirus outbreak: 32 of 323 Indians flown in from Wuhan taken to Manesar facility
Content:
A 15-second video in which a group of people at the centre can be seen dancing to a Haryanvi song was shared with the media.

GURUGRAM: Thirty two of the 323 Indians from Wuhan , the epicentre of the novel coronavirus outbreak in China, flown to India on Sunday morning were taken to the Army's quarantine facility in Manesar "Today (Sunday), around 11.30am, a batch of 32 individuals who arrived in India was brought to our quarantine facility at Manesar after an initial round of screening at the airport. They were taken to the centre with the same protocol that was followed yesterday (Saturday)," an Army officer told TOI .On Saturday, an Air India flight had evacuated 324 Indians from China, of which 220 had been taken to the Manesar facility set up at the Army training centre near the NSG camp.All 252 people who have returned from China till now have been put up in 16 barracks in segregated sectors. Those in one sector cannot come in contact with those from others."Initially, they were a little surprised. They were hoping to go home. When they got to the camp and were briefed about the rules, they were a little anxious. But our officers spoke to them and they are now at ease," a senior Army officer said.A 15-second video in which a group of people at the centre can be seen dancing to a Haryanvi song was shared with the media earlier in the day. About the medical protocol, Army officers said there is no need to panic.In Video: Coronavirus scare: Indian students brought back from Wuhan celebrate at quarantine facility

Title: Wettest January in Kolkata since 2013 with 42.5 mm rain
Content:
Frequent western disturbances caused untimely rain across the city in January this year

KOLKATA: The city had the wettest January since 2013 with rain record touching 42.5mm for the month, which was far higher than normal. Only once in the last 10 years did the city receive more rain during the first month of the year — considered to be the peak winter period when precipitation is negligible. Frequent western disturbances (WD) that are not unusual at this time of the year but fewer in number caused the sudden spurt in rainfall count, according to weathermen.Around four WDs affected Gangetic Bengal and Kolkata last month, leading to steady drizzles on several occasions. It paved the way for the chilly northwesterly wind and pulled the mercury down. Last Wednesday, the city had received 5.7mm rain that was followed by another spell of drizzle the next morning, triggered by a circulation. “WDs happen in January, but this time they have formed closer and induced ‘systems’ that generated rain in Bengal and Kolkata. When a WD forms, it induces cyclonic circulations or lowpressure troughs that often move eastward,” said Regional Meteorological Centre (RMC) director GK Das.He added that WDs have formed over northern plains rather than the Himalayan region, which has impacted the city’s weather.“They have formed over UP, MP and Jharkhand and sailed into Bengal, leading to rain. It is because of such rainy spells that the temperature has dropped. With the systems sucking out all the moisture that obstructs the chilly northwesterly wind, they have paved the way for the latter to flow unobstructed. This has helped lengthen the cool spells in Kolkata this winter,” said Das.In 2012, the city had received 94.4mm rain, the highest for the month in the last one decade. The following year, the city had received 12.2mm rain. Since then, Kolkata never received more than 3.2mm rain in January till this year. “It was unexpected as winter in north and east India has been severe this time. Cloud cover and rain tend to pull the temperature up but we had short spells of shower repeatedly in January. So, the periods of high temperature were short,” said a weather scientist.Another rainy spell is in the offing, said weathermen. While the city is set to remain dry over the next 72 hours with temperature expected to drop to 14 degrees Celsius on Monday from Sunday’s 15.1 degrees Celsius. A lowpressure trough line is set to form over central India around February 5.“It could lead to rain in the western districts and Kolkata on Thursday and Friday. There is a possibility of thundershowers like the ones that happen in the premonsoon period. But it is too early to predict the intensity of rain in Kolkata ,” said Das.Under the impact of the rain, minimum temperature will again climb up while the northwesterly, which still remains active, will slow down.

Title: Coronavirus outbreak: Local man placed in GMC's isolation ward
Content:
Representative image

PANAJI: A local man who is suspected to have contracted coronavirus , was placed in the isolation ward of the GMC, Bambolim , on Sunday, taking the total number of people quarantined to two. State epidemiologist Dr Utkarsh Betodkar told TOI the man was admitted after he was found to be symptomatic.On Saturday, a foreign woman was quarantined in the state-run hospital. Her blood sample and nasal swab were sent to the National Institute of Virology, Pune, along with those of a friend who had accompanied her to Goa."Both patients (foreign woman and local man) are fine," Betodkar said.Laboratory reports are expected in the next two days, following which the two may either be discharged or made to stay in the hospital.Last week, a domestic tourist was quarantined in GMC, but was discharged after he tested negative. He worked in the Chinese city of Kunshan, 750km from Wuhan. In all, 14 people with travel history have been placed under observation so far.Any person who has travelled to China since the coronavirus outbreak , or has come in contact with someone who has the disease, is regarded to be a suspect.

Title: Soon, taluka-wise GIS mapping in Goa to protect water bodies
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative image

Title: Chennai man hurls slipper at Periyar statue, held
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

A statue of Dravidar Kazhagam founder Periyar vandalised by miscreants, in Kancheepuram on January 24 (File ph... Read More

CHENNAI: A man was arrested on Sunday for hurling a slipper at a Periyar statue on Anna Salai .

Police said P Narasimmalu, a 59-year-old resident of Triplicane , fled the spot before before passersby could nab him. The incident happened on Saturday.

Narasimmalu, a worker in the neighbourhood, went for a drink at a Tasmac bar in Chintadripet. He roamed the streets and threw the slipper at the statute located at the junction of Anna Salai and Swami Sivananda Salai. Pedestrians heard him shouting abuses, police said.

Alerted by locals, the Chintadripet police registered a case and arrested the man with the help of the CCTV camera footage. Narasimmalu was booked for creating nuisance in public. He was produced before a magistrate who remanded him in judicial custody.

Title: ‘There are many thoughts moving inside your head … You have to learn to block them out’
Content:
Esha Singh was only 13 when she won the national 10m air pistol, possibly the youngest-ever senior national title winner across all sport. More than wins, it’s her uncluttered mind and clarity which has got everybody talking. Siddharth Saxena probes the mind of a champion:

You won a senior national title at 13. How do you understand this sudden change?

I was shooting since I was nine. I was in the fourth grade when I happened to watch a friend of my father’s do some skeet shooting. He asked if I wanted to try it. We had no idea that kids could even pick up shooting at all, and it was felt to be too dangerous. It was then he suggested that we go to Pune, to Gagan Narang’s Gun for Glory academy just to see if I would be interested. I tried air rifle, then the air pistol which I found most comfortable. I was quite a sportive kid from the start, trying my hand at tennis and badminton because Sania Mirza, Saina Nehwal, PV Sindhu, all Hyderabad girls, were such stars for us. But I settled for shooting because it was a unique sport. Initially my mother was worried when I picked up shooting: ‘Guns, just a child, is it safe?’ and all that. Then we entered the range and found out, ‘Oh, there’s something known as a sport gun’. There’s an air pistol also where the grip is just this small. Then she was fine with it.

You’re going to be 15. What does a gun mean to you?

It’s a completely different meaning today. Now, when I hear the word ‘gun’, I literally imagine all the parts, the mechanism, how do you shoot with it, etc. But back then, ‘gun’ was a really big thing for me, ‘Oh, it’s a gun,’ and all that. Now it doesn’t feel anything like that. I’m aware of the variety of guns, how they fire, etc.

How would you describe your approach to shooting? What kind of mental targets do you set?

Before a game, I just tell myself to go and play my game, to enjoy it. That’s all I say to myself. I don’t care about the score, I just don’t care who is watching me from behind, who is sitting in the audience. I’m just with myself at that time. It’s, ‘I chose this sport, I’m going out to enjoy it.’

As simple as that? How meditative is the experience?

You’re completely with yourself at that time. You have to really learn to control thoughts, so you need to do some meditation in the morning. Actually, whenever you have time. You really need to learn to block out thoughts.

Such as?

‘Will I hit the target?’ ‘Will I shoot out, hit out of the target?’ Or other random thoughts, ‘What if I fall ill tomorrow’? There are many, many thoughts which keep moving inside your head. You have to learn to block them out. Now I make notes of the mistakes and review them. Not all matches go according to plan. I really like those matches, where I can work [on the mistakes] and come back again.

You upstaged Manu Bhaker and Heena Sidhu to win the 10m air pistol national title in 2018. Theirs was already an interesting rivalry, are you the third axis in this rivalry?

I don’t see it as a rivalry, we’ve been on so many camps together. Manu’s been my roommate too. I’m going on 15, Manu will turn 18 in February and Heena is probably 31. We’re actually good friends. We talk a lot of things, girl stuff and not particularly shooting. Heena was an inspiration.

Do your schoolmates look at you differently now?

When I first shot a gun and everyone in school got to know of it, everyone in school was like, ‘Oh wow, she’s so small, she handles guns and all.’ But now I’ve hardly had any time to keep in touch with my classmates. I’m home only for two months a year. Last year was a very busy year, I was on international tours.

Do you miss growing up as a regular girl?

At some point, yes, but no also. I feel good, I feel lucky that my parents are so supportive. But there are some times, when my friends send me pictures of field trips or sports days at school and I’m not there. I miss it, but I also look at it as something I’m building up in my life. This is my goal; I have to do it. So, I have to sacrifice something.

Sometimes, I feel more pressure going to school after a very long time than I would feel ahead of big competitions. All the other students’ eyes on me, like, ‘Oh, ma’am’s finally come to school’.

Title: Bengaluru: Mob attacks BMTC bus, thrashes crew
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Mob vandalized BMTC bus over petty issue at Sulibele village on Saturday evening

Title: Degree certificate awarded to CoEP students
Content: PUNE: The degree certificate awarding ceremony of the twelveth batch of engineers who passed out in July 2019, after College of Engineering Pune was given autonomy was held on Saturday in the college main auditorium.A total of 749 students graduated in July 2019 in ten engineering disciplines in the college. Out of the 749 graduating students, 288 students received their degree certificate in person on Saturday.Naveen Gautam, managing director, HELLA India Automotive Pvt. Ltd., Pune was the chief guest at the function which was also attended by B B Ahuja, Director, COEP and others. Ahuja presented a brief report which showcased some of the major highlights of COEP in the last couple of months.‘Naveen Gautam, in his ceremonial address, congratulated the graduating students and said that the purpose of education is to be able to apply the same to contribute in the welfare of the society and create opportunities for self as well as for the society. He also shared some of his personal experiences to make the students understand the importance of following one’s passion for a quality life and career. He concluded by advising the students to pursue excellence in academics and career and also be responsible citizens of the society,’ said the official release from CoEP.

Title: Delhi elections: PM Modi to address back-to-back rallies as campaign enters final phase
Content:
With campaigning for Delhi elections set to end on February 6, PM Narendra Modi will address the first of his ... Read More

NEW DELHI: With campaigning for Delhi elections set to end on February 6, PM Narendra Modi will address the first of his two rallies in Delhi on Monday. The event, to be held at CBD ground in east Delhi's Karkardooma, will have the presence of all 20 party candidates from the 10 assembly segments each in east and northeast Delhi.Party insiders said they expected close to 50,000 people to attend the rally. PM's second rally will be held on Tuesday in Dwarka. BJP has mounted an aggressive campaign at the ground level and, till now, the party claims to have held over 4,000 public meetings across the city. The Shaheen Bagh standoff has dominated the speeches of BJP functionaries, who have sought to target chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on various fronts. Union minister Anurag Thakur and West Delhi MP Parvesh Sahib Singh have been temporarily banned from campaigning after Election Commission found that their speeches had violated the model code of conduct.On Sunday, as part of a mass-contact programme, over 1 lakh BJP workers - besides Union home minister Amit Shah and party national president JP Nadda - knocked on the doors of houses in all the 70 assembly constituencies of the city. While Shah visited different areas in Delhi Cantonment and canvassed for BJP candidate Manish Singh, Nadda campaigned for Shikha Rai in Greater Kailash."Under the leadership of PM Narendra Modi, BJP is committed to serving the public without discrimination between villages and cities," Shah tweeted, after visiting different localities in Mehram Nagar. Several senior functionaries, including Union ministers Prakash Javadekar and Harsh Vardhan, and city unit chief Manoj Tiwari , visited different assembly segments.Chief ministers from different BJP-served states have thrown their weight behind the party's campaign in the capital.After the daylong programme, Shah and Nadda, among other party seniors, visited election offices of party candidates in different constituencies and reviewed the poll preparedness. Shah visited the offices of party candidates in Timarpur, Adarsh Nagar, Shalimar Bagh and Rohini. Nadda went to Sadar Bazar, Chandni Chowk, New Delhi and Jangpura constituencies.
