Title: Bengaluru News - Times of India
Content:
Representative image

BENGALURU: Nine new samples of travellers who had gone to China with symptoms of coronavirus were sent for testing at the Rajiv Gandhi Institute of Chest Diseases on Sunday.The results of over 20 samples sent for testing so far from Bengaluru have been negative. "We received nine new cases of suspected patients who came to the institute with influenza-like symptoms. Since they hadn't visited the affected city of Wuhan, we have sent their samples for testing as per protocol," said RGICD director C Nagaraja.

Title: Chhattisgarh 10th & 12th admit cards to be available online at cgbse.nic.in, check updates
Content: The Chhattisgarh Board Of Secondary Education (CGBSE), Raipur, will release the board exam admit cards for class 10th and 12th students online on its official website - cgbse.nic.in. Earlier, the board had distributed the 10th and 12th board exam admit cards to schools and the students had been instructed to collect their admit card from the school. Now, the board will also release admit card online for students. The students can go to the official website of the Board - cgbse.nic.in - and download their admit card. The students can use the print out of their online admit card to appear for the Chhattisgarh State Board Exams 2020.This year, around seven lakh students have registered for the Class 10th and Class 12th board exams 2020. The students can follow the steps provided below to check and download the admit card:1) Open the official website - cgbse.nic.in2) Click on the admit card notification available on the official website3) Enter your roll number to download the admit card4) Take a print out of your CGBSE Board Exam admit card 2020 for further use

Title: ‘Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali’: Salman Khan’s protégés Sooraj Pancholi, Aayush Sharma and Zaheer Iqbal to star in this action comedy?
Content:
Announcing my next film... KABHI EID KABHI DIWALI .... STORY & PRODUCED BY SAJID NADIADWALA ... DIRECTED by FARHAD… https://t.co/p7ODjXr5Zj — Salman Khan (@BeingSalmanKhan) 1578643994000

Bollywood superstar Salman Khan took everyone with surprise when he announced his next ‘ Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali ’ on Twitter. The announcement was quite unexpected and there was no buzz of the film in the town.Sharing the same, Salman wrote, “Announcing my next film... KABHI EID KABHI DIWALI ....STORY & PRODUCED BY SAJID NADIADWALA ...DIRECTED by FARHAD SAMJI ...EID 2021 ...#SajidNadiadwala @NGEMovies @farhad_samji @WardaNadiadwala @SKFilmsOfficial”Now the latest reports suggest that Salman’s protégé – Aayush Sharma Sooraj Pancholi and Zaheer Iqbal might join the bandwagon. If reports are to be believed, Salman will lead the film but it will have an ensemble cast. Director Farhad Samji wanted to cast fresh faces for certain characters in the film. On this, Salman recommended Sooraj, Aayush and Zaheer’s names to which the director and producer Sajid Nadiadwala agreed. They thought these actors might fit the bill for the small but crucial roles. The trio will be seen as three friends who cross paths with Salman's character and end up helping him. Reports further also suggest that the film is expected to go on floors mid-year of 2020.Well, it will be interesting to see them coming together with Salman.Earlier, a source close to the development revealed, “It’s essentially a family drama with lots of action too. The narration took place early last week and Salman gave his nod in the first meeting itself as the script is tailor made for his image.”‘Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali’ will hit the theatres on Eid 2021.

Title: Karnataka student loses Rs 60,000 to conmen
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative image

BENGALURU: A 22-year-old engineering student has been cheated of Rs 60,000 by a gang of miscreants who contacted her over phone and posed as representatives of an online job portal .

Soumya, a resident of BTM Layout, told Mico Layout police last week that a man called her over phone on January 24 and introduced himself as a representative of an online job portal and convinced her to get registered with his firm to land a good job.

She paid Rs 2,500 as registration fee and Rs 7,500 for a telephonic interview.

"The woman sensed something was amiss after the gang demanded Rs 15,000 more to qualify for the next stage of job recruitment. She demanded her money back, saying she was no longer interested in the job. The miscreants agreed to refund the amount and asked her to click on the links they messaged her for a refund. She followed their instructions only to find the miscreants had siphoned off Rs 50,000 more from her bank account," a police officer said.

Title: Improving GST collection offers hope for Karnataka
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative image

BENGALURU: In an effort to increase compliance in payment of goods and services tax , the Centre has initiated corrective measures to improve the GST Network (GSTN) web portal.

Technical glitches on GSTN, through which tax is paid and and returns filed, were cited for poor compliance. Ever since it was rolled out over two years ago, despite initiatives such as setting up a group of ministers, the problems have persisted.

The Union revenue department has organised brainstorming sessions with GSTN’s lead service provider Infosys. “It was a long-pending demand that the Centre should intervene directly and it has finally happened, though a little late,” said BT Manohar, member, GST advisory council, Karnataka government. “It has raised hopes of resources mobilisation for Karnataka.”

Once the glitches are fixed, compliance in Karnataka could be higher than in Maharashtra, which tops GST collection in the country.

“We took stock of all issues related to performance of the portal,” said Anil Kumar Jha, additional revenue secretary, finance ministry, central government.

Title: Two injured after two cars, bikes pile up in Oshiwara
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Police filed a case of rash driving against a motorist, who rammed his car into a motorcycle.

MUMBAI: Two people were injured in a pile-up near Oshiwara police station on Sunday morning.

Police filed a case of rash driving against a motorist, who rammed his car into a motorcycle. Another bike and car were also damaged in the incident.

Title: 'No more AC locals' - Trains with both AC and non-AC coaches more suitable for Mumbai: Western Railway
Content:
Railway Board

AC and non-AC coaches

AC local trains

Churchgate-Borivali

Railway Board chairman VK Yadav admits ‘local population’ is angry over the AC local’s higher fares

Central Railway

Thane

Scenes from Thane station on Friday, when doors of AC local did not close due to overcrowding. The peak-hour services were affected

Zonal Railway Users Consultative Council

Public anger has forced the Western Railway (WR) to stop buying more AC locals for its Mumbai suburban section. The WR on Friday wrote to thesaying it prefers having bothin Mumbai due to resistance from commuters towards fullyTrouble with the AC local started almost immediately after its introduction on theroute in December 2017. Commuters resented the fact that the first-class pass wasn’t considered valid to board the train (see box below). Also, because of the automated doors, the AC local was given a longer halt at stations, resulting in other trains getting delayed ( ‘AC ki taisi’, MM, February 5, 2018 ).The WR has four AC locals, of which two are currently in service, one has been sent for the periodic overhaul, while one is yet to be inducted into the fleet. On January 31, when thegot the first AC local for its suburban line (Thane-Panvel), stampede-like situation was witnessed atstation.The train’s automated doors did not close because of overcrowding, resulting in the services being delayed by about 15 minutes during the morning peak hours. The WR officials said that the AC locals in service presently will not be affected, but they don’t know whether the additional seven fully AC trains they have been allotted by the Railway Board will be added to the fleet.Similarly, the CR has been allotted six fully AC local trains, but going by the January 31 chaos, it will take a while before it introduces the second AC local.The WR’s chief public relations officer, Ravinder Bhakar, said the railway suggested a six AC and nine non-AC coach formula, and a three AC and nine non-AC coach arrangement to the Railway Board.The Railway Board chairman, VK Yadav, said that “discussions with stakeholders revealed that there was some opposition to the trains”. “The local population is opposing the fully AC trains citing the expense factor. Negotiations are ongoing, and we are thinking of going with a six AC and six non-AC combination or a three AC and nine non-AC combination,” Yadav said.Subhash Gupta, member,, said that it would have saved money and spared everyone the headache had partially AC locals been procured in the first place. “A very small percentage of commuters the AC locals,” he said.

Title: Firing in Malad shops: Four to be questioned
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative image

MUMBAI: Four people were rounded up for questioning by Kurar police in connection with the shooting incidents that took place at two Malad (east) shops on Saturday. The shootings were reportedly directed by Uday Pathak, who is lodged in prison for quadruple murders in 2011. The owner of one of the two shops had been targetted for extortion in 2015 as well, at Pathak's behest.

Around 1.30pm on Saturday, a masked man walked into a medical store at Shivaji Nagar and fired a shot, shattering a glass cabinet. A shard pierced one of the employee's hands. The shooter was on foot, but it is believed that his associates were waiting on a bike some distance away. Shortly afterwards, the same shooter fired a round at Rokadia Traders. Nobody was hurt.

Sunil Singh, the owner of the medical store, said: "This is the second time we have been targetted. In 2015, shooters had fired a round at an under-construction site in Shivaji Nagar, injuring a contractor in the abdomen. A chit flung at the site mentioned the names of four targets, which included ours." Three people were arrested in the case and released on bail. Singh believes that by including his name in the list, Pathak may have wanted to instil fear among small business owners in the area and extort money.

Pathak was booked for murder and attempt to commit murder. He was externed from city limits more than 10 years ago.

Title: 'Saudis silent about Karnataka man's arrest'
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Harish Bangera’s wife Sumana M (inset), says a fake Facebook account is the cause of the problem

BENGALURU: More than a month after Harish Bangera, 32, was arrested in Saudi Arabia over alleged hate posts on social media, ministry of external affairs officials said they have sent several requests but authorities in the Gulf nation have not responded to even a single query. Bangera, a resident of Goyadibettu in Bijadi village of Kundapur taluk, Udupi district, was an air-conditioning technician for a company in Dammam, capital of Saudi's eastern provice.

He was arrested on December 20, 2019 for allegedly posting derogatory messages on Facebook against Saudi Arabia's crown prince Mohammad bin Salman and a community.

Sources in MEA told TOI, "We've made many efforts to contact the Saudi authorities but they haven't responded. It is the right of every individual to at least have communication with a counsellor, but the Saudi authorities have neither allowed nor communicated anything in this regard."

Bangera's wife Sumana M, who lives in Udupi, said a fake Facebook account was the cause of the problem. Udupi police said they have contacted the US-based company but is yet to get a response.

According to sources, Indians, especially people from Bangera's hometown, would visit him in prison and were in touch with the authorities, but Saudi police warned them not to meet him in jail as it's a serious offence.

Harish's roommate, a Pakistani, is also believed to have tried his best to get him out of prison, they added.

'Cannot console my daughter'

Sumana said her two-and-a-half-year-old daughter wants to talk to her father. "Harish would call us at least three-four times every day. He'd talk to her on a video call and she hasn't seen or spoken to him for over a month. I'm unable to make her understand what has happened to him," she said. Sumana has been told the Saudi authorities could take three more months to complete the inquiry.

Sumana has told the Cyber Economic and Narcotics (CEN) police in Udupi that her husband is paying the price for hate posts on a fake Facebook account created in his name. However, police are still unclear whether it was a fake account as in the same ID, there was a video apologising for the hate remarks.

Title: Kochi Metro's gain is bus operators' loss
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Kochi Metro train (File Photo)

KOCHI: Private bus operators in the city say that bus owners are being forced to stop operations of around 300 buses in the past one year in Ernakulam district .

Kochi metropolitan transport cooperative society president T J Raju said that after Kochi Metro began operations between Aluva and Thykoodam, about 35% of bus commuters have migrated to the Metro.

"While passengers who pay full ticket fares migrate to Metro, students who travel with concession travel by buses. If more private bus operators stop services, it will worsen the travel woes of students," he said.

Increased fuel expenses, spare parts cost, wages of crew and taxes have resulted in huge operational cost. "Bus operators are trying to convert to CNG-operated buses as part of their effort to survive in the industry. It will help us reduce fuel expenses and also bring down pollution in the city," added Raju.

According to private bus owners, it will be difficult for them to introduce air-conditioned buses or low-floor buses without the government increasing ticket fares. "The minimum fare is Rs 8 (for 5km). When KSRTC operates AC buses, they can charge higher rates, but private operators are not allowed to increase the rates," he added.

Meanwhile, Kochi Metro Rail Ltd (KMRL) has signed an agreement with Kerala State Road Transport Corporation for plying electric buses as part of its feeder service to Cochin International Airport Ltd (Cial). The plan is to introduce two electric buses. Electric buses having a seating capacity of 32 will conduct services from Aluva Metro station to Cial as well as in other feasible routes.

Title: 3 yrs to get suburban rail project on track: Chief Minister BS Yediyurappa
Content:
suburban rail

Chief Minister

KIA

.

Bengaluru

The much-delayedproject will be completed in three years,BS Yediyurappa said on Sunday. While addressing a press conference here on Sunday, the CM said that the entire project will be spread over 148.17 km and will also be a connecting point to the Kempegowda International Airport ().Like the Namma Metro, he said that the suburban trains will be in service from 5 am to midnight and run at a maximum speed of 90 kmph.However, the bigger challenge for the project is land acquisition and funding. As per the Rail India Technical and Economic Service report, the total land required for the project is 583 acres. It also stated that the cost of land acquisition has to be borne entirely by the state government. However, the CM claimed that only 103 acres needs to be acquired for the project as the rest belongs to either the Railways or the state government. He said that the Railways and government land will be leased at a nominal cost of Re 1 per acre. The current cost of the project is pegged at Rs 15,990 crore but it is estimated that it may go up to Rs 18,621 crore.The train corridors are spread from Kengeri to Whitefield, KSRCity Railway Station to Devanahalli (via Yeshwanthpur), Chikkabanavara to Baiyyappanahalli and Heelalige to Rajanukunte. There will be a total of 57 stations.The CM also said that the trains would have air-conditioned coaches. “There will be many junctions where the suburban trains will have common/adjacent stations with the Railways and Metro. As many as 23 stations will have connections with suburban trains and Railways; five stations will connect one suburban corridor to another and 11 Metro stations will have connections with suburban trains. The proposed elevated corridor will be at height of about 15 m due to the existence of a large number of foot over/under bridges,” he said.

Title: Cops won’t let the music play: Baner’s party destinations to go silent at 10 pm
Content:
music

Pune

Koregaon Park

bars

Baner

Chaturshringi police station

Noise Pollution

Resto-bars get notice to shut loudoutdoors and indoors by deadline; they demand rule relaxation at least on weekendsEven as Mumbai readies to embrace its tag of ‘City that never sleeps’, by moving towards extending hours for nightlife,is continuing to face a crackdown on its popular party districts.Close on the heels of, it is now the turn of restaurants andinto be told by police to shut down music at 10 pm — not just outdoors, but also indoors — in order to curb noise levels going up in a residential area.On January 31,officials shot off a notice to all restaurants and bars under its jurisdiction, and also attended a meeting with their representatives on the same day. Cops ordered this zone’s establishment owners to ensure that no loud music is played anywhere on their premises after the 10 pm cutoff, complying with the existing(Regulation and Control) Rules.Reacting to this, the restaurant and bar owners have criticised the early deadline, further demanding that music be allowed to play till a later hour at least on weekends. The owners also argued that the norms should be applicable to outdoor or rooftop restaurants, not indoor ones.Worries about losing customers seem to already be making waves. Sandip Agrawal, founder and managing director of the Thikana Group and The Tenth Floor restopub, said, “When we were told at Friday’s meeting on noise levels to shut loud music by 10 pm, we complied right away. But, we collectively agreed that it should be applicable for outdoor restaurants. Plus, a relaxation of the rule should be discussed at least for weekends. This deadline is just too early. Many of our customers come especially to enjoy the music and atmosphere. Baner is an area where youngsters revel in the nightlife. If music is off at 10 pm, we wonder if customers will even wait thereafter.”Expressing helplessness, Effingut Brewerkz owner Manu Gulati shared on Sunday, “When we were told restrictions have been put in place on noise levels, we immediately followed the norm and started shutting music after 10 pm. While indoor music should be allowed to stay on for more time, police are cracking down on that, too. We have to abide by the law.”A few restaurant owners also said they are still to get any such written order — but most such establishments in the area have had the new rule communicated to them at least verbally. Another such owner on Baner Road told Mirror on condition of anonymity, “We have received no such notice, but messages on the shutdown were circulated by police verbally, and we are being made to follow them.This is all similar to the KP drive. We can understand concerns if the music causes problems to residents — but a blanket ban is also unacceptable. Also, in both KP and Baner, the ban on indoor music is not justified at all.”Since Friday, several customers who headed to Baner for their weekend parties have returned an unhappy lot. Heated discussions were also floating on social media about how the very purpose of nightlife is defeated if music is banned even indoors so early in the evening. One such customer, Amit Shinde, told Mirror, “I am regular to many of the restaurants on Baner Road. This new deadline is not something many like me are happy with. At least weekends should be shown more laxity!”Deaf to these pleas, senior police inspector Anil Shewale of Chaturshringi police station said, “We have issued these orders to restaurants and we are making rounds to ensure the norms are followed.” Similarly, commissioner of police (CP) K Venkatesham merely clarified, “We are following noise pollution rules of the government which are applicable to everyone and should be followed. Notices were sent out on this basis.”Now, many residents appear to be a happy lot. Vaishali Patkar, a citizen activist who stays in Baner, said, “It has been five years that we are complaining about loud music in restaurants here, but in vain. Even if action was ever initiated, there was no continuous effort — the loud music would just return after a few days. Noise levels usually go up during weekends, and it is unbearable. This 10 pm time limit should be followed in indoor restaurants, too. If these establishments can get their property soundproofed to such an extent that even their immediate neighbours won’t be able to hear the noise, only then should they be allowed to play at whatever decibel they want till late.”

Title: Five bronze sculptures found at Palghar excavation site
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

While digging to tap rainwater, workers found 8 ancient idols and 2 grinding stones

MUMBAI: Excavation workers digging a barren land to tap rainwater in Saphale, Palghar district , stumbled upon five ancient bronze sculptures and two grinding stones on Thursday. The forest department was carrying out excavation at Chari-Lalthane village, around 7km from Saphale station, when the workers found the sculptures around 3ft below the ground.

The digging was halted and forest officials reached the spot to take custody of the sculptures. Saphale range forest officer Ruchita Sankhe said the sculptures and stones would be handed over to the State Archaeological Survey of India (ASI). Further digging has been suspended, and an ASI team is expected to visit the site soon.

The idols are each 8 inches tall, and the stones weigh around 35kg each. The idols have been kept with the gram panchayat. Locals believe the history of the sculptures could be traced to Tandulwadi fort, located near the village. As news of the sculptures spread, residents from surrounding villages flocked to the spot. While the history of the findings has yet to be traced, a few locals have began to worship the idols.

Title: Women who have battled Cancer and emerged victorious
Content:
Neeta Vyas

Pragna Shah; For busy bee Ami Oza, the treatment period was like a vacation where she slowed down

Prutha Dave

Urvi Sabnis

(L-R) Decked up in red, these two exuded confidence ; White and alright, the women are all smiles

(L-R) Meditation, workout and family support helped 37-yearold Nitya Nirav Khokhani to overcome the illness ; Surat resident Pushpa Jain was beaming positivity at the fashion show

Emotions ran high as moms and daughters walked the ramp

We seek inspiration from different avenues, even when they are right in front of our eyes. Mirror met women, phenomenal women, who have battled the big C and emerged victoriousThe ramp was all set and so were the models. All decked up in sparkling outfits, the glow on their faces just added to their beauty. But it wasn’t any other fashion show. As the host put it, it wasn’t the cancer survivors, but women of substance who put their best foot forward at ‘Fabulous Forever’. And we completely agree, as these women have not just fought and won their own battles with breast cancer, but continue to motivate people through their inspiring stories. Here are a few…Principal, College of Physiotherapy, IKDRCIt is recommended to undergo regular check-ups after 50. I came to know about my cancer on undergoing one such check-up in 2017. But my doctor explained and counselled so well that I remained positive all throughout the process. Family support is another thing that helps. Besides, my lymphatic system got disturbed too, which is a very important part of our body. Physiotherapy helped cope with it. Today, I spread awareness about the importance of physiotherapy in post-treatment care. It helps in bringing life to normalcy.Senior assistantI could not believe my doctor when they told me I was suffering from cancer. After all, I was fit as a fiddle! I used to teach yoga and had done 50 Surya Namaskars on the day of my check-up. With the help of my family and doctors, I didn’t just accept the illness, but also overcame it. My son encouraged me to even run a marathon. I started training just after my radiation sessions got over and run a marathon once completely treated. Today, I practise yoga and run marathon. It is like I have got a new meaning to my life, of serving a greater purpose and of inspiring people.Studio managerI was in the US, when one day, my breast started paining. I thought it was a result of gymming, but I went for tests which revealed I had breast cancer. I was diagnosed in March 2018 and was cleared in March 2019. It is in times of strife that you realise who your true well-wishers are. The journey is not as tough as it seems. I remember my son telling me to treat it as if it was a bout of jaundice, which also required six months to heal, so does cancer. So, I treated it like any other disease, fought and emerged victorious.Cancer coachToday (Sunday) is a special day for me as I became cancer-free on this day five years ago. My family had a history of the disease, so I underwent regular check-ups and my cancer was detected during one. Since my husband was in the US, I was at the doctor’s all by myself. Even my doctors were surprised by the composure I had maintained when the news was broken to me. I don’t know where I got the strength to overcome it, I just remember closing my eyes and telling myself that I have to push through it. Later, I even decided my look after going bald, donning long earrings and heavy makeup. I even started learning sugam sangeet, something which I always wanted to do. Now, I help cancer patients to overcome the battle with their illness, as I believe emotional support is what we often lack here.PICS: NILKANTH DAVE, ANUSHREE VIJAYA HARSHAN

Title: Woman shields brother from attack in Andheri, loses part of finger
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative image

MUMBAI: A 26-year-old woman lost a part of her finger while trying to shield her brother during an attack on him at Andheri (east) on Sunday. Shama Shaikh was taken to Cooper Hospital for treatment. A case has been filed at Sahar police station.

The police said two men, Bipin Singh and Manish Singh, had a dispute with the Shaikh family. As Shama's brother, Zaid, came to meet her and their mother at Andheri (east), the Singhs landed there with two of their aides. They were carrying a knife. The men assaulted Zaid and when Shama intervened, she was hurttoo. Police said the Singhs clashed with Shama's husband on January 26.

Title: Shaheed Smarak on MI Road is Jaipur's Shaheen Bagh
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

People protest against CAA and NRC at Albert Hall in city on Sunday.

Title: Mumbai: Tour firm's visa goof-up forces family to skip convocation in Canada, to pay Rs 6.5 lakh
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative image

MUMBAI: A travel and tour company from Mahim has been ordered to pay Rs 6.53 lakh as compensation to a woman and her two daughters who could not attend the elder daughter's convocation ceremony in Ottawa, Canada, as the company was negligent with their visa application in 2013.

The visa was held up after the company failed to inform them on time that the Canadian Embassy had sought a 'no objection letter' from her husband for taking their younger daughter on the trip in his absence. The tour had to be rescheduled.

Holding Harvey India Tours & Travels guilty of deficiency in service, the state consumer commission said, "Although opponents [company] are engaged in processing visa application. they were not having knowledge of the same. Although in that respect query was made by Canadian Embassy and letter collected for the same, opponent had not sent the same to complainant in time."

Deepa Ganjoo from Borivli and her daughters, Twisha and Sneh, moved the Maharashtra State Consumer Disputes Redressal Commission in 2014. They said that Twisha, who was studying in Canada, had her convocation ceremony on May 14, 2013. The Ganjoos had decided to reach Canada early and go on an 11-day trip. The company booked Mumbai-Vancouver tickets for Deepa and Sneh for April 24, 2013 and for the three to return to India on May 20, 2013.

The Ganjoos said that they furnished all documents mentioned by the company for the visa. However, the visa did not arrive before their departure, forcing them to reschedule. Deepa learnt that the embassy had sought more documents, but she was not informed. She booked fresh tickets for May 13. However, they reached Canada late on May 14, and missed Twisha's convocation ceremony.

Included in the relief was in compensation was Rs 1.28 lakh towards expenses incurred for rescheduling tickets and an unnecessary stay in Vancouver. While Rs 3 lakh is to be paid towards the mental agony and pain suffered by Deepa, Rs 1 lakh each for the harassment caused to Twisha and Sneh. Also, the company will also have to pay the Ganjoos Rs 25,000 towards litigation expenses.

Title: DCP Chinmoy Biswal shunted out by EC over Shaheen Bagh firing
Content:
For now, Chinmoy Biswal will report to the Union ministry of home affairs.

NEW DELHI: The Election Commission on Sunday transferred DCP ( Southeast Chinmoy Biswal after it reportedly found his continuance on the post not conducive to holding a free, fair and impartial election in Delhi.Sources said the action is linked to the firing incident at the anti-CAA stir site near Shaheen Bagh on Saturday in which a youth from Dallupura fired two rounds in the air.Biswal, who EC said stands relieved from his post with immediate effect, will be replaced by senior additional DCP (Southeast) Kumar Gyanesh. However, the police commissioner will be sending a panel of three names to EC for posting a suitable officer as a regular DCP. A compliance report with the charge taken over details would be sent to EC through Delhi chief secretary.For now, Biswal will report to the Union ministry of home affairs. A 2008-batch officer, he had been posted as DCP (Southeast) since 2017. He had served as additional DCP in south and central districts earlier.According to sources, the poll panel had received adverse reports from its observers as well as the special police observer about handling of security arrangements and policing at Shaheen Bagh. This was corroborated in the report received from Delhi chief electoral officer (CEO).An EC official said, "Given that the area is sensitive in view of the ongoing protests and the impending elections, and since one incident of random firing by a civilian had earlier taken place near Jamia , it was expected that the security around the anti-CAA dharna site would be further strengthened with strict access control and constant vigil against any attempt to create a communally-charged situation.""The second firing occurred despite EC's directions to field-level officers at the poll review meeting on Friday to take swift action in the interest of fair, just, legal and impartial elections in Delhi. It was particularly stressed that law and order arrangements at vulnerable polling booths must be tightened ahead of polling day," the official added.The meeting on Friday was convened for a comprehensive review of the poll arrangements, including the state of law and order.

Title: DCP Chinmoy Biswal shunted out by EC over Shaheen Bagh firing
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

For now, Chinmoy Biswal will report to the Union ministry of home affairs.

NEW DELHI: The Election Commission on Sunday transferred DCP ( Southeast ) Chinmoy Biswal after it reportedly found his continuance on the post not conducive to holding a free, fair and impartial election in Delhi.

Sources said the action is linked to the firing incident at the anti-CAA stir site near Shaheen Bagh on Saturday in which a youth from Dallupura fired two rounds in the air.

Biswal, who EC said stands relieved from his post with immediate effect, will be replaced by senior additional DCP (Southeast) Kumar Gyanesh. However, the police commissioner will be sending a panel of three names to EC for posting a suitable officer as a regular DCP. A compliance report with the charge taken over details would be sent to EC through Delhi chief secretary.

For now, Biswal will report to the Union ministry of home affairs. A 2008-batch officer, he had been posted as DCP (Southeast) since 2017. He had served as additional DCP in south and central districts earlier.

According to sources, the poll panel had received adverse reports from its observers as well as the special police observer about handling of security arrangements and policing at Shaheen Bagh. This was corroborated in the report received from Delhi chief electoral officer (CEO).

An EC official said, "Given that the area is sensitive in view of the ongoing protests and the impending elections, and since one incident of random firing by a civilian had earlier taken place near Jamia , it was expected that the security around the anti-CAA dharna site would be further strengthened with strict access control and constant vigil against any attempt to create a communally-charged situation."

"The second firing occurred despite EC's directions to field-level officers at the poll review meeting on Friday to take swift action in the interest of fair, just, legal and impartial elections in Delhi. It was particularly stressed that law and order arrangements at vulnerable polling booths must be tightened ahead of polling day," the official added.

The meeting on Friday was convened for a comprehensive review of the poll arrangements, including the state of law and order.

Title: Special ward at Vellore Government Medical College Hospital
Content:
Picture used for representational purpose only

VELLORE: A special ward for coronavirus patients has been set up on the premises of Vellore Government Medical College Hospital (VGMCH) at Adukkambarai.The ward is equipped with 10 beds, including seven in the male ward and three in the female ward."The special ward was opened based on instructions from the Directorate of Medical Education (DME), following the outbreak of nCoV in China," said a medical official at the government hospital on Sunday.The ward will be operated by the department of general medicine. It is equipped with N95 masks, three-layered masks, and medicines along with other vital equipment such as ventilators, suction apparatus and oxygen flow meter, the officer explained.The ward will be operated round the clock by doctors, nurses and support staff, said Inbaraj, the resident medical officer of the hospital.

Title: Sensex drops over 150 points; Nifty below 11,700
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Market benchmark sensex dropped over 150 points in morning session on Monday as investor sentiment took a beat... Read More

MUMBAI: Market benchmark sensex dropped over 150 points in morning session on Monday as investor sentiment took a beating after the Union Budget failed to meet expectations.

After swinging over 300 points in early session, the 30-share BSE index was trading 125.45 points or 0.32 per cent lower at 39,610.08, and the broader NSE slipped 21.30 points, or 0.18 per cent, to 11,640.55.

In the previous session, sensex logged its biggest single-day plunge in more than a decade on Saturday after the Union Budget failed to live up to market expectations of growth-boosting measures and fiscal discipline.

Sensex settled 987.96 points or 2.43 per cent lower at 39,735.53, and Nifty plunged 300.25 points or 2.51 per cent to close at 11,661.85.

Meanwhile, on a net basis, foreign institutional investors sold equities worth Rs 1,199.53 crore, while domestic institutional investors purchased shares worth Rs 36.64 crore on Saturday, data available with stock exchanges showed.

ITC, Hero Motocorp, M&M, Tata Steel, HDFC Bank and ONGC were among the top laggards, while Asian Paints, IndusInd Bank, Nestle India, HUL and Bharti Airtel were trading with gains.

According to analysts, the market is disappointed as the budget lacked any significant measure to stimulate demand and did not provide any relief on capital gains tax as expected from budget.

Presenting the Union Budget for 2020-21 in Parliament, finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman pegged the fiscal deficit at 3.8 per cent for the current fiscal, compared to the earlier target of 3.3 per cent of GDP.

She also proposed lower income tax slabs for those foregoing various exemptions, and removed dividend distribution tax on companies, effectively shifting the tax burden to the recipients.

Further, volatility in the market also heightened after Chinese stocks opened after an extended break, traders said.

Bourses in Shanghai plummeted over 8 per cent, Japan and South Korea were trading with significant losses, while Hong Kong was up.

Brent crude oil futures fell 0.69 per cent to $56.23 per barrel.

The rupee depreciated 26 paise to 71.58 against the US dollar in morning session.

Title: Latest on the coronavirus spreading in China and beyond
Content:
7

Chinese stock and commodity markets fell heavily at the open on Monday, in the first trading session after an extended Lunar New Year break, as investors dumped risky assets in response to rising fears about the spread of a new virus across China. China's central bank said it will inject 1.2 trillion yuan ($173.81 billion) worth of liquidity into the markets via reverse repo operations on Monday, after promising to provide monetary and credit support to companies struggling due to the virus.

Title: Rajasthan: History-sheeter who sold ghost plots in cop custody
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: Police on Sunday arrested a fraudster who had multiple cases registered against him at various thanas across the city.

The accused would take money from victims on the pretext of selling them plots and would then disappear. He is currently being questioned at Chitrakoot police station.

Vikas Sharma (35) was arrested after cops received a case that he had duped the complainant of Rs 30 lakh in return for a plot. According to the complainant, Sharma got in touch with him a year ago and was asked to invest in a colony called Shri Krishna Vihar being developed at Jaichandpura on city outskirts.

Chitrakoot SHO Virendra Kumar said, "Sharma told the complainant about the new residential colony and they agreed to buy a 1,500 square yard plot at the rate of Rs 2,000 per square yard. He took the money from the complainant and in return gave 16 fake lease deeds, side plan and receipt."

When the complainant went to the location of the plot, he found that no such colony existed after which he lodged a complaint.

This was not the first case where Sharma duped people by luring them with cheaper property.

Such cases have registered against him in Sanganer and Jawahar Circle police stations previously.

"The accused was wanted in similar cases registered at various police stations across the city and we are questioning him to find out about other fraud cases as well. He would target poor widowed women who had some agricultural land in villages around the city by saying that he would purchase the land. After the agreement he would develop this land a bit and get prospective buyers to see them. He would take the money from the buyers and then disappear. He has done this repeatedly."

Title: Rajasthan: Fresh locust swarms sighted in Jodhpur, Sriganganagar districts
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

File photo of a swarm of dead pink locusts at Sriganganagar district

JAIPUR: A day after Pakistan declared locusts as "national emergency", fresh swarms were sighted at Srikaranpur tehsil and its villages in Sriganganagar district and at Dechu area in Jodhpur district on Sunday.

However, the agriculture and revenue department authorities and the Locust Control Organisation (LCO) were relieved as a very minimal presence of locusts was confined to Sriganganagar district only, out of the 10 other affected districts. The fresh attack has came as a major setback to their locust control programme.

Rajasthan started witnessing the locust attacks since May 2019 and after a minor gap in September, locust swarms were witnessed in western Rajasthan especially the border districts including Sriganganagar, Hanumangarh, Bikaner, Nagaur, Jodhpur, Churu, Barmer and Jaisalmer and others including Jalore and Sirohi. According to a government estimate, crops on 3.65 lakh hectare of land were damaged till January, while the farmers' union claimed in Rajasthan, around 7.17 lakh hectare of land has seen crop damage.

Chief minister Ashok Gehlot had already told the district collectors in the affected districts to complete the crop damage assessment and distribute the compensation. In a symbolic protest, BJP MLA Bihari Lal Nokha in Rajasthan had recently entered the state assembly carrying a basket full of locusts to draw the government's attention to the farmers affected by the menace. "On Sunday, we were informed about the fresh swarms of locusts which were witnessed at many villages in Srikaranpur tehsil of Sriganganagar district. We were also informed about fresh swarms at Dechu village in Jodhpur district. It is of course a fresh attack and is alarming as Pakistan on Saturday had declared swarms of locusts as national emergency," LK Gurjar, deputy director, LCO told TOI over phone from Srikaranpur.

Gurjar said that the authorities in various districts have enough pesticides and resources to further contain the locusts. He added that the authorities associated with locust control in Pakistan on Thursday had maintained that they were free from locusts, while the neighbouring country declaring the swarms of locusts as national emergency on Saturday, is little mysterious.

"When we had spoken to their authorities they had maintained that they have fully contained them (locusts), however Pakistan declared it as national emergency," said Gurjar.

Authorities in the agriculture and revenue department who have already completed the task of Girdawari (crop assessment), also received a setback as fresh locust swarms were witnessed on Sunday. "Our team visited various affected villages in Dechu (Jodhpur) and villages under Srikaranpur tehsil of Sriganganagar," said a senior officer of agriculture department.

Title: Gold worth Rs 2 crore seized from four at Chennai International Airport
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

The gold that was recovered from 4 passengers at the airport

CHENNAI: Four people were arrested and 4.8 kg gold worth 2.05 crore was seized from them at Chennai international airport . An employee of a food retail company at the airport was also among those arrested.

On Saturday, while on surveillance duty at the departure terminal, Customs officers noticed that a woman who was trying to exit the Customs bay in a hurry was stopped by a lady CISF officer for routine frisking.

Customs officials found a cloth sack attached to her waist from which six bundles wrapped with black adhesive tapes were recovered. On opening the packets, 24 gold bars weighing 2.8kg and valued at 1.17cr was recovered and seized under Customs Act.

The woman was identified as A Vijaykumari,29, an employee of a private food outlet at the airport. On questioning, she informed that the gold had been handed over to her by A Ayesha Banu,32. Based on her information, Ayesha and her accomplice S Ibrahim,25, were apprehended. Both were proceeeding to New Delhi in an Air India flight. They told customs officials that the gold was handed over to them by a person in the transit area . All three were arrested. Efforts are on to nab other members of the gang.

In another case on Saturday, Mohamed Azeem Sarook,19, of Ramanathapuram arrived from Colombo and was intercepted at the exit gate. Officials found two sachets containing gold paste on him. The gold is valued at 25.16 lakh. In yet another case, gold weighing worth 50.55 lakhs was seized from a passenger who arrived from Bangkok on Sunday.

Title: Happy Birthday beautiful! Priyanka Chopra's sweet birthday wish for niece Alena Jonas
Content: Recently, Kareena Kapoor Khan announced the big breaking news of her second pregnancy with hubby Saif Ali Khan. While fans, friends, and family of the gorgeous diva seem to be growing impatient for the upcoming little bundle of joy who’s expected to arrive by late February to March 2021, one must also recall Bebo’s first pregnancy days when she was carrying her munchkin, Taimur Ali Khan. No doubt, she was a complete stunner in her first pregnancy glow, meanwhile, if the actress is looking for some inspiration for her second round, here’s a list of five celebrities from whom Bebo can take fashion inspirations to ace her maternity look once again. From the supermodel, Gigi Hadid to ace singers like Katy Perry and Beyonce, this list covers some of the most fashionable mommies and mummy-to-be.Photo credit: Instagram

Title: Mumbai businessman held for helping gangster extort from builder
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative image

MUMBAI: A businessman from Vikhroli has been arrested by the crime branch for allegedly abetting gangster Prasad Pujari by passing on contact details of a builder whom the gangster called up and threatened. Sunil Narayan Aagane (55) was arrested on Saturday.

Aagane allegedly tried to play intermediary by meeting the builder and trying to facilitate a phone chat between the builder and gangster, the police said.

Last week, two police informers — Salim Penwala alias Maharaj and Faiyyaz Ibrahim Sannata — were arrested for allegedly passing on a builder’s phone numbers to gangster Ejaz Lakdawala.

In the latest case, the developer had taken up a housing redevelopment project in Vikhroli. Soon after his company demolished the old building last June, he started receiving calls from an international cellphone number and the caller demanded Rs 1 crore.

A police source said that the builder told the caller that he would not be able to pay up as much, claiming that redevelopment projects do not rake in too much money and also said that business had been bad in recent times. “At this, the gangster said that the builder should pay the amount before he started work the project,” said the source.

Subsequent calls from the international number were not answered by the builder, said the source, spurring Aagane to meet the builder last week.

“Aagane asked him not to ignore calls from the international number and even dialled the gangster from his [Aagane’s] phone,” said the source. “The builder told him he would speak to the gangster later.”

By evening the gangster called up the builder, said the source. He threatened him to pay and said that the builder would meet the fate of a political leader who had been fired at recently.

The builder then lodged a police complaint. Aagane was picked up from Tagore Nagar in Vikhroli. The police claimed that Aagane has admitted to having met the builder at the gangster’s behest. He has also confessed that he had passed on the builder’s number and provided him with updates about the redevelopment project, said a police source.

Title: Chinese woman, three others test negative for coronavirus in Jaipur
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

The state government has set up a facility for nCoV screening at the Jaisalmer airport.

JAIPUR: Four persons including a 39-year-old Chinese woman have tested negative for novel coronavirus (nCoV). All the four were quarantined at the Sawai Man Singh (SMS) Hospital.

Following the virus scare, the state government has introduced a facility for nCoV diagnostic testing at the SMS Hospital. The facility is helping doctors in getting test reports in a day.

Earlier, the health department had to send samples of suspected nCoV cases to the National Institute of Virology (NIV) in Pune. All the six persons who had been quarantined at the hospital have tested negative for the disease.

The health department has sought help from collectors to identify people who had travelled to China and returned recently. A similar letter has also been sent to the DGP to seek police help to identify Chinese tourists staying in hotels.

Arrangements have been made at Alwar's ESIC Medical College for keeping nearly 300 Indian citizens airlifted from China's Wuhan city, the epicentre of the coronavirus outbreak.

The batch of passengers has not yet arrived and is likely to arrive on Monday, said Ravi Sharma, a state health department official coordinating with the Centre.

Title: Black Widow Super Bowl TV Spot: Scarlett Johansson's new trailer promises one action-packed family reunion
Content:
Here's your look at the brand new character posters for Marvel Studios’ #BlackWidow! See the film in theaters May 1… https://t.co/L64cRToHh7 — Marvel Entertainment (@Marvel) 1580688902000

Here's your look at the brand new character posters for Marvel Studios’ #BlackWidow! See the film in theaters May 1… https://t.co/2wcUNj1FUn — Marvel Entertainment (@Marvel) 1580688905000

Here's your look at the brand new character posters for Marvel Studios’ #BlackWidow! See the film in theaters May 1… https://t.co/I9HciEiavW — Marvel Entertainment (@Marvel) 1580688907000

Here's your look at the brand new character posters for Marvel Studios’ #BlackWidow! See the film in theaters May 1… https://t.co/V9LkleeDzt — Marvel Entertainment (@Marvel) 1580688909000

The ‘Black Widow’ Super Bowl trailer is here and it assures us that we “don’t know everything” about the famed Avenger’s past as it gives us some detailed new shots.Starring Scarlett Johansson in the lead, this film is set to trace the back story of the famed Russian assassin turned superhero, Natasha Romanoff , a.k.a Black Widow and introduce us to her first family, before the Avengers . Featuring many scenes we’ve already overanalyzed in the surprise teaser released last year, today’s special TV Spot, although about a family reunion, doesn’t hold back on the actionThe teaser starts with a voice-over of Natasha stating, “You don’t know everything about me.”While the trailer gives us a good look at the supporting characters, including Belova (played by Florence Pugh ) she continues, Melina Vostokoff and Alexei Shostakov or the Red Guardian played by Rachel Weisz and David Harbour respectively, she adds, “The Avengers weren’t my first family.”“At some point, we all have to choose between what the world wants you to be and who you are,” she concludes.With Rober Downey Jr rumoured to be making a cameo in the film, it is bound to make one wonder if Natasha was narrating these lines to Tony Stark , a.k.a Iron Man.Packed with gripping combat scenes, gunfights, and chase sequences and a whole range of new stealth suits, this teaser has something for everyone. While giving us a peek into the Red Room training facilities, previously mentioned in ‘Avengers: Age of Ultron’, the makers also dropped a new set of impressive character posters.Set after the events of ‘Captain America: Civil War’, and before the character’s shocking death in ‘Avengers: Endgame’, it remains to be seen if this will be Scarlett’s last outing as the Black Widow or if her character is resurrected somehow.Guess we will have to wait until April 30 when the film releases in India.

Title: Novak Djokovic targets Roger Federer's twin records
Content:
Novak Djokovic with the Australian Open trophy at the Royal Botanic Gardens, Victoria. (Reuters Photo)

MELBOURNE: It was sweet 17 for Novak Djokovic at the Australian Open on Sunday, but he's already looking at Grand Slam No. 20, Roger Federer 's record haul. The Swiss' best of 310 weeks as No. 1 is also on the Serb's radar as he begins his 276th week at the top on Monday.Djokovic, who beat Austria's Dominic Thiem in the final, said he wanted both. "It was more about Grand Slams, to be honest. Especially the first part of my career, I was dreaming of winning as many Grand Slams as possible," he said."When I started winning a couple of Grand Slams a year, a few years in a row, that's where I felt actually I can maybe can challenge Roger.""The No. 1 was not really in the equation for me until I successfully finished as the year-end No. 1 for several years in a row. I can't identify exactly the moment when I started thinking about it. That's one of the two biggest goals for sure, there is no secret in that," he said.

Title: Two foreigners isolated over coronavirus fear discharged
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative image

MUMBAI: Two foreign nationals, who were quarantined last week at Kasturba Hospital, Chinchpokli for the suspected novel coronavirus, were discharged on Sunday. State officials said 72 people with travel history to China were currently under observation across the state, but only five were hospitalized.

A 21-year-old African national who was in China till arriving to the city on January 25, was quarantined on Thursday. The other traveller, a 32-year-old airline crew member, who came to the city on Wednesday from Beijing, was also isolated at Kasturba on the same day. Additional municipal commissioner Suresh Kakani said both tested negative for the virus and were thus discharged.

"As per the new protocols, no repeat tests would be necessary, so we discharged them. We don't have any patients quarantined currently," said Kakani. Eight patients were admitted at Kasturba for the virus since last week but all have tested negative.

State officials said that over 6,432 travellers arriving at the international airport have been screened, of which 72 were kept under observation. So far, India has reported two positive cases.

Two other travellers were isolated at a civic hospital in Pune on Saturday and Sunday, after they complained of minor illness including cold, cough and fever. Both had returned from China recently. Their reports are awaited.

Title: Rajasthan medical student narrates horrific experience
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

As many as 38 people who returned from China are under observation in state hospitals.

JAIPUR: One of the seven students from Rajasthan, studying in China narrated the horror of being confined in their hostel rooms for the past 10 days due to lock down in Wuhan of China amid novel coronavirus (nCoV) scare before being taken to Manesar, where he is quarantined along with others airlifted from China in the past two days.

They reached Delhi on Saturday after the Centre extended help and airlifted the students. "Wuhan is the city which I liked a lot. Even in winter vacations, which started from January 10, I preferred to stay back. But I never thought that I will have to remain confined to my hostel room wearing a mask all the time. Situation changed entirely in 10 days as Wuhan was under a health emergency and was completely locked down," said a medical student, who went to China in December 2018 for studying MBBS course He said that all the shops and hotels were closed. "The university in which I studied, helped us a lot. As we were confined within a room, we were facing difficulty in getting food. However, the university took the initiative and provided us food in our rooms," he said.

"The internet was functioning properly, and we were continuously getting news updates of deaths of people due to nCoV in Wuhan. It was quite scary. It was even more worrisome for my parents," he added. "It came as a major relief for us when we got a call from the university that we are going back to India. We reached Delhi around 7.30am on Saturday," he said.

His 18 colleagues from the same medical university had already arrived before the lock down in Wuhan. Including the medical students, there are 38 persons in the state who have come from China and are under the watch of the health authorities.

A health department official said eight more have been added to the list of people coming from China to the state till Sunday night, who are kept under watch.

Title: Kochi: Change in occupancy of buildings under lens
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Illustration used for representational purpose

KOCHI: The corporation is conducting a survey of the buildings, where occupancies have been changed without permission from authorities, following an order from the state government.

"We would collect tax from the dates in which the occupancies were changed without the corporation's permission. We will also charge conversion rates. So many such cases have come to our notice in several parts of the city, including in Panampilly Nagar. Hence, we have asked revenue inspectors to start the survey," said a corporation official.

The audit wing has been already preparing a report as well mentioning the names of the buildings and the nature of such violations in building rules and occupancy changes.

The move of the audit wing has come in the wake of demolition of four apartment complexes in Maradu following orders from the Supreme Court order. The court order had put focus on various illegalities by apartment owners.

When a property is changed for one use from another, or an extension is built, a certificate of occupancy is usually required, said an official of the audit wing. He said they have identified a pattern in such changes of occupancies done in violations of the building rules.

For instance, several commercial buildings have closed parking areas after securing occupancy certificates. Similarly, residential buildings have been converted for commercial activities without permits.

"Such violations of have been going on for many years. Following the order to demolish the buildings in Maradu, we have started detailed examination of the violations in the city. A detailed report on occupancy violations will be included in the audit next year. We will also examine discrepancies in the printing of receipts also. We have noticed that the same agency has been printing receipts for the local body since 2015," said an official of the audit Wing. The audit report of 2018-19 will include the details of the building rule violations and occupancy change without the permission of the authorities.

If any changes or deviations are to be made to the buildings, they should be carried out according to the provisions of the Kerala Municipal Buildings Rules and such changes should be intimated to the civic body's secretary with revised drawings, specifications and details. The changes should not compromise the building requirements, namely, structural stability, safety, health or environmental provisions of central laws and state laws applicable to the buildings covered under Kerala Energy Conservation (Building Code) Rules 2017 also.

Fire force officials in the district have also noticed that changes in the occupancy group of buildings is a common issue in Kochi . "During renewal of fire NOC, we have noticed that buildings which took final approval for residential purposes have been converted into commercial purpose. In such cases, we deny them renewal," said a fire force official.

Title: Tamil Nadu footwear industry may get a leg-up as Taiwan firm plans $100 million investment
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

The plant is expected to generate 25,000 to 50,000 jobs in the next two years

Title: Firing in Jamia: Poll slip with name of Jamia shooter sparks row
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Jamia shooting accused. (PTI photo)

GREATER NOIDA : An image of an electoral slip, purportedly showing the name and other details of the youth accused of shooting at CAA protesters near Jamia Millia Islamia , has gone viral on Twitter, raising questions on claims that he is a minor. The Gautam Budh Nagar administration has said it is not aware of any such picture being uploaded.

The image has the names of the accused, his father and the polling station in Jewar 's Rampur Bangar village where he is enrolled. The polling date mentioned along with the image is April 11, 2019, when Lok Sabha elections were held in the district.

Dr Azim Khan, who uploaded the image, captioned it: "Here is the proof that Jamia shooter ... is not a minor. Election Commission of India registers him as a 20 year old voter. He should be tried as an adult accused."

Another Twitter user pointed out that the name of the father of the accused was different in his Aadhaar card.

However, the district administration said it was not aware of any such voter card. Additional DCP Ranvijay Singh said, "We have not received anything in writing from Delhi Police about verifying the age of the juvenile. Moreover, electoral rolls are the domain of the district administration." The district magistrate declined comment, saying the matter had not been brought to his notice.

Title: Kolkata: Flyover, footbridge and underpass planned to handle Bypass traffic once Metro operations begin
Content:
The spot near Captain Bheri where an underpass may come up

KOLKATA: The traffic police and Kolkata Metropolitan Development Authority ( KMDA ) have prepared a blueprint on traffic dispersal system on EM Bypass with special focus on one stretch — from Chinrighata crossing to Science City crossing, between which a Metro station is coming up. They have suggested a foot overbridge, an underpass and a pedestrian channel at key crossings and a new flyover on a busy stretch of EM Bypass.The police, along with KMDA engineers and bridge experts, conducted a spot inspection, focusing on Chinrighata crossing on Saturday to look into the existing traffic bottlenecks and chalk out plans to disperse huge pedestrian and vehicular traffic in the future once the Metro station near Science City crossing starts operating.“The way both pedestrian and vehicular traffic is increasing on the EM Bypass stretch, specially at some specific crossings, multi-level traffic interchanges are needed to facilitate movement of both vehicles and pedestrians. Advance traffic dispersal planning is also required as a number of Metro stations are being set up on EM Bypass which would create a huge surge of both pedestrian and vehicular traffic,” said a bridge expert.Officials said that the Chinrighata crossing is already in a mess with the existing flyover no more capable for extensive use. KMDA is in the process of engaging IIT Kharagpur to prepare a roadmap for proper traffic dispersal system at the important traffic intersection. KMDA is already working on a foot overbridge at the crossing.Among the new plans that have been conceptualised by the traffic police, bridge experts and KMDA engineers for proper pedestrian and vehicular traffic dispersal are, a new foot overbridge near Dhapa crossing, a vehicular underpass near Captain bheri and a pedestrian channel at Metropolitan crossing.“Once the Metro station becomes operational, both pedestrian and vehicular traffic from Chinrighata to Science City will increase. A foot overbridge at Dhapa crossing and a pedestrian channel at Metropolitan crossing will help disperse this huge pedestrian traffic on both ends, while the vehicular underpass near Captain bheri will help disperse vehicular traffic to check snarls at Chinrighata, Metropolitan and Dhapa crossing,” an official said.KMDA has come up with a plan to set up a flyover from EM Bypass to New Town that will move parallel to the Metro alignment, via Nicco Park and Sector V. Once it’s ready, the existing Chinrighata flyover will be pulled down.Another new flyover has been conceptualised from Chinrighata crossing to Hyatt crossing on EM Bypass to ease traffic congestion. “A small flyover on this stretch for light vehicles will help ease traffic congestion,” said an official.Plans have also been made for a dedicated bus lane near the Metro station at Metropolitan crossing.Officials said that similar traffic plans with multi-level interchanges would also be required near Ruby and Avishikta crossings where Metro stations are coming up.

Title: Amaravati News: Andhra Pradesh netas under CID lens over Amaravati land
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

An artist's design of Amaravati capital region

HYDERABAD: Many senior politicians could have financially benefited from redesigning the capital region boundaries, said the CID on Sunday, as it expanded its investigation to probe their role into land pooling. The Andhra Pradesh CID has fast-tracked the probe into allegations of encroached government lands being given in land pooling scheme to AP Capital Regional Development Authority (CRDA).

A source in CID said that the scope of the probe was extended, based on the cabinet sub-committee report. Sources said that transactions involving 4,000 acres were under the scanner in Amaravati.

The CID is already probing illegal transactions and assigned lands after issuing FIR. The cabinet sub-committee had said that many people, privy to the likely location of capital, had bought land in the capital region, between June 1, 2014, and December 31, 2014, just before a formal official declaration was made.

“Certain highly-connected individuals procured land through illegal transactions. We are also probing on the findings that the boundary of the capital area was changed to benefit certain people who had lands on the fringes. Another aspect under probe is the fraudulent surrender of Lanka (river island), Poramboke, government lands towards LPS scheme to receive returnable plots,” said a CID official.

Irregularities in land allotment in CRDA and violation of provisions of AP Assigned Lands (Prohibition of Transfer) Act of 1977 and Violation of Rules of SC/ST (Prevention of Atrocities) Act 1989 have also come under the scanner. The lands were purchased in the mandals of Thullur, Amaravati, Tadikonda, Pedakurapadu, Mangalagiri, Peddakakani, Tadepalli of Guntur district and Ibrahimpatnam , Penamaluru, Vijayawada Rural and Chandarlapadu of Krishna district.

“As per records, lands were bought at nominal rates from farmers right before the notification of the capital. It was established that 2,279.91 acres were purchased in the above-mentioned mandals of Guntur district and 1,790 acres were purchased in the mandals of Krishna district,” said an investigating officer, adding, ““Redrawing the boundaries of CRDA were done later.”

Title: Israeli national held with 2.5kg charas in Himachal Pradesh
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative image

SHIMLA: A 42-year-old Israeli national was arrested with 2.5kg charas in Himachal Pradesh 's Kullu district, police said on Monday. Shaul Borov of Jerusalem was travelling in a Delhi-bound private bus from Manali, Kullu superintendent of police Gaurav Singh said.

He was arrested after the Kullu Police seized 2.5kg charas from his possession during checking at TCP Bajaura on Sunday night, the SP said.

Borov came to India on a tourist visa and was on his way to Varanasi, Singh said.

A case under the NDPS Act was registered against him, the SP added.

Title: CBSE 12th Board Exam 2020 study plan & preparation tips to score high in Biology
Content:
CBSE 12th Biology Exam Tips

1 Get familiar with the exam pattern To prepare a clear exam preparation strategy you should be well aware of the exam pattern, sections/parts of the paper, important topics, weightage of each section and type of questions asked in the exam. Take help from your subject teacher or you can refer to the previous years’ papers to find out more details about the exam pattern. Based on your knowledge of exam pattern, divide your chapters and allocate study hours for each one of them.

2 Study your syllabus thoroughly The students are advised to thoroughly study all the chapters in the NCERT Biology book and stick to the topics prescribed in the syllabus. Most of the questions asked in the previous board examinations were from the syllabus only. Make sure you read every topic in the syllabus and avoid the mistake of speculating the chapters.

3 Practice diagrams Diagrams in the Biology paper are important. Using diagrams of various organs and tissues of plants as well as animals is an inseparable part of understanding Botany and Zoology. Long answers with the support of relevant diagrams always help in fetching maximum marks in the exam. Also, make sure you remember nomenclature and other difficult terminologies.

4 Revise multiple times before exam Revision of the topics that you have already studied will help you clear many doubts which will eventually boost your confidence. The students who have prepared well can take the exam fearlessly. Also, keep a short note of all the topics ready for a final revision right before the exam.

Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) will conduct the class 12th Biology examination on March 14, 2020. It's one of the most important papers for the students of Class 12th Science stream who wish to become a doctor, biotechnologist, or pharmacologist.Here are some of the useful exam preparation tips for CBSE Board Class 12th students to score well in Biology exam 2020:

Title: Maharashtra CM says no to NRC, but insists CAA won't rob citizenship
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Uddhav Thackeray

MUMBAI: CM Uddhav Thackeray reiterated that he would not allow the National Register of Citizens ( NRC ) in the state, but defended the Citizenship Amendment Act ( CAA ), saying it would not take away anyone's citizenship.

In a video clip of a three-part series of an interview with Sena mouthpiece, Saamna, Thackeray responded to Saamna's executive editor Sanjay Raut saying, "CAA is not the Act to remove anybody from the country, but about giving citizenship to persecuted minorities like Buddhists, Christens, Jains from neighbouring nations."

About NRC, he said, "Proving citizenship would be a difficult part for both Hindu and Muslim communities."

CPI-M leader Sitaram Yechury welcomed Thackeray's comment on NRC, but suggested that Maharashtra government also pass a resolution to not accept the CAA and NRC in its legislative assembly.

In January, Thackeray had met a delegation of Muslims who had sought a resolution against CAA in the assembly, like Kerala and Punjab and Thackeray had said Mumbai is home to everyone, but not promised any resolution.

Title: Krishnakoli update, February 2: Nikhil grows suspicious due to Padma’s behavior
Content: In the latest episode of Krishnakoli , someone enters the room while Shyama is sleeping. It is none other than Nikhil , who has come to surprise her. The latter is elated to see him.Meanwhile, Aditya bribes an official and sneaks out of the jail. A man is appointed to give his proxy during his absence.Suddenly, the lights go off. Shyama gets worried and calls Nikhil. The latter surprises her with some gifts. He decorates the hotel room and turns the atmosphere into a romantic one. The couple spends some romantic moments. Shyama feels shy.Aditya enters the hotel. He bribes a man who works in the same hotel where Shyama is staying along with her troupe.Nikhil boosts Shyama’s confidence and says she will win the competition. Shyama too promises to win the prestigious compaction where singers from different countries have taken part.Aditya calls up Padma. As her phone rings, Tumpa intends to pick up but Padma takes the phone away. She lies that her relative is hospitalized. Her behavior irks Tumpa.Aditya asks Padma to meet him. She initially hesitates but finally goes to meet him.Aditya hands over a small bottle of poison to her and instructs Padma to feed the same to Shyama. Meanwhile, Nikhil comes out of his room and notices Padma talking to someone in the middle of the night. He grows suspicious.

Title: Coronavirus in Hong Kong: Hong Kong medics strike for China border closure over virus fears
Content:
Hong Kong medical workers strike, demanding the city close its border with China to reduce coronavirus spreadi... Read More

HONG KONG: Hundreds of Hong Kong medical workers walked off their jobs on Monday, demanding the city close its border with China to reduce the coronavirus spreading -- with frontline staff threatening to follow in the coming days.The financial hub has 15 confirmed cases of the disease, many of them brought over from the Chinese mainland where the epidemic began and has so far killed more than 360 people.The action by non-essential medical staff comes as the city's pro-Beijing leadership resists completely sealing the border.Authorities have argued that doing so would be discriminatory, economically damaging and go against advice from the World Health Organisation.Instead, the city government has closed down some crossings and says arrivals from the mainland have dropped significantly.But there is growing public anger in a city that maintains a deep historical mistrust of the mainland after the 2003 SARS outbreak -- which was initially covered up by Beijing -- killed nearly 300 Hong Kongers.Thousands of members of a newly formed medical worker union voted to strike on Saturday unless their demand for the border to be closed was met, with the first group downing tools on Monday.The first strikers are "non-essential" staff but the union has said frontline workers, including doctors and nurses, will walk out on Tuesday if their demands are not met.Staff gathered outside hospitals across the city on Monday morning, handing white ribbons to colleagues encouraging them to join the strike action."If there is no full border closure, there won't be enough manpower, protective equipment, or isolation rooms, to combat the outbreak," Winnie Yu, chairwoman of the 9,000 member Hospital Authority Employees Alliance, told reporters.Talks with the government broke down on Sunday after the union said city leader Carrie Lam had decided to not attend discussions in person.The Hospital Authority, which employs some 75,000 people, said it sympathised with calls to lower the risk of new infections but was opposed to industrial action, saying patients would suffer.It warned half of pre-booked operations would be cancelled or delayed by the strike.Hong Kong's government criticised the industrial action, calling on workers to "reconsider their decision, continue to safeguard Hong Kong with their professionalism and together win the battle against the disease".The virus outbreak comes at a politically precarious time for the city's pro-Beijing leaders who currently have record-low approval ratings after deploying the police to face down seven months of sometimes violent pro-democracy protests.Animosity towards Beijing and mainlanders has also risen steeply in recent years in lockstep with Hong Kongers pushing for democracy.Many in Hong Kong feel an increasingly authoritarian Beijing is clamping down on the city's freedoms.And they also resent the economic pressures caused by the huge influx of mainland immigrants and day-trippers to the city, something that has helped ramp up prices of everything from pharmacy goods to retail rents and housing.Anti-mainland sentiment has sometimes exploded into outright bigotry, especially online where insults and slurs abound.
