Title: Despite ban, polybags still flood Gaya markets
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

File photo used for representational purpose

GAYA: Local markets are flooded with plastic carry bags of the prohibited category despite a ban on the same for more than a year now. The incidence of plastic use is rampant in vegetable and other small shops with a heavy buyer footfall, thereby causing avoidable pollution hazard.

Ban on use, manufacture, sale and storage of plastic bags of all sizes was implemented in the urban areas of Bihar from December 2018 and in rural areas from February 2019.

Activist Motibhai said that GMC should ensure that the plastic ban is not blatantly violated. "Besides, construction materials continue to be transported without the mandatory cover and builders do not sprinkle water and cover the construction site," complained the activist.

Gaya municipal commissioner Sawan Kumar told this newspaper that the civic body was committed to fight pollution and the ban on polythene would effectively be implemented. "We will soon constitute special teams to conduct raids both at the source as well as end use point of plastic bags. Building construction guidelines too would be implemented," Sawan said.

Asked about the proposal to ban the entry of motorised vehicles and allow only environment-friendly e-rickshaws on some of the busiest roads including GB Road and KP Road, the municipal commissioner said the idea was not found feasible and as such it has been put on the back burner.

Title: Narendra: Paayal Rajput to play the first woman pilot of the Indian Air Force in Jayanth C Paranjee’s film
Content: Kangana Ranaut fans were in for a surprise on August 21 as the actress announced her arrival on Twitter. And within 10 days of her debut on the micro-blogging site, Kangana has clocked 1 million followers. In an exclusive interaction with ETimes, Kangana Ranaut opened up about her tryst with social media, how she deals with trolls and all things Twitter. Excerpts from the interview:

Title: Spruha Joshi looks fresh as a daisy in a traditional outfit
Content:
Spruha Joshi looks fresh as a daisy in a traditional outfit

Spruha Joshi has acquired a huge fan following owing to her wonderful acting skills as well as utter beauty. She has impressed the audience with her performance in movies like 'Baba', 'Vicky Velingker' and many more. But she has mostly managed to impress fashion aficionados with her style quotient — during red carpets, press conferences or candid clicks.Spruha, who is quite active on Instagram, keeps on sharing interesting pictures and videos of herself, much to the delight of all her fans. Recently, the star took to her Instagram profile to share a stunning picture of herself. Looking gorgeous in a white and blue colour salwar kameez. The actress completed her attire by wearing a pair of matching earrings and a pair of matching footwear.Meanwhile, on the work front, Spruha's last released 'Baba' produced by Bollywood superstar, Sanjay Dutt and helmed by Raj Gupta did well at the box office. Spruha played a major role in the film opposite to Abhijeet Khandkekar. The film was released on August 2, 2019.

Title: I Love being my Husband’s wife says Genelia Dsouza as she wishes hubby Riteish Deshmukh on their wedding anniversary
Content: Genelia D'souza and Riteish Deshmukh has completed another blissful year of marriage today. The couple had tied the knot on 3 February 2012 according to the Maharashtrian style wedding. At present they are parents to two sons Riaan and Rahyl. Celebrating the special day, the 'Jaane Tu Yaa Jaane Na' actress took to the photosharing app to post a romantic wish for hubby Riteish Deshmukh Genelia shared a beautiful video which includes the throwback picture of the two and captioned it as "Dearest Forever,Grow old along with me,I promise the best is yet to come❤️ Happy Anniversary @riteishd Just to let you know I Love being my Husband’s wife 😍😍😍😍😍😍. #since2002❤️ The two met first time in 2003, on sets of ‘ Tujhe Meri Kasam ’. Ironically their first scene together was Genelia slapping Riteish, but as it turns out, it was the beginning of something beautiful. The two became best of friends and eventually started seeing each other. Their courtship period went on for about for 9 years and finally, in 2012 Riteish and Genelia got married.On the work front, Genelia was last seen in a special appearance in Marathi film 'Mauli'. While Ritesh was last seen in 'Marjaawan' and 'Housefull 4'. He will be next seen in 'Baaghi 3' alongside Tiger Shroff and Shraddha Kapoor.

Title: world famous lover: Vijay Deverakonda’s World Famous Lover trailer to release on Feb 6
Content: The CBI has taken over the mysterious death case of Bollywood actor Sushant Singh Rajput from the Mumbai Police and has been probing it extensively. While Rhea Chakraborty is expected to return for the fifth round of questioning today, the CBI has summoned her parents to join the investigation as well.

Title: Four PFI members held for inciting violence during anti-CAA protest in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

In December 2019, the Uttar Pradesh Police had sought a ban on the PFI (File photo)

MUZAFFARNAGAR: Four members of the Popular Front of India (PFI) were arrested for allegedly inciting violence during a protest against the Citizenship Amendment Act in Uttar Pradesh 's Muzaffarnagar on December 20, 2019, police said on Monday.

Farman, Nafees, Idrish and Mursaleen were arrested on late Sunday night, SHO Anil Kapervan said.

Some pamphlets against the CAA were seized from their possession, he said.

In December 2019, the Uttar Pradesh Police had sought a ban on the PFI after its complicity was suspected in the statewide violent protests against the amended citizenship law.

UP Director General of Police O P Singh wrote to the Union Home Ministry, seeking a ban on the PFI after its Uttar Pradesh head, Wasim, and 16 other activists were arrested for allegedly masterminding the violence in Lucknow during anti-CAA protests.

Title: Rajasthan: MLAs told to vacate official houses in Jyoti Nagar, Jalupura
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Gates of MLA quarters in Jalupura area near MI Road, Jaipur.

JAIPUR: Rajasthan assembly secretary Pramil Kumar Mathur on Sunday directed all MLAs residing in Jyoti Nagar and at the MLA quarters in Jalupura to vacate their official houses in one month. The government is planning to auction the land at Jalupura and construct multi-storey flats for MLAs at Vidhayak Nagar (East and West) in Jyoti Nagar.

Meanwhile, the MLAs, who vacate their residences, will be provided alternative accommodation at Vidhayak Puri and Gandhi Nagar on a priority basis and availability.

The houses of Rajasthan Housing Board (RHB) will also be allotted to MLAs as per availability, the order stated. "This will be given as per availability and on priority basis," said an official on condition of anonymity.

"If the MLA chooses to reside in his/her personal accommodation or make arrangement for his stay, he will be given Rs 30,000 monthly," the order further stated. Around 30 MLAs reside at the Jalupura MLA quarters. It is proposed to build 174 flats for MLAs at these sites at a budget of Rs 300 crore.

The government is planning to auction the land at Jalupura and construct multi-storey flats for MLAs at Vidhayak Nagar (East and West) in Jyoti Nagar.

Meanwhile, the MLAs, who vacate their residences, will be provided alternative accommodation at Vidhayak Puri and Gandhi Nagar on a priority basis and availability.

The houses of Rajasthan Housing Board (RHB) will also be allotted to MLAs as per availability, the order stated. "This will be given as per availability and on priority basis," said an official on condition of anonymity.

"If the MLA chooses to reside in his/her personal accommodation or make arrangement for his stay, he will be given Rs 30,000 monthly," the order further stated. Around 30 MLAs reside at the Jalupura MLA quarters. It is proposed to build 174 flats for MLAs at these sites at a budget of Rs 300 crore.

Title: Rajasthan: MLAs told to vacate official houses in Jyoti Nagar, Jalupura
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Gates of MLA quarters in Jalupura area near MI Road, Jaipur.

JAIPUR: Rajasthan assembly secretary Pramil Kumar Mathur on Sunday directed all MLAs residing in Jyoti Nagar and at the MLA quarters in Jalupura to vacate their official houses in one month. The government is planning to auction the land at Jalupura and construct multi-storey flats for MLAs at Vidhayak Nagar (East and West) in Jyoti Nagar.

Meanwhile, the MLAs, who vacate their residences, will be provided alternative accommodation at Vidhayak Puri and Gandhi Nagar on a priority basis and availability.

The houses of Rajasthan Housing Board (RHB) will also be allotted to MLAs as per availability, the order stated. "This will be given as per availability and on priority basis," said an official on condition of anonymity.

"If the MLA chooses to reside in his/her personal accommodation or make arrangement for his stay, he will be given Rs 30,000 monthly," the order further stated. Around 30 MLAs reside at the Jalupura MLA quarters. It is proposed to build 174 flats for MLAs at these sites at a budget of Rs 300 crore.

Title: 'Mulan' Super Bowl trailer: Liu Yifei steps up as China's unlikely hero in action-packed new trailer
Content: Among the many teaser clips that dropped at the Super Bowl , was a new 'Mulan' trailer that sheds light on the invading army of “murderers” lead by a powerful witch Xianniang (played by Gong Li ) out to take over the imperial city. The trailer of the live-action film sees the rise of a new hero in Liu Yifei as Hua Mulan , the legendary female warrior who takes the place of her ageing father to battle it out with the invading armies.Packed with some gravity-defying stunts and explosive action scenes, this trailer gives the supporting cast featuring Donnie Yen as Commander Tung, Yoson An as fellow soldier (and Mulan's love interest) Chen Honghui, Tzi Ma as Mulan's father, and Jet Li as the emperor of China, enough time to shine.Fans of the animated 1998 classic will, however, miss the presence of Mushu, in this flick that will reportedly be based on the original folktale, 'The Ballad of Mulan'.Helmed by Niki Caro, with the screenplay by Elizabeth Martin, Lauren Hynek, Rick Jaffa and Amanda Silver, and backed by Walt Disney Pictures, 'Mulan' will hit theatres March 27, 2020.

Title: Curfew lifted from rural Lohardaga
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

File photo of a locked door in Lohardaga during the curfew. (Photo: PTI)

GUMLA: Curfew in rural areas of Lohardaga district was lifted on Sunday, 10 days after it was imposed following violence at a pro-CAA rally organised by BJP and VHP. A participant of the rally, Neeraj Ram Prajapati, who was hurt when miscreants hurled stones at them, had died during treatment at Rajendra Institute of Medical Sciences (Rims) in Ranchi on January 27.

In urban areas, the prohibitory order was relaxed for 12 hours from 6am, the district administration said. Officials said Section 144 of CrPC will, however, remain in force in the rural areas, thus putting a ban on meetings, processions and congregation of people till further orders.

The administration's move brought cheers to the residents, especially daily wagers, who are now back to their daily routine. Soon after lifting of the curfew, streets and local haats also abuzz with activities. Farmers turned up at markets to sell their produce while a large number of people were seen walking down the streets of the town area. A commuter in the town area said, "I feel independent once again."

Arbind Pathak, a local trader of Senha block, said, "We are feeling relaxed and met with our friends and relatives today (Sunday). I am planning to resume work from Monday."

"After a gap of 10 days, about 200 labourers went to work in Ranchi by train on Sunday as usual," added Ravi Prajapati of Kairo block in the district.

Lohardaga deputy commissioner Akanksha Ranjan held a meeting of peace committees of the town area and the blocks to restore total normalcy in the district. Appealing to the public for peace, she said, "The situation can be improved only through mutual cohesiveness. Don't allow rumours to spread."

SP Priyadarshi Alok said, "A probe into the January 23 violence is underway and all victims should come forward to lodge their complaints or grievances. No action will be initiated against any innocent people." Altogether 21 persons were arrested in connection with the incident so far.

Title: Better roads, enhanced patrolling: Officials
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

SECUNDERABAD: The Rachakonda police slaps cases on close to 100 people daily for consuming alcohol and ganja in the open in Uppal areas, said Y Narsimha Reddy , assistant commissioner of police (ACP), Malkajgiri division.

Several residents from Uppal and its surrounding areas aired their grievances at Times Connect, organised by TOI in Habsiguda on Sunday. Residents complained that there are two wine shops after every 100 meters between Uppal and Medipally stretch, encouraging consumption of alcohol in the open.

Admitting to rampant consumption of alcohol in the open, Narasimha Reddy said: “Every day, we fine 50-100 people in the Uppal limits. Despite having permit rooms adjacent to wine shops, many are seen consuming alcohol in the open. While we do patrolling in these areas, we will enhance the same.”

Few residents also raised concerns over youngsters consuming ganja near Uppal vegetable market at night. Residents claimed that on multiple occasions they dialled 100 to raise a complaint about the same. “While the response rate is faster, the police is unable to nab these youngsters as they escape as soon as they hear the police siren. The police needs to conduct silent operations to nab them,” said a resident.

Reacting on the issue, Reddy said they not only slap fines but also conduct timely counselling for people who are caught consuming ganja. He further added that a few days back, police had nabbed some people with one kg of ganja around the market area following a tip-off from the residents.

Meanwhile, residents sought establishment of a police station only for Habsiguda colonies. “Currently, Habsiguda and its nearby colonies fall under the jurisdiction of Osmania University police station, which is relatively far. We want the government to establish a police station in Ramanthapur , which is closer for perusal,” said Sudhakar Reddy , a resident.

Malkajgiri ACP said that a proposal to setup a police station in Ramanthapur has been lying pending with the government for the past five years. “We will be pursuing the matter with the government for the same,” assured Reddy.

Title: Isha Sharvani Luca: Isha Sharvani: I feel lucky to have a loving son like Luca
Content: When actress — dancer Isha Sharvani recently made an appearance at a fashion show in Thiruvananthapuram, where she has been living since her childhood, she surprised everyone. With her was her four-year-old son Luca, who won everyone’s hearts as he walked down the ramp with his mom. The handloom fashion event also marked the little boy’s first public appearance. Isha, who is also busy touring around with her new dance productionalong with her brother Tao Issaro, tells us more about her son, her dreams as a dancer and actor, life in Kerala and more.I feel lucky to have a son like Luca, who loves his mom so much. And I love being a mom. He is my partner in crime and we have a lot of fun together. He loves to perform rope dance and presents it in his own way like a long solo (laughs). He also wants us to watch him when he performs. I have never tried to impose any steps on him, but he learns watching us. When I wondered how he could dance so well at such a young age, my mom said that I used to dance on tables from the age of two, whenever I heard music or when we were in restaurants.At his first public appearance, Luca was a bit shy and nervous, probably as it was his first time seeing so many lights and cameras.Photo Courtesy: Satheeshan KaricheriIsha with her son, LucaI am a fearlessly independent woman. I am financially stable, I raise my child on my own, even doing chores like cooking and cleaning. Whether you are a single parent or not, raising a child is a beautiful experience which we learn a lot from. Children are innocent and have a beautiful perspective on this world. As parents, we can care for them, but I believe we shouldn’t think we know more than them. In my experience, all parents can learn a lot from their kids, alongside taking care of them.I am not saying no to films. I say yes when the right projects come along. The break happened as scripts that interest me haven’t been offered. Even recently, I rejected a script as it didn’t portray women in a way in which I was comfortable. I believe in equality and I’m definitely a feminist. My ideologies have also changed with age.Moreover, I have never been a career-oriented actress, though I love acting and have learnt a lot from the industry, working with talented artistes. My favourite genre is comedy and I love stand-up comedy routines. I will definitely try comedy roles if I get a chance.I believe womanhood means finding happiness within oneself. The most desirable thing for me is a life in peace and serenity. We can spread happiness when we are happy with ourselves. As women, we should feel content and feel our life worth living.The performance shows how a sari is weaved out of handloom. It is choreographed and conceptualised by my mother Daksha Sheth. Its music and direction are by my father Dev Issaro. My brother Tao Issaro performs along with me with the other artistes at the show. We have been touring with it across the world for some time now.The production highlights the individuality of sari and the art of draping it. It might sound like a simple subject, but through the dance, we showcase its journey from being a cotton pod to a handloom fabric, and how it is draped in various styles. Its music is also live.We love handloom and respect the efforts of weavers. That’s why I made an appearance at the fashion show in Thiruvananthapuram, along with my son. The act conveys a similar meaning.Thiruvananthapuram is home for me. I moved here at the age of 12. My parents love Kerala and they are very much part of the place and culture now. My mom is also active in a project that tries to save Vellayani Lake.When I travel abroad, I miss my Kerala breakfast — idli and dosa. I also love appam and fish curry.For me, dance is many things in life. I started it at the age of two and now I am 35 years old. It is also a therapy for me. When I am stressed, I go to the studio and perform for one and a half hours. I come out with a smile and a relaxed mind. Dance, for me, is also an offering to the universe I believe in.I don’t do shows after shows. In 2020, I am planning two projects, which will be ready by the year end. One of them is an Indo-Spanish project and the other, and Indo-Australian project. I am also into a project that allows therapists to help people connect with their bodies, to de-stress, through dance.

NEW DELHI: North Eastern Railway has released the result and the list of applicants called for document verification for ACT apprentice training.Candidates should report at the Main Gate of the Principal Chief Personnel Officer’s Office, North Eastern Railway, Gorakhpur-273012 at the reporting date & time mentioned against their names. Candidates reporting late will not be entertained.Names of the candidates in the list are given in the order of their Roll Numbers.Candidates must bring the following documents while reporting for Document Verification:A printed copy of the online application form.High School mark sheet in original and a photocopy.ITI Certificate in original and a photocopy.Medical Fitness Certificate issued by an Authorized Medical Officer in the format published on NE Railway’s website.A valid photo ID Card in original and a photocopy.Two latest coloured photo.Apart from the above, following certificates must be brought for various reservation categoriesCaste Certificate in original and in photocopy.Disability certificate, if any, in original and a photocopy.Service Certificate/ Ward Certificate of Ex-Servicemen/Armed Force in original and a photocopy.A Candidates have been called for the Document Verification in double of the vacancies. Title: Union Budget 2020: Centre may spend Rs 500 crore- 1,000 crore for tribal museum, says Jayant Sinha
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Jayant Sinha

RANCHI: BJP MP from Hazaribag and former Union minister of state, Jayant Sinha , on Sunday said the Centre is expected to spend anywhere between Rs 500 crore and Rs 1,000 crore for setting up of a world-class tribal museum in Ranchi.

In her budget speech on Saturday, Union finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced support for a tribal museum in the Jharkhand capital.

Sinha said, "You must have seen the Patna museum which is built at a cost of Rs 500 crore to Rs 1,000 crore. The Centre has plans to investment that much amount to install a state-of-the-art facility to showcase the state tribal's rich history, culture and art. Once ready, it will be one of the global tourist magnets."

Speaking to reporters at the BJP office en route to Hazaribag, Sinha said the Union Budget 2020 has many other positives for Jharkhand. Citing examples, he said the Centre has increased the tribal budget to about Rs 54,000 crore, including Rs 1,200 crore special grant to the Union ministry of tribal affairs. "Jharkhand being one of the tribal-dominated states will get benefits and the prospects of Adivasi welfare here is very good," he said.

On the Centre's 'Udaan' scheme, a regional air connectivity scheme, Sinha said with the announcement of 100 more airports under this mission, Jharkhand too stands to benefit from the project. Sinha, who served as MoS (civil aviation) when this scheme was launched, said, "Airports in Jamshedpur, Bokaro and Deoghar are already announced. Work on another in Dhanbad is expected to start soon while revival of another airstrip is awaited. Daltonganj and Hazaribag, too, will now be covered with this scheme and will put the state's remotest district on the aviation map."

He also hailed Sitharaman's announcement to link every district with a medical college. "A state like Jharkhand stands to get benefits the most under this scheme," he said and added, "The Centre's fiscal assistance to Jharkhand in the recent years has increased to Rs 30,000 crore. Moreover, funds will continue to flow to the state's coffers from various central, state-sponsored schemes and other sources to help it grow further."

Title: Harbhajan makes his debut as a lead actor
Content: After impressing the audience with his stellar performance in 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' as Udaybhan Singh Rathore, Saif Ali Khan is all set to step into the shoes of another negative character. The talented actor will be going face-to-face with Prabhas in Om Raut's upcoming film 'Adipurush'.Saif, who started his career with 'Parampara' in 1993 has gone on to deliver several blockbusters on the silver screen. The versatile actor, who is known for taking up challenging and entertaining roles, has always managed to do justice to his characters. While the news of Saif stepping in as Lankesh in Adipurush' has got fans excited, we take a look at the dark and negative characters which the skilled actor has essayed on the silver screen.

Title: Reopen U-turns, traffic signals at key junctions, demand residents
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

SECUNDERABAD: Voices to reopen U-turn under the Habsiguda-Tarnaka flyover turned louder as residents sought smoother flow of traffic from Uppal towards Secunderabad . Residents raised serious concerns over traffic issues that plague areas such as Tarnaka, Habsiguda , Uppal main road among others.

The Hyderabad traffic police had closed the Tarnaka crossroads in November, 2015, in view of Metro rail works. Following this, all the commuters travelling from Moula Ali towards Osmania University have to travel till the end of the flyover to take a U-turn.

“At a time when the government is encouraging us to save fuel, we are forced to drive further 1.5 km to take a U-turn. It’s time the traffic police reopens the U-turn to reduce inconvenience among commuters,” said CS Chandrasekhar, a resident of Karthikeya Nagar.

Commuters rue that the traffic conditions on the Tarnaka-Uppal stretch have worsened owing to plying of heavy vehicles during peak hours. Many claimed that auto-tippers and trucks carrying heavy goods are seen plying during school hours causing traffic snarls on the Uppal main road.

“There is heavy traffic near Habsiguda circle towards Nacharam as there are no dividers. Vehicles get into a bottleneck creating nuisance,” said Krishna Rao, a resident of street number 8 in Habsiguda. Few residents also urged the traffic police to install a traffic signal at Habsiguda street number 8 near NGRI for pedestrians to cross the road.

On multiple complaints and requests made by the residents, Y Narsimha Reddy, assistant commissioner of police (ACP), Malkajgiri division, said that the same shall be forwarded to the traffic division. “Installation of traffic signals is a decision taken up by the traffic police in association with the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation . We will forward al the grievances raised by the residents to the concerned traffic officials for their perusal,” said Reddy.

Title: Road maintenance programme the panacea to end commuter woes
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

SECUNDERABAD: GHMC officials assured the residents of Uppal on Sunday that their commuting woes will be reduced under its Comprehensive Road Maintenance Programme (CRMP).

The civic body officials said that they will look into the issue of residents living in the vicinity of a canal, located near National Geophysical Research Institute , Uppal Road in Habsiguda and 138.771 km of road under LB Nagar zone will be handed over to private agencies for upkeep.

The stretches that will get a facelift under CRMP are Habsiguda Cross Road to Nagole bridge, Meeseva NGRI junction to High Court Colony, Warangal Highway Junction near Balaji Sweet House to Chilkanagar Cross Roads and Nacharam junction.

Residents from Prashanti Nagar, Kalyanapuri and Beerappa Gadda also complained about bad roads in their area and the civic body officials assured that the roads will be fixed. “The roads in Prashanti Nagar, Kalyanapuri and Beerappa Gadda have been dug to lay water pipelines and the issue has already come to my notice. Even if the stretches don’t fall under CRMP, appropriate measures will be taken to fix these roads,” said Sikta Patnaik, GHMC zonal commissioner, LB Nagar.

“As part of CRMP, the private agency is responsible for maintaining central medians and take up other civic activities,” Patnaik added.

Under CRMP, 401 stretches — covering 709.49 km of roads — are being handed over to private agencies for a period of five years and the contract value is ?1,827 crore.

If a road is damaged, a deadline will be set and the assigned private agency will have to fill the potholes or take up road restoration work within the stipulated time. “If they don’t fix the issue on time, heavy penalties shall be imposed,” an official said.

Title: Afghan held for fudging documents for passport
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative image

VARANASI : An Afghan national was arrested from passport office in Varanasi’s Mahmoorganj while he was trying to procure an Indian passport on the basis of fake Aadhaar and voter identity cards.

The man who provided him fake documents was also arrested from Azamgarh.

SP, city, Dinesh Kumar Singh said the accused – Abid Abdullah (25) from Afghanistan and Sahbe Alam of Chamradih village in Azamgarh – have been booked under sections 419, 420, 467, 468, 471 of IPC and section 14 the Foreigners Act.

Singh said Abid was arrested on January 31 after passport office employees found his behaviour suspicious and alerted cops.

Abid said he wanted to go to Kuwati but as Afghan nationals are not allowed there, he decided to go there on an Indian passport.

He befriended Alam on Facebook and reached India on January

11.

After staying in Delhi for a few days, Abid visited Azamgarh to meet Alam.

Title: Did you know? Samantha outrightly rejected ‘Jaanu’ when approached for the first time
Content: After striking the right chord with a couple of soothing songs and a heart-touching teaser, the makers of Jaanu have recently unveiled the theatrical trailer of the film and the 2-minute clip instantly hit the bull’s eye with the crackling chemistry between the lead pair. Starring Samantha Akkineni and Sharwanand , this Telugu remake of the Kollywood blockbuster 96 is helmed by the original director Prem Kumar and bankrolled by prominent producer Dil Raju.The pre-release event of Jaanu took place on January 1 in Hyderabad and it was a grand affair with fans thronging to the venue. Speaking amid the electrifying atmosphere, Samantha stated that she initially rejected the film when producer Dil Raju approached her to play the part.“When Dil Raju approached me first, I outrightly rejected the film and said that I can't do it. But, thank you Raju sir for asking me the second time. I could feel that we were creating magic every day on the sets and recreating a classic film in Telugu. I feel that I should talk less before the release. But, I am sure I'll speak more about the film after February 7.”While Sharwanand termed Samantha as a dangerous actress who can easily steal the scene with her impeccable acting abilities, Sam said “Thank you Sharwa for being my Ram. If there's any credit to my acting, it should go to Sharwa. It is because of him. We made a strong team.”From the promos, it’s quite evident that music director Govind Vasantha has stayed true to the genre by composing mesmerising tunes for Jaanu. While the cinematography is brilliantly handled by Mahendran Jayaraj N, the editing has been done by Praveen KL. The film is set for a release on February 7.Helmed on a shoe-string budget, the original version of 96 opened to fabulous response from all quarters and enjoyed a glorious run at the ticket counters. Trisha and Vijay Sethupathi have played the leads.

Title: ‘Why RTA charging postal fee for docus handed over in office’
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

SECUNDERABAD: The collection of postal fee by the Regional Transport Authority (RTA) for documents that are handed over to the applicants directly at the RTA office stood out as one of the major grievances of Uppal residents.

Residents alleged that RTA officials are collecting ?35 as postal fee for issuing key documents such as no objection certificate, driving license clearance certificate and international driving permit.

“RTA is collecting ?35 as postal charges, but the same documents are being delivered by evening. Why should the RTA collect postal charges if the documents are being collected by 4pm in the evening on the same day? Where is this money going? We need to know whether all this money that we pay is going to the government, postal department or RTA? There should be a CBI enquiry in this matter,” said M Dayanand, a resident of Tarnaka.

They urged the officials to either send the documents home or stop collecting the postal charges. “The fee for most of these documents include application fee, service charge, smart card fee and postal charges. Delivering key documents through speed post was made mandatory by the government in 2008 to ensure that no fake addresses are used and this needs to be implemented strictly,” said U Yadagiri, a resident and general secretary, Shakthi Auto and Goods Drivers’ Union.

Accepting that the postal charges are being collected for documents that are being given to the applicants by hand on the same day, RTA administrative officer B Prasad Rao , said, “It is true that for some services the postal charges are being collected. Since this is a state-wide problem, I will take this issue to the notice of our head office and we will correct the policy.”

Title: Uddhav Thackeray: Did I ask for stars and moon?: Uddhav on severing ties with BJP
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

MUMBAI: Maharashtra chief minister Uddhav Thackeray , whose party severed ties with the BJP after the state elections, on Monday said that if somebody breaks a promise, "pain and anger is obvious".

"No, I did not get any shock," Thackeray said in an interview with Shiv Sena mouthpiece Saamana while talking about forming an alliance with NCP and Congress , and becoming the Maharashtra chief minister.

"I am a son of Shiv Sena Pramukh ( Balasaheb Thackeray ), several people tried to give a shock to me but they didn't succeed. This is a field where you have to accept in the beginning that there will be a bit pushing and pulling," Thackeray said.

He added that accepting the chief minister's post was not a shock for him and neither was it his "dream at any point of time"

"But I can say one thing for sure that I had decided to go to any level to fulfil the promise which I made to Balasaheb Thackeray. I want to further clear it that me becoming chief minister is not the fulfilling of the promise made to Shiv Sena Pramukh but it's just a step towards that. I will fulfil every promise which I made to my father," Uddhav Thackeray said.

"There are several types of shock. Did people like it or not, it is the important part. I have spoken on this issue (alliance with NCP and Congress) several times and even people have understood this. Making promises and keeping them are two different things. If someone breaks a promise, pain and anger is obvious," he added.

The chief minister said that he does not know if BJP "has come out their shock till now or not."

"But I have to say if they had kept their promise what would have happened, what a big deal had I asked for? Did I ask for stars and moon? I only asked for what was decided before Lok Sabha polls, when we decided seat distribution," he said.

He further said, "Maharashtra and the country are watching (who betrayed/shocked whom), I don't need to say much on this."

Soon after the assembly election results, Shiv Sena demanded rotation of the chief minister's post and equal power-sharing in the state government, which was rejected by then ally BJP. The weeks of political stalemate led to the imposition of President's rule on November 13.

Firm on its demands, Sena, the second-largest party in the state, did not hesitate to cobble up with the ideological opponents -- NCP and Congress -- and was given the chief minister's post.

Title: Prince Harry: Majority of Canadians reject paying for Harry, Meghan's security
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Prince Harry and Megan Markle

MONTREAL: A clear majority of Canadians feel their country does not have to pay for security for Prince Harry and his wife Meghan Markle, who have settled in British Columbia.

Seventy-seven per cent of people surveyed by Nanos Research, for CTV, believe the Candian taxpayer does not have to pay for the Duke and Duchess of Sussex because they are not in Canada as representatives of the Queen.

Canada is a parliamentary monarchy and Queen Elizabeth II is the reigning head of state.

Only 19 per cent of Canadians would not object to their country assuming a share of the security costs.

There has been no official announcement about the question of security for Prince Harry and Meghan, or who will cover the bill, now that they have officially left the royal family.

Canadian authorities have only indicated that discussions were taking place.

More than two-thirds of Canadians feel the privacy of the couple and their infant son will be better respected in Canada than it was in Britain.

But Harry and Meghan -- who live in Victoria, on Vancouver Island -- are taking no chances: last month they issued a legal warning to media over photographs of the duchess out walking her dogs with Archie, their son.

Their lawyers claimed the images were taken without Meghan's consent, the BBC reported, and the couple were prepared to take legal action.

Perhaps more worrying for the couple in the long run is that only 32 per cent of those surveyed were strongly in favour of maintaining links with the royal family and their country's status as a constitutional monarchy. Twenty-eight per cent said they were only somewhat supported that option.

And 35 percent would be more or less strongly in favour of abolishing links with the British monarchy.

The survey was conducted by telephone and online, with a sample of 1,003 Canadians and a margin of error of 3.1 per cent.

Title: Chandigarh: BMW car kills 18-year-old in Sector 9
Content:
The youth was riding the cycle with his cousin sitting pillion when the BMW hit them on Sector 9-10 road

The boy was killed by a BMW

CHANDIGARH: An 18-year-old youth was killed and his cousin injured after a BMW car hit their cycle on the road dividing sectors 9 and 10 on Sunday evening.The victim has been identified as Bikku Kumar, who belonged to Bihar and was residing in Sector 18. Bikku had arrived in the city in search of job a few days back and was staying with his brother at a rented accommodation in Sector 18.Police said Bike and Laltu Kumar of Sector 18 had gone to Sector 10 to meet a friend. They were returning home, with Laltu riding pillion. As they took a right turn from Sector 10 for Sector 9, a speeding BMW car coming from the Punjab and Haryana high court direction hit the cycle. Both fell on the ground. A PCR van took the two to Government Multi-specialty Hospital, Sector 16, from where Bikku was referred to PGI. He eas declared brought dead there, Laltu was discharged after treatment.The accused has been identified as Uday Singh Bhatia (21), a resident of Sector 44. His father is an excise inspector in Chandigarh.In 2019, 11 cyclists were killed in accidents in the city. On January 10, a 48-year-old cyclist was killed in a hit-and-run near Colony Number 4. On January 9, a two-year-old girl was crushed under the wheels of an SUV at Darshana Bagh, Manimajra. The girl was playing outside her house when the driver ran the vehicle over her while reversing. On January 4, an ASI in Chandigarh Police was killed in a hit-and-run on the road dividing sectors 27 and 28.

Title: Hina Khan lashes out at KRK for saying 'someone's made a film with her'; tweets ' I have worked my A** off
Content:
Krk Bhai,whatever ppl say about u, it's a fact that millions follow you and wait for your tweets and reviews. We ha… https://t.co/zFoIRctB75 — Karanvir Bohra (@KVBohra) 1580667274000

Every project I’ve got so far, every appreciator, every fan I have today. I have earned it with my hardwork n talen… https://t.co/K4UzbBcJMG — SAM #NoWhereToHide (@eyehinakhan) 1580668744000

#LetsLiftEachOther Instead of putting each other down for no reason.. I may not matter to u but I have worked my… https://t.co/BDd5Oml0rt — SAM #NoWhereToHide (@eyehinakhan) 1580669023000

Former Bigg Boss contestant and self-proclaimed critic, Kamaal R Khan has created quite a storm with his latest tweet on actor Hina Khan The actor mocked Hina for managing to bag a film and joked she will watch the film alone.He tweeted, "I got shocked to know that someone has made a film with #HinaKhan! Who will watch it? I am 100% sure that it will be watched by alone Hina Khan only! #BB13 #BiggBoss13."This did not go down well with Karanvir Bohra , who was quick to respond to the nasty post. For the uninitiated, he was also the first to defend Hina during the Cannes controversy.Karanvir shared that they might not have any godfather in the industry, but they have dreams. He praised Hina for making it so far on her own.The actor wrote, "Krk Bhai,whatever ppl say about u, it's a fact that millions follow you and wait for your tweets and reviews.We have no #Godfather but we all have dreams and a will 2 achieve. @eyehinakhan must be applauded the fact that she has come here by her own effort & god's grace..."This even made Hina hit back at KRK. She credited her hard work for all the projects and good things that have come her way.Quoting Karanvir's tweet, Hina wrote, "Every project I’ve got so far, every appreciator, every fan I have today. I have earned it with my hardwork n talent. And that’s what got me the film and THAT’S WHAT MATTERS. Not PR brokers, so @KVBohra people are smart enough to see through such stunts and acknowledge the good work."She further wrote, "#LetsLiftEachOther Instead of putting each other down for no reason.. I may not matter to u but I have worked my A** off to reach where I am today.. #AppreciationOrNoAppreciation #FromTelevisionToFilms #TelevisionHasItAll #WeDeserveAChanceToo."

Title: Education must for artistes: Ustad Anwar Khan
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Ustad Anwar Khan Manganiar was conferred the Padma Shri this year.

JAIPUR: Ustad Anwar Khan Manganiar , 60, is attending hundreds of phone calls since his name was announced for Padma Shri . People who congratulated him included Gaj Singh of erstwhile royal family of Jodhpur to Grammy award winners. Khan wishes that the next generation of the folk musicians of western Rajasthan should also go for proper education, to excel in life.

Khan was humbled while receiving congratulatory messages and phone calls. " Sab phone kar riya hain, sangeet ra premi hain saa (Everyone is calling me up. They are music lovers)," he said while talking to TOI over phone from Barmer. He was also felicitated at the Republic Day function in Jaisalmer and has been getting invitation for other functions in Barmer too.

Khan, a Manganiyar artiste, was born at Baiya village of Jaisalmer and now lives at Indira colony in Barmer. He has also been felicitated by the President of India with the Sangeet Natak Akademy Award in 2017. "I can't remember since when I started singing. Since it is my only bread and butter, so far there has not been a single day when I skipped singing," he added.

Attributing the recognition gained by the folk music of western Rajasthan to several Langas and Manganiyars, Khan has given his voice to a few Hindi movies including 'Rang Rasiya', where he was a playback singer with Kailash Kher. "The award is an honour for the folk music of western Rajasthan. This is also a recognition to the Langas and Manganiyars, who are selflessly singing and keeping the folk music alive," he said.

Having travelled more than 50 countries for his musical performances, Khan further stated that such a recognition certainly benefits folk music and the arts. "I have got many awards from other countries like Russia and Scotland. But an award for a folk artiste in his own country will inspire the next generation of Langas and Manganiyars to work harder and to keep practising their music and art," he added.

During the interaction, he further stressed on his community to ensure that the next generation of musicians should get proper education. "I am not very educated, as except for my musical craft, I have no other knowledge. So, if the next generation of our musicians will study well, they can do well for themselves and can earn fame and glory," he added.

Khan has only one regret in his life. " Angrezi awani chahijey, kaam avey hai (One should know English, it helps)," he added.

Title: GHMC to deploy drones for anti-larval operations
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative image

SECUNDERABAD: With residents of Uppal complaining that fogging machines just zip past their area, Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) officials took note of the exact locations and added them to their pin-point programme.

As a part of the programme, anti-larval operations are carried out in a locality every eight days. The newly-appointed zonal commissioner also promised bio-remediation and antilarval operations with the help of drones. The drones would be pressed into service especially around lakes and places where human cannot reach physically.

Replying to a question by a resident, GHMC zonal commissioner, LB Nagar, and additional commissioner, information technology wing, Sikta Patnaik said, “Fogging for a longer duration or staff equipped with fogging machines plying too slow can result in accidents. Fogging has to be done scientifically.”

She also explained the measures being taken by the entomology wing through drone and pin-point programme. GHMC entomology department officials emphasised that fumigation, in terms of fogging, was not the solution to reduce vector-borne diseases. Fogging would be done only on streets away from houses following the World Health Organization (WHO) rules, they added.

As per norms, if an employee carries a portable fogging machine (used in bylanes) on a bike, the speed limit should be between five km and 10 km. The vehicle-mounted machines ply on main roads and they ply fast compared to portable machines. “Number of vehicle-mounted fogging machines has been scaled up across Greater Hyderabad,” the IAS officer said.

Coordination with sanitation, engineering and entomology department by removing garbage points, identification of hot spots by taking epidemiological data between 2017 and 2020 were the other activities GHMC was taking up in LB Nagar as well as in rest of the city, according to entomology wing officers. “GHMC is also using eportal information to track dengue cases and take measures accordingly,” they added.

Title: Photo: Shivani Surve looks absolutely bewitching in her black ensemble
Content: Marathi actress Shivani Surve is an avid social media user and shells out some major fashion and wanderlust goals with her daily posts. The diva, who enjoys a huge fan following on the picture-sharing platform shared another mesmerising picture of her.Taking to the Instagram handle on the social platform, she shared a picture of herself dressed in an all-black ensemble has grabbed the attention of many. With minimal makeup and open tresses, Shivani has nailed her look with sheer brilliance.Meanwhile on the work front, Shivani's last release 'Triple Seat' did well on the box-office. She played a major role in the film opposite to Ankush Chaudhari and alongside Pallavi Patil . The film was released on October 25, 2019.

Title: Two arrested with 12.5kg ganja in Kochi
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representational Image

KOCHI: In a major narcotic bust in Kochi City police limits, around 12.5kg of ganja was seized from two youths in joint operation led by Palarivattom police and District Anti-Narcotic Special Action Force (Dansaf) on Sunday.

The accused were identified as Sreekuttan (26) of Illikkal House at Palarivattom and Ajith Anil (21) of Ambalaparambil House at Thiruvalla. According to police, the ganja seized from them was brought from Andhra Pradesh by train and was meant for sale to retail drug dealers in the city.

Police said that they bought the ganja in bulk quantity at Rs 600 per kilogram from ganja cultivators in Andhra Pradesh and sold at a price multiple times higher than the buying price. Sreekuttan left Kerala a few years ago after an estranged relationship with his family and went to Goa as staff in a hotel. It was during that time he started working for drug mafia.

“Though he reached Kerala last year and started working as a manager in a private firm, he continued his drug dealings. Anil was his colleague and they together carried out the illegal trade. Sreekuttan is an accused in a ganja case registered at South police station. Anil is an accused in a ganja case in Pathanamthitta. Both were under police surveillance for more than two months. They have been trapped after collecting information about their recent deals and travels,” police said.

A case has been registered under NDPS Act against the two accused, who will be presented before the magistrate on Monday. The police operation was led by narcotic cell assistant commissioner Biji George.

Title: Moscow is Europe's most congested city
Content: TomTom’s 2019 Traffic Index shows levels of traffic congestion in 416 cities across 57 countries. While Bengaluru earned the dubious distinction as the most congested city in the world, in Europe, Moscow remains the most gridlocked city with commuters there experiencing 59% extra travel time each year due to the city’s traffic problems.That equates to 225 extra hours stuck behind the wheel or nine days and nine hours each year. Istanbul is the second-most congested city in the European category of the ranking at 55%, followed by Kiev. Here's a look.

Title: Jaipur: Civil engineering students to help transport department to map roads
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

JAIPUR: Transport department will take help of civil engineering students in every district for the road mapping, identification of black spots, faulty curves and other issues related to the roads.

Their suggestions would be taken on record by the district-level committee headed by district collector. The transport department is mulling giving some stipend to these students.

In a meeting held at the transport office, a policy was made in this regard to take the help of the civil engineering students in the road mapping and other things related to the road engineering.

"We will identify one college and its students from the civil engineering stream in every district. These students would be asked to go for road mapping, identification of black spots, faulty curves and other issues related to the road engineering," said Rajesh Yadav, transport commissioner while talking to TOI on Sunday.

He added that these students would work under the supervision of the district transport committee head by the district collector.

"Already various units in the government are on the task of doing this job of road mapping. But the expertise of the students pursuing civil engineering would certainly facilitate us," he added.

In the meeting it was decided to identify colleges across the state in every district.

"These students would also be given special training of road audit and would also be given certificates. Also, we would try to give some stipend for the work they do for us," Yadav added.

Title: Lok Sabha: Opposition members raise slogans against CAA in Lok Sabha
Content: NEW DELHI: Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha proceedings were disrupted on Monday over the amended citizenship law and the issue of NPR.The slogans were heard as soon as the day's proceeding in the Lok Sabha started. Some of the opposition lawmakers invoked the shooting incidents that have happened in the national capital and were heard shouting, "Goli maarna bandh karo; desh ko todna bandh karo" (Stop firing bullets, stop breaking the nation).As part of the question hour , Shiv Sena Member of Parliament, Hemant T Godse, raised the first question over skill development upon which Mahendra Nath Pandey, Union minister for skill development and entrepreneurship, replied with necessary provisions and steps taken on the issue.However, throughout the question and answer, the opposition members kept shouting to express their discontent over different issues. They also demanded an explanation from the Prime Minister and asked for his presence in the house."Say no to CAA", "save our democracy" and "save our Constitution" were some of the slogans raised by them.Rajya Sabha proceedings too were adjourned for close to an hour after opposition parties sought to raise the issue of NPR and amended citizenship law.Chairman M Venkaiah Naidu first disallowed notices given by several opposition members to discuss the issue and then adjourned proceedings till noon after MPs belonging to the Congress, TMC, Left and BSP rose to raise the issue.Naidu said members will get enough opportunity to raise the issue during discussion on the Motion of Thanks on the President's Address to the joint sitting of both Houses of Parliament.The President's address had specific mention of the amended citizenship law and it can be discussed during the debate on the Motion of Thanks, he said.However, Satish Chandra Mishra of the BSP, Derek O'Brien of the TMC, T K Rangarajan of the CPM and other opposition members rose to speak on it.Naidu cut them short, saying he has already given a ruling on adjournment notices and cannot allow them to speak now.As other opposition members joined them, Naidu adjourned proceedings.In Video: ‘Goli maarna bandh karo’: Opposition raises slogans in Parliament over CAA, NPR

Title: Darshan starts shooting for his next on February 10
Content: Kannada star Darshan will be seen next in Raja Veera Madakari Nayaka , director Rajendra Singh Babu ’s historical drama, which will see him don the leading role of the last ruler of Chitradurga. The upcoming Kannada period drama, which is reportedly being made with a huge budget, is based on the novel written by author BL Venu . Actress and politician Sumalatha Ambareesh will also been in this film, in a pivotal role. The film has managed to create a lot of hype ever since a traditional muhurath was held in Chitradurga on December 2, followed by the film’s launch on December 6, and the announcement made on the script’s status on January 28. The first schedule of the shooting will begin in Kerala, where the Challenging Star will join the crew within the first few days. The actor is also said to be taking a three-day break in between to celebrate his birthday with his fans on February 16, and will get back to Kerala to resume shoot post that. Music director Hamsalekha will be scoring the music, while Ashok Kashyap has been signed on for the cinematography.

Title: Ujjivan Financial Services will declare its Q3 results today
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

NEW DELHI: Ujjivan Financial Services is slated to announce its third-quarter results today i.e. Monday, February 3.

The company reported over two-fold jump in consolidated net profit to Rs 93 crore for the second quarter ended September 30. Its total income increased 55 per cent to Rs 710 crore in the second quarter as compared to Rs 459.04 crore in the year-ago period.

In the past three years, the share price of Ujjivan Financial Services has gone down from Rs 424.25 on February 02, 2017 to Rs 372.85 on January 28, 2020 on NSE.

With its share quoting at Rs 370 (NSE) and Rs 369.80 (BSE) at 11:25 am on Monday, February 03, it would be interesting to see how Ujjivan Financial Services has earned in the third quarter of 2020.

Title: Jaipur: Police yet to find accused who shot dead teen
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative image.

JAIPUR: Karauli police are yet to arrest the accused who shot dead a teenager in accidental firing on Saturday. The police teams have been searching the area for the accused but tracing him in the forest area is proving to be a challenge.

Teams are conducting overnight searches for the accused who is suspected to be hiding there.

Teja Ram (16) was killed when Ramveer Gujjar fired in the air in an inebriated state. The incident is of Langra in Karauli district . According to police, the accused has a criminal record and would randomly fire in air but this time the bullet hit the teenager, who was standing on the roadside after leaving his animals in the forest area for grazing.

Karauli SP, Anil Kumar who is spearheading the search said, "Our teams have been deployed to look for the accused and we will not stop the search till we find him. The biggest problem is that there is a large forest area, to search inside that is time consuming. Teams have been deployed at various locations to look for the accused."

Gujjar has been involved in cases of dacoity and in the past also has fired in air after getting drunk. "We are on the job and talking to locals as well to find the accused's location. There were witnesses to the incident and their statements will also be recorded. Gujjar is also a local and there are chances that he might get in touch with some of his accomplices," added the official.

Sources claimed that there are very less chances that Gujjar might have gone out of Langra as there was heavy police presence in the area, making it difficult to get out without being noticed.

Title: Supreme Court begins hearing in Sabarimala temple matter
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Supreme Court of India

NEW DELHI: The Supreme Court's nine-judge bench, headed by Chief Justice of India Sharad Arvind Bobde, on Monday began hearing the Sabarimala temple matter and other related cases, involving entry of women into the temple.

Solicitor general Tushar Mehta told the apex court that the issues can be framed in the chambers itself. He stated that there is no need to frame the questions and other issues if relevant, in an open court.

After hearing Mehta's submissions, CJI Bobde observed that there are questions that arose in Sabarimala, and also there are questions that are there in other cases such as Muslim women's demand to enter mosques, and the FGM in Dawoodi Bohras and whether Parsi women married to non-Parsis lose religion.

Earlier, CJI Bobde had said that the court will examine the matter and hear the scope of judicial review on the point of religious faith and women's rights.

He had fixed a 10-day period for concluding the hearing on the petition seeking women's entry into Sabarimala temple, mosques, and Parsi Agiyari.

The apex court had on January 13 said that it will only hear the questions referred to in the review order passed by it in November last year in the Sabarimala temple case, which allowed women and girls of all age groups to visit the shrine in Kerala.

The top court had in November last year, observed that the entry of women into places of worship is not just limited to the Sabarimala temple but also includes issues like allowing Muslim and Parsi women to enter religious practice.

The court is hearing a clutch of petitions seeking reconsideration of its September 2018 judgment that lifted the bar on menstruating women from worshipping in the Sabarimala temple.

The apex court in a landmark 4:1 ruling had set aside decades-old restrictions on the entry of women of menstruating age inside the temple.

The verdict had sparked a series of protests across Kerala, which eventually led to the filing of several petitions seeking review of the top court's order challenging the authority of the court to intervene in a belief of the people.

Title: Hyderabad Metro: Locals seek parking at Metro stations, official says has been provided
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

SECUNDERABAD: The long pending connectivity issue of Hyderabad Metro Rail from Uppal to LB Nagar phase II project, parking and rainwater harvesting were some of the issues raised by the residents on Sunday.

Locals were concerned over the delay in commencement of second phase of works, which would improve connectivity to many areas. “We want to know when the officials are planning to connect Uppal to LB Nagar Metro extension as residents are still being forced to spend more money as they have to depend on cabs and autos for transport? We also want to know if there is any plan to extend the services from BHEL to Mehdipatnam?” asked P Shashi Kumar, a resident of Uppal.

They also raised concerns about commuting problems from surrounding areas of ECIL such as Kushaiguda and Nagaram. “Commuting from ECIL to surrounding areas has become really difficult for a many people. A Metro extension from ECIL to Tarnaka will benefit people staying on this side of the city,” added Shashi Kumar.

Residents suggested the officials to provide better parking facilities at Metro stations and also re-direct the rainwater pipelines into water harvesting pits in some places.

The HMRL superintendent engineer Sayappa Reddy said, “The Metro extensions from Uppal to LB Nagar and BHEL to Mehdipatnam are under phase II and they will be taken up as soon the works for that phase commence. We will also look into the issue of rainwater harvesting pits. The parking has been provided near all those stations where there is enough space.”

Title: Fan holds up banner asking if season 13 of the IPL will finally see Virat Kohli break his title jinx
Content:
V

RCB IN THE IPL

2008 7th out of 8 teams

2009 3rd out of 8 teams 2010 4th out of 8 teams 2011 4th out of 8 teams

2012 5th out of 9 teams

2013 5th out of 9 teams 2014 7th out of 8 teams 2015 3rd out of 8 teams 2016 2nd out of 8 teams 2017 8th out of 8 teams 2018 6th out of 8 teams 2019 8th out of 8 teams

Thinkirat Kohli and you will think of a fierce competitor who gives his 100 percent on the field every single time, both as a batsman and as India and Royal Challengers Bangalore captain.The number one player in the ICC Test and ODI rankings for batsmen is a force to reckon with for every opposition team in the world. Under Virat's captaincy Team India reclaimed the number 1 Test rank in the world. He recently became the first Indian to score 40 centuries as captain. He is also the most successful Indian Test captain ever with 33 Test wins under his belt. And the list goes on and on.In other words, Virat the batsman and the India captain has conquered the world.But, one tournament where Virat the captain still remains empty handed in terms of silverware is the IPL. In the 12 seasons of the Indian Premier League so far, Virat has played for only one team, the Royal Challengers Bangalore. And RCB have never won the IPL title.In fact, one of the big questions before every IPL season is will RCB break their title jinx and will Virat Kohli , who was appointed as the official captain of RCB ahead of the 2012 season finally win the IPL title?In the run up to IPL 2020 , it's not surprising that the fans have begun asking the same question. In fact one fan during the first India vs New Zealand T20 international in Auckland on Friday was seen holding a banner which read "13 kya hoga Kohli-ya?". A witty take on the famous dialogue from the blockbuster film Sholay used to ask the question - will season 13 be Virat's season?Virat the batsman has set the stage on fire in the IPL many times. In fact, the 973 runs he scored, with 4 centuries and 7 fifties in the 2016 season, when RCB finished as the runner-up, is a record that will be very hard to break. In fact, Virat is the leading run getter in IPL history with 5412 runs.But Virat the RCB captain is still waiting to break the team's title jinx.From the inaugural season of the IPL in 2008, the complexion of the Royal Challengers Bangalore team has changed multiple times. Many different batting and bowling combinations have been tried, coaches have changed, but the quest for the holy grail of franchise based domestic T20 cricket continues for Virat and his team. The sheer unpredictability of the team is perhaps best showcased in the fact that RCB hold the records for both the highest (263/5 in 2013) and lowest (49 all out in 2017) team totals in IPL history.So, will IPL season 13 prove to be the lucky one for Virat and his team?For most Indian fans there is an emotional connect also of sorts with RCB, regardless of which team they might support in the IPL. And that connect is because of Virat's incredible popularity across the country. So, most fans do feel bad when RCB struggle.There have been 8 seasons with Virat at the helm of affairs at RCB (from 2012 onwards). In that time the franchise has managed to finish in the top 3 only twice, finishing last on the points table in 2017 and 2019.T20 will be the flavour of the year in 2020 and 2021, with two back to back T20 World Cups lined up. In that context, the IPL will be a very important platform for cricketers from across the world to sharpen their T20 skills.If the team backs their captain and every player manages to step up to the plate, IPL season 13 could well see RCB under Virat Kohli's captaincy finally break their title jinx.

Title: Rajasthan: No respite from shivering cold, Fatehpur logs 1.5°C
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

JAIPUR: There was no respite from the shivering cold conditions in the state on Sunday when most places witnessed a dip in temperatures, especially during early morning and late evening hours. Fatehpur remained coldest in the state where a minimum temperature of 1.5°C was reported, the met reports said.

Attributing the continued dip in the mercury to the active northerly winds and vanishing of factors like upper air cyclonic circulation and western disturbances, Jaipur Met office said that similar conditions will prevail in the state for the next couple of days.

People in Jaipur woke up to another chilly morning as a minimum temperature of 8.4 °C was recorded in the city. However, bright sunny day brought minor respite in the afternoon as a maximum temperature of 22.2 °C was recorded in the afternoon.

Since no fog and mist was present in the morning the air, road and rail traffic from Jaipur was smooth.

Sikar logged minimum temperature of 4 °C. Sikar was followed by Udaipur where a minimum temperature of 4.3 °C was recorded, Churu 4.6, Pilani 5.1, Sriganganagar 6.4, Kota 7.5, Ajmer 8.8, Jodhpur and Bikaner 9.4 °C each and a minimum temperature of 9.6 °C was recorded in Jaisalmer.

Ground frost was also witnessed in some parts of the state which is considered good for vegetables and Rabi crops. "It is also good for the mustard crop which would be harvested during the first week of March," said an officer with the agriculture department.

In its forecast Jaipur Met office said that cold wave conditions will prevail in the state for the next couple of days. "Since no fresh revival of western disturbances and upper air cyclonic circulation is expected, mercury will continue to take a dip in the state," said an officer while quoting the forecast for the next 24 hours.

Title: Rajasthan: Child welfare panel member terrorises kid
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

The viral videos have raised questions on the manner of the minor’s counselling by the child welfare panel mem... Read More

KOTA: After police investigation gave a clean chit to the school administration on Friday - in a case where a minor boy was allegedly thrashed and thrown into a water tank by one of his class teachers - a few video clips went viral on Sunday, showing a member of the Child Welfare Committee (CWC), Bundi counselling the 7-year-old boy in an intimidating manner, sparking a controversy.

The viral videos have raised questions on the manner of the minor's counselling by the CWC member. The minor's father Chandradeep Singh alias Sonu Singh, a resident of Bibanwa Road of Bundi city on Sunday evening submitted a report against the CWC member Shobha Kasat and investigating officer Kurshed Khan , accusing them of severely torturing his son in the name of counselling and demanded to lodge a case against them under appropriate sections of IPC.

The parents of the minor boy, who studies in a private school in Bundi, on Thurssday last week had alleged that one of his class teachers had beaten him up with a stick and had thrown him into a water tank as punishment for not having covered his copies.

Besides, an audio clip has also surfaced where the private school proprietor is heard tempting the kid's father to sort out the matter through negotiation, while asking him not to bring police into the matter. However, police after investigation into the matter, on Friday gave a clean chit to the school administration.

The CWC member Shobha Kasat on Saturday visited the school and carried out counselling with the minor to verify the allegation of beating and throwing him into the water tank as punishment. In the video clips, Kasat is seen 'counselling' the minor boy, who is visibly stressed and alarmed, in the presence of investigating police official and the school staff members, but did not allow his father to be present on the spot and kept him out of the school gate. On being asked, the stressed kid nods to having been beaten and thrown into the water tank, but Kasat does not accept his response and goes on repeating her queries in a high-pitched tone.

Moreover, ignoring the kid's nodding, the CWC member continues asking him, "Doesn't Mahima madam (the accused teacher) love you and does she always beat you?" Later, Kasat, along with investigating cop and staff members, takes the minor boy in her lap to the said water tank, in which the boy was allegedly thrown, and asks him, "Tell me truly, did Mahima madam throw you into the tank yesterday and if she did, I will also throw you into the this tank, tell me the truth." Meanwhile, the investigating cop (Kurshed Khan) is holding a heavy and long beam to measure the depth of the tank and the minor further gets terrorized at the site of the beam. The CWC member then bends the minor into the water tank repeating the same, "I would also throw you into the tank."

When contacted, CWC member, Kasat also gave a clean chit to the school staff and the teacher saying the kid was never beaten and thrown into the water tank in the school and added, "I have submitted report to the investigating police official." (She being a member of judicial body is supposed to submit the report to the collector or to senior officials of the CWC). When questioned about not allowing the father of the minor boy in the counselling session, she said, "The CWC guideline does not allow the presence of parents."

"We have received the complaint against the CWC member Shobha Kasat and ASI Kurshed Khan and will submit the same to SHO for investigation," said duty officer at Bundi Sadar police station. Meanwhile, CWC chairman Kota Kaniz Fatima said minors in any kind of counselling, cannot be spoken to in a high-pitched tone, as he/she needs soft and polite treatment in a healthy environment and the presence of minor's parents is also necessary, so that he/she may not feel terrorized.

Title: Rajasthan: Child welfare panel member terrorises kid
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

The viral videos have raised questions on the manner of the minor’s counselling by the child welfare panel mem... Read More

KOTA: After police investigation gave a clean chit to the school administration on Friday - in a case where a minor boy was allegedly thrashed and thrown into a water tank by one of his class teachers - a few video clips went viral on Sunday, showing a member of the Child Welfare Committee (CWC), Bundi counselling the 7-year-old boy in an intimidating manner, sparking a controversy.

The viral videos have raised questions on the manner of the minor's counselling by the CWC member. The minor's father Chandradeep Singh alias Sonu Singh, a resident of Bibanwa Road of Bundi city on Sunday evening submitted a report against the CWC member Shobha Kasat and investigating officer Kurshed Khan , accusing them of severely torturing his son in the name of counselling and demanded to lodge a case against them under appropriate sections of IPC.

The parents of the minor boy, who studies in a private school in Bundi, on Thurssday last week had alleged that one of his class teachers had beaten him up with a stick and had thrown him into a water tank as punishment for not having covered his copies.

Besides, an audio clip has also surfaced where the private school proprietor is heard tempting the kid's father to sort out the matter through negotiation, while asking him not to bring police into the matter. However, police after investigation into the matter, on Friday gave a clean chit to the school administration.

The CWC member Shobha Kasat on Saturday visited the school and carried out counselling with the minor to verify the allegation of beating and throwing him into the water tank as punishment. In the video clips, Kasat is seen 'counselling' the minor boy, who is visibly stressed and alarmed, in the presence of investigating police official and the school staff members, but did not allow his father to be present on the spot and kept him out of the school gate. On being asked, the stressed kid nods to having been beaten and thrown into the water tank, but Kasat does not accept his response and goes on repeating her queries in a high-pitched tone.

Moreover, ignoring the kid's nodding, the CWC member continues asking him, "Doesn't Mahima madam (the accused teacher) love you and does she always beat you?" Later, Kasat, along with investigating cop and staff members, takes the minor boy in her lap to the said water tank, in which the boy was allegedly thrown, and asks him, "Tell me truly, did Mahima madam throw you into the tank yesterday and if she did, I will also throw you into the this tank, tell me the truth." Meanwhile, the investigating cop (Kurshed Khan) is holding a heavy and long beam to measure the depth of the tank and the minor further gets terrorized at the site of the beam. The CWC member then bends the minor into the water tank repeating the same, "I would also throw you into the tank."

When contacted, CWC member, Kasat also gave a clean chit to the school staff and the teacher saying the kid was never beaten and thrown into the water tank in the school and added, "I have submitted report to the investigating police official." (She being a member of judicial body is supposed to submit the report to the collector or to senior officials of the CWC). When questioned about not allowing the father of the minor boy in the counselling session, she said, "The CWC guideline does not allow the presence of parents."

"We have received the complaint against the CWC member Shobha Kasat and ASI Kurshed Khan and will submit the same to SHO for investigation," said duty officer at Bundi Sadar police station. Meanwhile, CWC chairman Kota Kaniz Fatima said minors in any kind of counselling, cannot be spoken to in a high-pitched tone, as he/she needs soft and polite treatment in a healthy environment and the presence of minor's parents is also necessary, so that he/she may not feel terrorized.
