Title: Naagin 4 update, February 2: Brinda marries Dev and plans to take revenge on Parekh family
Content: In the latest episode of Naagin 4 Vishakha intends to take the naagmani after fifty poornima nights. Brinda tells Dev , she is upset because he left the mandap and went to look for Nayantara Brinda blames Rajat for her injury. She says that Rajat never loved her. Brinda says she felt something when Dev left the manadap, and Dev says she might have feelings for him.Dev proposes Brinda to marry him.Nayantara goes to see Manyata , while she was asleep at the Shiv temple. Vishakha takes Nayantara to another shiv temple, and only Naagins know about the hidden temple.Brinda tells her parents she wants to marry him. Dev also informs Vrushali about his decision to marry Brinda.Vrushali does not agree with Dev, his father, Akash and Baa support his decision. After Baa announces that she wants Brinda to be the daughter in law of their family, Vrushali had no say in it.Brinda’s parents agree with her decision after they learn that Dev and his family are ready to accept Brinda.Both families give their blessing to Brinda and Dev as they get married the same day.After the marriage rituals, Vrushali goes to search for Manyata. Vrushali sprinkles the ashes that would make Manayata weak.Manyata loses consciousness and Vrushali takes her home. She hides Manyata in her room.In Dev’s room, Brinda notices that the ashes to weaken a Naagin are everywhere.She comes outside the house and prays to Lord Shiva, to help her kill Dev. It starts raining and Dev asks Brinda to come inside the house or else she might fall ill.

Title: Maharashtra: Voters’ verification and registration drive to conclude on February 13
Content:
Representative image

PUNE: Voters need to verify their names on the electoral list and register their names along with those of their family members on the electoral rolls by February 13, additional chief electoral officer Dilip Shinde said.The ongoing voter verification drive commenced on November 11 and will continue till February 13. A revised draft list will be published on February 28 following which suggestions and objections will be invited for a month.Two special drives/ camps will be organised on March 7 and 8 and again on March 14 and 15. All suggestions and objections received during this period will be decided by April 15. The final list will be out and published on May 5.According to the election officials, the aim of verification is to ensure a clean electoral roll as there have been several complaints earlier of names being repeated and wrong addresses on the list.The basic aim of the programme is to give an opportunity to voters to verify their names so that there are no omissions and errors, stated officials.The election officials have also appealed to residents completing 18 years on January 1, 2020, to come forward and apply for voters’ ID.The state has a total of 8,97,56,928 electors. As on date, the commission has received 2,42,94,623 requests. Of this, 7,65,606 entries were incorrect. Any corrections will have to be applied on Form 8 as prescribed by the commission.So far, 6,76,683 online forms have been received by the commission. Altogether 88,923 forms have been received offline, added officials.The Maharashtra government has appointed booth level officers across the state, and they are working to ensure enrolment. “We appeal to all parties to appoint their agents at booth levels and help in enrolment as they know their constituencies and voters,” added Shinde.A review meeting was held for the Pune division and all collectors asked to rope in more government officials to clear the new voters’ applications at the earliest. Voter who want to check their names or those of their family members on the electoral rolls may do so after keying in the EPIC numbers on the commission website. They can enrol the names of family members on electoral rolls by clicking on the ‘unenrolled members’ option.Alternatively, voters can also personally visit the common service centres or voter centres and complete the required procedure.

Title: What is bird flu? Can you get bird flu from eating eggs?
Content: Even as the Chinese authorities are working round the clock to contain the deadly coronavirus--which has since spread to 24 other countries including India--the outbreak of the fatal bird flu has also been reported in the country. This disease is also known as the H5N1 which is a type of influenza virus and is known to cause extremely infectious respiratory diseases in birds. This infection causes severe disease in humans and has a high mortality rate (60 percent, according to the WHO).A highly pathogenic strain of H5N1 bird flu has been detected at a farm in Shaoyang city of the southern province of Hunan in China.According to a report, more than 4,500 chickens died on the farm where the outbreak was first reported. Hence, the Chinese government has culled 17,828 chickens as a precautionary measure. The World Health Organization has stated that even though H5N1 can be transmitted to humans, it does not infect them easily.The Bird flu disease, as the name suggests is a strain of virus which affects birds including chicken, ducks and other poultry and wild birds.This disease is also known as the H5N1 virus and causes severe respiratory infection in birds. It is known to spread in humans through contact with infected bird feces and their other bodily secretions. The outbreak of bird flu has occurred in Hunan, which shares its borders with Hubei--the epicenter of novel coronavirus 1. Cough2. Diarrhea3. Respiratory difficulties4. Fever (over 100.4°F)5. Headache6. Muscle aches7. Malaise8. Runny noseSince avian influenza (bird flu) can easily spread to domestic poultry, it is important to minimize the risk when it comes to consumption and/or handling of eggs. Even though there is no known case of spreading of bird flu through the consumption or cooking of eggs, it is important to remember:1. Cook eggs properly till their yolks are firm2. Do not consume runny eggs3. Cook poultry thoroughly at or above 70 degree Celsius to kill the H5N1 virus4. Wash your hands with lukewarm water for at least 20 seconds after handling eggs or poultry while cooking5. Use separate dishes for boiling or preparing eggs to avoid cross contamination6. Egg yolks should not be runny or liquid

Content:
Against his strongest enemy, His greatest battle, Up against a nation, RONNIE is back! #Baaghi3 trailer out on 6… https://t.co/wpBQv32F56 — Fox Star Hindi (@foxstarhindi) 1580707978000

After the massive success of Baaghi and Baaghi 2, Tiger Shroff is all set to bring triple the action to fans with Baaghi 3. The makers of the movie have released the first poster of the movie and it is as enticing as ever!Taking to their social media the makers shared the poster with the caption, “Against his strongest enemy, His greatest battle, Up against a nation, RONNIE is back! 🏻 #Baaghi3 trailer out on 6th Feb, Thursday#SajidNadiadwala @iTIGERSHROFF @ShraddhaKapoor @Riteishd @khan_ahmedasas @WardaNadiadwala @NGEMovies @foxstarhindi"The poster has Tiger Shroff facing an army tank with his back towards the viewers and a rifle in his hand.The poster has created immense buzz already and fans can’t wait to see the trailer which is all set to release on 6th February 2020.The film is produced by Nadiadwala grandson and directed by Ahmed Khan. Title: Maharashtra: ITI diplomas in agriculture from 2020-21 academic year
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative image

PUNE: With increased interest in agriculture education, the state education department has decided to launch ITI courses in the subject through the Agriculture Engineering Innovation Centres from the 2020-21 academic year.

Such centres would come up in various parts of the state, including Pune, officials said.

A meeting of senior officials of the state Directorate of Vocational Education and Training (DVET), deputy chief minister Ajit Pawar, skill development minister Nawab Malik, among others, was held recently in Mumbai when the decision to introduce ITI course in agriculture sector was taken.

A DVET official told TOI, "The idea is to set up innovation centres at agriculture universities and colleges in the state."

The ITIs have recently started offering diplomas in aviation, 3D printing, robotic welding, design engineering, auto electrical, among others. The Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship has taken a keen interest in developing ITIs across the country.

"The plan is to initially start the agriculture courses in two-three institutes and later scale them up. The courses will be helpful for rural youths clearing the SSC and HSC exams."

Title: Samikshaa to play Shravani in Moorugantu
Content: New serial Moorugantu which will go on air from tonigt at 9pm has Samikshaa in female lead. The actress was last seen in the movie 99 which is the official remake of the Tamil film 96.Shravani plays the role of traditional girl who falls in love with super star Vikramaditya. Shravani will be seen a traditional look in the serial. On the other hand, Vikramaditya is a popular actor who conducts reality show in search of a perfect girl to get married.

Title: Samatha gangrape case: Thorough probe led to swift justice
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: Meticulous collection of evidence and thorough investigation led to the conviction of three culprits in the Samatha case, where a woman from Yellapatar village in Adilabad was gangraped and killed on November 24, 2019. The three were sentenced to death by a fasttrack court on January 30 after trial in a little over two months, thereby silencing people demanding encounter killing of the accused or entrusting the case to CBI.

This case reaffirms that justice can be provided in courts of law if police are allowed to make use of technology and investigate cases without influence.

As the trial was conducted without loss of time, there was little scope for the accused or their counsel to delay the hearings. Farm labourers who had heard the screams of the victim and saw the accused leave the spot were the main witnesses and, based on their detailed statements, the court was able to prove that the three accused had indeed committed the offence.

There were other witnesses too in the village who saw the accused following the victim and also a kirana shop owner who saw the accused with blood-stained clothes. This coupled with scientific evidence linking the blood and semen samples of both the accused and the deceased clinched the case in favour of the prosecution.

Interestingly, the main accused had himself admitted before the court that he went to Yellapatar on the day of the crime, though he claimed that it was only to collect ration. Though the other two accused claimed that they were outside the village on that day, they could not bring to the fore any evidence in support of their claims. On the other hand, the prosecution had proved their presence at the crime spot.

Adilabad principal sessions judge MG Priyadarshini, who was appointed as the special judge for the designated fast-track court, described the case as a rarest of rare cases because the accused showed no mercy towards the suffering of a fellow human being and said that they behaved in a barbaric manner. Dismissing the mercy pleas of the three criminals at the end, the judge proved a point that the anguish of the society against such crimes will be shared by the judiciary as well if the system acts in a prompt and swift manner.

Title: BJP's Anantkumar Hegde calls Gandhi's freedom struggle a 'drama'
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

BENGALURU: Former Union minister and BJP MP Anantkumar Hegde is in the news again for the wrong reasons, this time for attacking Mahatma Gandhi and calling the freedom struggle led by him a "drama".

He also questioned as to how "such people" come to be called 'Mahatma' in India.

While addressing a public event in Bengaluru on Saturday, the Lok Sabha MP from Uttara Kannada said the entire freedom movement was "staged with the consent and support of the British".

"None of these so-called leaders were beaten up by the cops even once. Their independence movement was one big drama. It was staged by these leaders with the approval of the British. It was not a genuine fight. It was an adjustment freedom struggle," he said.

The senior Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leader also termed Mahatma Gandhi's hunger strikes and satyagraha a "drama".

"People supporting Congress keep saying that India got independence because of the fast unto death and satyagraha. This is not true. The British did not leave the country because of satyagraha," he said.

" Britishers gave independence out of frustration. My blood boils when I read history. Such people become Mahatma in our country," Hegde said in his concluding statement.

Title: Karnataka: Too many agencies muddle the process
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

CM BS Yediyurappa with Lakshmi Mittal recently

The Karnataka government is probably the only state to have so many nodal agencies to deal with investment proposals. There is the KIADB , Karnataka Udyoga Mitra , State High Level Clearance Committee ( SHLCC ), State Level Single Window Clearance Committee (SLSWCC) and District Level Single Window Clearance Committee.

While the government claims these have been created to speed up the process of setting up industries, they’re only delaying it. “A four-to-five year delay in acquiring land has become the norm,’’ say industry sources.

“These entities are only adding layers of obstacles to investors and is not really helping industries,” said a senior IAS officer.

While DLSWCCs are headed by deputy commissioners are empowered to clear investment proposals up to Rs 15 crore, SLSWCC, headed by the industries minister, clears proposals more than Rs 15 crore and up to Rs 500 crore. Proposals worth more than Rs 500 crore have to be cleared by SHLCC chaired by the CM. These entities have to meet regularly and clear proposals. But often, these meetings don’t happen as scheduled. “The delay starts from here,” said Vasant Ladava, industrialist and member of Karnataka Industries and Commerce, Bengaluru.

The single-window agencies involving representatives of departments like industries, revenue, pollution control board and forest are supposed to collectively give necessary clearances required for industries. “But, of late, they have become only project approvers without other responsibilities, leaving investors in the lurch,” said Ladava.

Title: BAFTA Awards 2020: 'The Irishman' actor Al Pacino trips on the red carpet
Content:
AL PACINO FELL??? WHYYYYY https://t.co/7EWk8u7dVy — haiz (@gretafiIms) 1580668983000

The 73rd British Academy Film Awards were held in the UK. The best performances and movies were nominated at the BAFTA . Stars put their fashion leg forward as they attended the event. Pictures and videos from the red carpet are doing the rounds on social media. But it was an unfortunate red carpet moment caught everyone's eye. Irishman star Al Pacino tripped and fell on the red carpet before he could pose for the shutterbugs at the event.The actor sported an all-black suit. He finished the look with a pair of sunglasses. In the photos, we can see him making his way into the event when he lost balance and tripped. We can see people holding him as he tried to get back on his feet. According to the reports. Pacino suffered no injuries.Check out his photos here:The actor is competing against co-star Joe Pesci, Brad Pitt in 'Once Upon a Time in Hollywood', Tom Hanks in 'A Beautiful Day in the Neighbourhood', and Anthony Hopkins in the 'Two Popes' for the Best Actor in a Supporting Role award. The actor lost the award to Brad Pitt.

Title: 1,700 cardiologists lose specialist tag after MCI order
Content:
Representative image

BENGALURU: Cardiac care has taken a hit across India with the ranks of cardiologists having shrunk. In all, 1,706 clinical cardiologists lost their specialist tag following Medical Council of India's recent decision not to grant approval for post-graduate diploma in clinical cardiology course they had completed between 2006-13 from Indira Gandhi National Open University.Close to 350 doctors from Karnataka graduated with PGDCC and 120 of them are working in the state."The objective of this course was to train physicians working in semi-urban areas in community cardiology to diagnose and prevent cardiac ailme nts. It was not meant to compete with medical colleges. The irony is that MCI is objecting to a course started by the Union health ministry. There is certainly some wisdom lacking here," noted cardiologist Dr Devi Shetty said."Most cardiologists live in cities and the worst affected will be patients in non-urban set-ups. In fact, the situation now is the same as that of 2006 when the course started," said Dr Shetty, who was among those who had designed the PGDCC curriculum.Dr Ravi Shankar HP, who works in Chamarajanagar government hospital and is a PGDCC holder, said, "I am proud to have saved many lives by diagnosing heart ailments among patients coming to government hospitals. I have been trained in clinical cardiology for two years from Narayana Hrudayalaya."Incidentally, the two-year PGDCC course was not a distance-education programme, but a post-graduation course conducted after an all-India entrance exam in 77 hospitals with separate cardiology departments. In Karnataka, seven hospitals in Bengaluru and one each in Mysuru and Mangaluru offered this course.MCI's major objection was that the training programme wasn't evaluated within one year of the course in accordance with the Indian Medical Council Act, 1956 rules. Ignou hadn't obtained MCI's nod before starting the course.The course was stopped in 2013 and the last batch graduated in 2015. No fresh admissions were made in 2014 and 2015. Disappointed doctors approached the Delhi high court, which in September 2019 asked the Union health ministry to take a decision in the matter. The court also directed MCI to consider Ignou's application for grant of recognition to PGDCC.However, MCI's board of governors concluded that those doctors cannot be allowed to work as cardiologists.Top cardiologists, including Dr Shetty, have written to the Union health minister to recognise PGDCC. The Indian Association of Clinical Cardiologists has also raised the matter with the Centre.IACC chairman Dr Rajesh Rajan said, "Due to non-recognition of the course, we are facing disrespect in society, to the extent of being labelled as 'quacks'. In some states like Kerala, the government has appointed PGDCC doctors in taluk and district hospitals as clinical cardiologists."

Title: ‘Love Aaj Kal Porshu’ trailer: Get ready to witness the changing dynamics of relationships
Content: Pratim D Gupta’s ‘ Love Aaj Kal Porshu ’ is a thrill ride through the many facets of a modern-day love story. The film, starring Arjun Chakrabarty and Madhumita Sarkar in the lead, has already grabbed attention for its romance-oozing teaser and the romantic track ‘Shune Ne’.Now, the official trailer of ‘Love Aaj Kal Porshu’ is out and it surely raises the curiosity bar without giving too many details about the narrative. Another interesting thing about the trailer is the eye-soothing cinematography by Shubhankar Bhar and the haunting romantic melodies composed by Arindom.Check out the trailer here:The trailer starts with Arjun Chakrabarty and Madhumita Sarkar playing a young couple who plans to explore a unique relationship based on hidden identities. Just when you there’s an uncanny similarity with Imtiaz Ali’s ‘Tamasha’, Pratim comes with a twist introducing a mysterious character played by Paoli Dam . From this point, the shocking turn of events ensures its way beyond a typical boy-meets-girl love story.The backdrop is a world which looks familiar but may not be so. It’s not a run of the mill love story, but the story takes an intriguing look at the changing dynamics of man-woman relationships against a riveting backdrop.Produced by SVF, ‘Love Aaj Kal Porshu’ will release on February 14 celebrating Valentine’s Day.

Title: balu varghese wedding: Balu Varghese Wedding: Balu Varghese and Aileena Catherin tie the knot in a starry ceremony
Content: Mollywood actor Balu Varghese and model Aileena Catherin Amon tied the knot on February 2. The couple married according to the Christian traditions. The wedding was held at Sr James Church, Cheranaloor, Kochi. Balu Varghese looked dapper in a black suit while his beautiful bride Aileena was decked up in a dreamy white gown and veil. The wedding was indeed a starry affair as Mollywood celebs like Asif Ali, Ganapathy, and Jean-Paul Lal marked their attendance as groomsmen for Balu. The grand wedding was followed by a lavish reception in the evening at Vallarpadam, Kochi.Balu Varghese and Aileena met during the shoot of Asif Ali's movie 'Vijay Superum Pournamiyum'. The duo fell in love and with the blessings of their parents they got engaged this year.Balu Varghese entered showbiz with Lal Jose's directorial 'Chanthupottu'. Balu shot to fame with his appearance in 'Honey Bee'. The movie featured Asif Ali and Bhavana essaying the lead and emerged as a box office blockbuster. The actor's most popular film as a lead is Omar Lulu’s directorial 'Chunkzz'. Balu's performance in Dileep starrer 'King Liar' also earned the actor a lot of fame.

Title: Kerala: Bus staff blocks ambulance, assaults driver for overtaking in Kozhikode
Content:
The incident took place around 7am on Monday

KOZHIKODE: An ambulance driver was manhandled by an employee of a private tourist bus at Eengappuzha near Thamarassery in the district on Monday. The ambulance was blocked and an employee of the bus was seen dragging out the ambulance driver.The injured ambulance driver was identified as Siraj. He has been working as the driver of an ambulance service that operates near Kozhikode medical college hospital.The incident occurred around 7am when the ambulance was on the way to pick a patient from Thamarassery region. As per the complaint of the ambulance driver, the tourist bus driver was trying to obstruct the movement of the ambulance by not allowing him to overtake the bus.As the ambulance overtook the bus at Eengappuzha, the bus stopped and an employee assaulted the ambulance driver. The Thamarassery police have started procedures to book a case against the accused person.“We have received a complaint from the ambulance driver and we are collecting the statement of the driver and other witnesses,” said an official with Thamarassery police station. The injured driver was taken to Thamarassery Taluk Hospital.In Video: Ambulance driver thrashed for trying to overtake tourist bus while carrying critically ill patient

Title: Rajasthan: Teachers and parents contribute over Rs 9 crore for better school infrastructure
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

The staff of the government school in Ulat village of Barmer donated Rs 1.91 lakh for the school’s uplift.

JAIPUR: Teachers and parents of students at government schools across the state have been able to collect more than Rs 9 crore towards improvement of school infrastructure.

In an effort to improve the infrastructure at government schools with wider participation from people, Rajasthan school education department organised a Bal Sabha along with the Republic Day celebration on Sunday where teachers and parents both contributed towards the cause.

Commissioner of college education Pradeep Borad , said that they are expecting the number to grow until the final calculations. "Till Tuesday when we calculated, this amount was around Rs 9.13 crore. We are expecting this number to grow. This is just our 60% of the calculations. This money will be utilised for the development of school for which villagers, parents and teachers have contributed money. At Bal Sabha, parents were requested to contribute for the school development," said Borad.

Many teachers donated their one-month salary towards the cause. Kailash Dan, headmaster of the Government High Secondary School , Ulat village in Barmer said that his school staff collected around Rs 1,91,000 for the upliftment of the school.

"At the Bal Sabha, we asked parents and public at large to contribute in the school and we will do our part. Five teachers in total contributed their one-month salary to the school. We have taken so much from the school and these students have given us so much love and affection. One month salary is not much," said Kailash.

Kailash said that his school needs four classrooms, furniture and other school amenities. Officials at the education department said that this step will increase school's accountability as then parents will be able to question a particular school directly on infrastructure and more.

School education minister Govind Singh Dotasra also tweeted about the contribution stating he is full of pride looking at the huge amount of contribution from the people for improving the school infrastructure. Around 25 lakh people attended the Bal Sabha celebrations across state on Sunday. Around 15,000 schools are yet to update their collection at the Shala Darpan portal.

Title: Watch Jeeva Hoovagide from tonight
Content: Get set to watch the new serial Jeeva Hoovagide from tonight at 9pm. The serial will be aired from Monday to Friday at 9pm. The serial is produced by Raghavendra Rajkumar under Vajreshwari combines. The project is directed by Malatesh.The plot revolves around two characters Madan and Madhu who falls in love, but two families share long standing rivalry which becomes a major obstacle for their love. Girish babu is the editor . Mannju and Ravi are cinematographers.

Title: Umar Akmal faces sanctions for misbehaving during fitness test: Report
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

(Getty Images)

KARACHI: Pakistan's out-of-favour wicketkeeper Umar Akmal could face disciplinary action after he reportedly asked a trainer "where is the fat" while exposing himself completely during a fitness test.

The matter has been reported to the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) and according to an 'ESPNcricinfo' report, they are fully aware of the incident that took place at the National Cricket Academy and are looking at potential punishments for bringing the game into disrepute.

The junior Akmal, who is reported to have exposed himself in frustration after failing to pass one of the fitness tests, is now faced with the prospect of being banned from the country's next domestic tournament.

He is said to have asked a staff "bataye charbee kaha hain (tell me where is the fat)".

Fitness has been an issue with the Akmal brothers for several years now with Umar falling out with the PCB on the same grounds during Mickey Arthur 's time as head coach.

This comes at a time when the PCB, under the stewardship of former captain Misbah-ul-Haq , has pledged its commitment to maintaining high fitness standards not just in international but also in domestic cricket.

As per Misbah's instructions, each provincial side is required to regulate fitness tests on a quarterly basis.

Umar's elder brother Kamran, who himself skipped two fitness tests, before failing in nearly all departments when he finally did take one, said the incident at the NCA was simply a "misunderstanding".

Once seen as a bright prospect, Umar scored a century on Test debut against New Zealand in 2009, and remained a regular feature for some years until poor form and fitness led to him being dropped in favour of Sarfaraz Ahmed .

In 16 Tests, Umar made 1003 runs with one century and six fifties. While in 121 ODIs, he has 3194 runs with two centuries -- the best being 102 not out.

In 84 T20 Internationals, Akmal has made 1690 runs with the highest score of 94 and eight half-centuries to his name.

Title: HONOR 9X and Kirin 710F - Killer combo for the perfect mid-range smartphone
Content: What do you look for while buying a smartphone? Impressive camera set-up, bankable battery backup, sufficient internal storage? While we compare and analyse all these features, most of us ignore the most important feature that makes or breaks a phone - its processor. From the quick and quality processing of our pictures to smoother interface and overall trusting performance, the core features of any smartphone are decided by its processor. And one brand that has aced this arena has to be HONOR. Backed by its trusted and impeccable HiSilicon Kirin series, HONOR phones have been known for their smooth user experience.The latest addition in this kitty is the HONOR 9X , backed by the revamped HiSilicon Kirin 710F chipset. The phone, which launched on January 14, 2020 has been pushing people to be #UpForXtra and is packed with Xtraordinary features in every front. But before we delve into everything that users are loving about the HONOR 9X, let’s explore the chipset that makes this extraordinary phone truly exceptional - the Kirin 710F.The Kirin 710F ensures that the chip has more transistors in place, without actually increasing the space occupied by the chipset. Built on the 12nm process node, the Kirin 710F chipset is smaller as compared to its predecessor, the Kirin 659. This compact chipset gives more space for phone-manufacturers to amp up other components like battery backup, number of cameras, among others.The processor of your phone is especially important for serious gamers who are always on the lookout for smooth and lag-free gaming sessions. The Kirin 710F comes with ARM Mali G5 GPU and supports GPU Turbo 3.0 technology that enables a faster and smoother gaming experience. The touch input latency in this software is also reduced by 36%, ensuring that the phone responds instantly at your touch, without lagging.GPU Turbo 3.0 technology supports 4D vibration feedback, which will give you a console-like feel while playing on your phone, on the go. The graphics processor is armoured with a game app that block calls and other notifications and ensures that you have an undistracted gaming session.While the lag-free and distraction-less gaming experience may seem like the dream for many, some may rightly question the possibility of speedy connections while on the go. The Kirin 710F delivers in this front with the dual-4G VoLTE support. This ensures that the network on your second SIM slot does not fall back to 3G or 2G. The chipset also offers an upload speed of up to 150MBPS and download speed of 600 MBPS, so you are always connected and can easily download or update your apps and games.The Kirin 710F chipset is designed to support AI scene recognition, which facilitates the phone to recognise 500 scenes in 22 categories. This feature adds to the phone camera’s ability to distinguish the products in focus and sharpens the picture output. With such a vast range of abilities, the chipset uses Machine Learning to detect the product in focus, sets the tone, and adjusts the shooting mode to deliver professional quality pictures. Further, the Kirin 710F chipset ensures that the face-unlock feature in your smartphone is not misused. The AI feature detects if your eyes are open or closed, and based upon it, permits or restricts access to the phone.One of the biggest issues that users often face with smartphones has to be the lag issues that begin early on. Your phone can have the best camera set-up or enough space to download your favourite games, but if the processor messes things up, you are bound to be left with a phone that hangs on camera mode or losing games, just because of the lagging phase.With the Kirin 710F’s octa-core processor, this becomes a thing of the past. Kirin 710F boasts of four Cortex-A73 cores clocked at 1.7 GHz, which ensures smoother switches between apps, better performance during gaming and quicker access to apps. These efficiency cores also keep a check on your data usages while streaming videos or browsing social media.From its octa-core processor that ensures smoother performances to the CPU Turbo 3.0 that acts as a blessing for all gaming enthusiasts, Kirin 710F truly makes sure that your phone is reliable in every front. And now that we know what makes this processor out of the ordinary, its time to talk about the device that it is powering – the HONOR 9X. Its trusting 4000mAh battery combined with Kirin 710F’s power- efficient feature, the exemplary triple camera (48MP + 8MP +2 MP) set up that captures everything in great detail, all makes this phone a perfect choice.Priced at Rs 13,999 for the 4GB RAM variant and Rs 16,999 for the 6GB variant, the HONOR 9X is available online on Flipkart. The phone comes in two colour options - Midnight Black and Sapphire Blue and has been on sale from 19January. So, if you are on the lookout for a phone whose processor is here to deliver on every front, HONOR 9X is the choice for you!

Title: Pune: Police zero in on five gangs in over 15 ATM theft cases
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative image

PUNE: Police have identified five gangs of criminals involved in the string of cash thefts from automated teller machines (ATM) across Pimpri Chinchwad in the past few months.

About 16 cases of ATM cash thefts have been registered with the Pimpri Chichwad police. In some cases, the suspects had cut the ATMs with gas cutters. There have been instances of the thieves dragging away the ATMs with sports utility vehicles and ropes. Of all these cases, only one has been detected so far.

Pimpri Chinchwad additional commissioner of police Ramnath Pokale said “We have taken up the cases seriously and formed a special investigation team (SIT) to track down the thieves.”

He said, “The police have done a detailed study of all the thefts and examined the modus operandi of the suspects — like the time they strike and their operation areas. We are taking preventive actions on the basis of the study.”

Pokale told TOI that the probe has so far revealed involvement of five gangs in the thefts. “Three gangs are from some other cities of Maharashtra and two are from outside the state,” he said.

The police have sent their teams to Haryana and Rajasthan to track down the thieves. “The remaining three gangs are from Nashik, Ahmednagar and Kolhapur. Our teams have been sent to those cities as well,” Pokale said.

The police have identified eight points the suspects used either to enter Pimpri Chinhcwad or escape and started carrying out nakabandi operations there. Assistant commissioner of police R R Patil said. “Personnel from the crime branch and police stations are being used for the ‘nakabandi’ operation. Assistant commissioners of police monitor such operations.”

An officer said most of the ATM kiosks did not have guards. “In all the 16 theft cases, the police did not get any alert as the kiosks were not equipped with the siren facility,” he said.

Title: Kerala Water Authority offers 1% discount on online bill payment
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representational Image

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: To encourage online payment, Kerala water authority ( KWA ) has announced 1% discount for consumers who make e-payments without dues. Consumers can avail a discount of up to Rs 100 on a single bill. The offer will come into effect from March 1.

In addition, KWA has taken a decision to allow only online payment for all industrial connections and bills amounting more than Rs 2,000.

KWA consumers can pay online through its official website kwa.kerala.gov.in. They can use registered phone numbers or consumer ID or consumer number to log in for payment. There is also a quick pay facility on the website.

Currently, payments using the gateway BillDesk cost consumers an additional charge of Rs 7 + GST. KWA has invited an expression of interest from all banks so that it could reduce the payment gateway charges. KWA has also taken steps to include its payment under Bharat Bill Payment System so that consumers can use platforms such as Google Pay, Paytm and UPI for payment. The service will be launched on a pilot basis in Thiruvananthapuram next month and will be implemented across the state.

Only 18% KWA consumers use online mode of payment. KWA gets only 10% of its revenue through online payment, KWA sources said. Recently, KWA had begun distributing point of sale machines to its section offices to enable cashless payment.

Title: Asaduddin Owaisi: Nirmala Sitharaman’s budget speech was like a long movie
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Asaduddin Owaisi

HYDERABAD: Taking potshots at finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman ’s budget speech on Saturday that was over two hours long, AIMIM president Asaduddin Owaisi on Sunday said, “The speech by the finance minister was like a long movie where people desperately waited for an interval.”

He was speaking at a meet organised by United Muslim Action Committee (UMAC) for women on Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), NPR and NRC at Shivarampally.

Owaisi also mentioned the firing incident that took place in Delhi’s Shaheen Bagh. “An Union minister in an election meeting said ‘Desh Ke Gaddaro Ko Goli Maro Saalo Ko’ and within 48 hours a youngster resorted to violence,” the Hyderabad MP said without naming Union minister Anurag Thakur.

He also slammed Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath and said, “We will not forget the UP CM’s badla vow and the reign of revenge that followed, which resulted in numerous Muslims being assaulted and killed by the UP police.”

Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath had sparked a controversy with his speech at a public rally in Delhi recently where he said that anyone trying to open fire at those participating in Kanwar Yatra will be dealt with bullets.

“The CAA is unconstitutional and should be scrapped. Women have always been a huge part of the anti-CAA protest as we feel insecured about our future. We will show our aggressive side to sustain and maintain the anti-CAA movement till the Act is rolled back,” said Ayesha Rubina, AIMIM corporator from Ahmednagar.

Title: RPF plans 'dynamic' escort system to curb crime rate on-board trains
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative image

PUNE: The Railway Protection Force ( RPF ) has decided to shake up its system of escorting trains in a bid to break pattern and curb crime on long-haul and suburban trains.

Under the new, "dynamic" system, the RPF will deploy escort teams at random and also on trains depending on the need. Earlier, the RPF would only focus on certain trains originating from the Pune division.

"At present, there are 32 trains, including six suburbans, in which the RPF personnel provide security. However, more than 100 trains originate from the Pune division. The selected trains and sections had a track record of offences. Now we plan to factor in the crime pattern in the remaining trains and deploy escort teams," divisional security commissioner Arun Tripathi told TOI.

"We plan to conduct a weekly analysis to identify trains that require security. RPF personnel can board any train during the week. The escort team would not limit itself to a specific number of trains. After one week, a new set of trains would be selected," he said.

The move, Tripathi said, would act as a deterrent to criminals who tend to target trains they know would be devoid of any escort.

Title: Vishnu Unnikrishnan wedding pictures: Vishnu Unnikrishnan Marriage: 'Kattappanayile Rithwik Roshan' actor Vishnu Unnikrishnan gets hitched to Aishwarya
Content: 'Kattappanayile Rithwik Roshan' fame actor Vishnu Unnikrishnan got hitched to fiancée Aishwarya on February 2. The duo tied the knot in a traditional Hindu wedding held at Kothamangalam, Ernakulam. Vishnu Unnikrishnan chose a traditional white mundu and shirt for the ceremony while his beautiful bride Aishwarya was decked in a red bridal saree paired with temple jewelry. Only the couple’s family and close friends attended the wedding which was followed by a lavish reception at Kaloor, Kochi.Vishnu entered showbiz as a child artist with 2003 release 'Ente Veedu Appuvinteyum'. The actor later appeared in a few movies including 'Raapakal' and 'Palunku', essaying small characters. Vishnu rose to fame with 'Kattappanayile Rithwik Roshan' wherein he played the lead for the first time. The movie directed by Nadirshah was a career-defining moment for Vishnu Unnikrishnan. He wasn't the conventional hero, but his talent and acting skills earned him a lot of fans. 'Kattappanayile Rithwik Roshan' was also scripted by the actor along with Bibin George. Apart from 'Kattappanayile Rithwik Roshan' Vishnu Unnikrishnan has also penned the script for movies like 'Amar Akbar Anthony' and 'Oru Yamandan Premakadha’. The script of 'Amar Akbar Anthony' was highly praised and the movie emerged as a box-office hit. Meanwhile, Vishnu Unnikrishnan was last seen in Mohanlal starrer 'Big Brother.

Title: Protected species being sold illegally in Nalgonda
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: After the city’s Murgi Chowk, illegal trade of exotic and protected species of birds and animals have now flourished in Nalgonda’s Ramgiri market. A visit by TOI revealed that protected species of birds such as whitebreasted waterhen, grey francolins, partridges, quails, and heirs are openly sold at the market.

“There seems to be no end to illegal trade of species protected under the Wildlife Protection Act,” said Mirza Kareem Baig, a member of the Forest and Wildlife Protection Society (FAWPS).

“People purchase birds like partridges, francolins and waterhens for consumption and in rare cases they are used for black magic,” Baig said, adding, “The meat of a monitor lizard, especially its tongue and liver, are believed to be aphrodisiacs. However, this is just a myth.”

When contacted, divisional forest officer of Nalgonda district , Shantha Rao said, “Wewilldefinitely take action against those selling these birds and animals in Ramgiri market as well.”

Title: Experts welcome decision to develop 100 UDAN airports
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

PUNE: Even though some concerns persist, experts have largely hailed the Centre’s decision to develop 100 airports for the regional connectivity scheme by 2024.

“UDAN, being a futuristic mega project, is expected to experience teething troubles. That 250 routes are operational — with 45 unserved/underserved airports being operationalized — since its launch in April 2017 is an achievement,” aviation analyst and expert Dhairyashil Vandekar said.

In Maharashtra, flights have started in just 28 of 48 routes. Of the six routes under UDAN for the Pune airport, only two are operational. IndiGo said it will start its long-delayed flight to Prayagraj from March 5/ An official in the know said the scheme needs a rejig. “Where is the guarantee that more flights start from the 100 airports that will be developed? Airlines have bid for existing routes, but have not started flights on many of them. There clearly are problems with the scheme, which the Centre needs to identify,” the official said.

“About 1/3 of previous UDAN allocations are operational. Prior to building 100 more airports, we need to fix and operationalize the ones already built,” Sanjiv Kapoor, former chief commercial officer of Vistara, tweeted on Sunday.

In Solapur, for instance, a sugar factory’s chimney is on the flight path and the problem remains unresolved. Solapur was assigned two RCS routes.

Availability of slots is another issue, an airline official said, adding, that recent problems, such as the grounding of Airbus A320 NEO and Boeing 737 Max, and delay in procurement of aircraft, played a part. “Almost all airlines have been hit. New flights can be started when one has a proper fleet size,” the official said.

“With proper planning and monitoring, the scheme should take off and serve its purpose in due course,” Vandekar said.

Title: Lack of strict action leading to rise in dowry cases in Telangana, say activists
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: With cases of dowry-related harassment being reported frequently across the state, activist say that lack of stringent action against the offenders is pushing women backintothehellholesthey are fighting to escape from.

A housewife attempted suicide by consuming pesticide in Medipally after being harassed for additional dowry. The incident was reported on Saturday.

In another incident, a 28-year-old newly-married woman recently committed suicide in Vanasthalipuram after she was allegedly harassed by her husband and in-laws. A dowry death case was registered. At the time of the wedding, the victim’s family had given Rs 2 lakh cash and jewellery as dowry. But soon after marriage, the groom’s family began harassing her for more dowry.

Data provided by the city police reveal there has been a steady increase in dowry death cases since 2018. Recently city police commissioner Anjani Kumar tweeted saying Bharosa centre has registered over 4,600 domestic violence cases in over three years.

“Couples are counselled when a domestic violence case is registered. At least three sessions are conducted, but the women can choose to register a case,” said a She Team source.

Activist Mamatha Raghuveer said even after victims approach cops, they are sent for counselling sessions. In a fewcases,women aresentback to their in-law’s house where they were physically tortured.

Title: Ke Apon Ke Por update, February 2: Joba fools Tandra
Content: In the latest episode of Ke Apon Ke Por Koel is under Tandra’s custody. Sapnamay and Tandra discuss their plan to take the antique statue from Joba . Seeing Sapnamay and Mitti forming an ally with Tandra, Koel feels bad.Tandra’s men bring Joba. The latter is shocked to see Koel, whose mouth has been sealed. She loses her calm and asks Tandra to untie Koel. Tandra doesn’t pay any attention and asks Joba to handover the statue.Joba and Tandra have a face off yet again. Tandra mocks Joba, who is accused of killing her son. She reveals how Joba was tricked by her. They cancelled the earlier meeting since Mitti informed them about Joba’s absence from the asylum. Joba stays calm and asks Tandra why she considers her as an enemy. They talk about past incidents where Tandra tried to harm her.Tandra reveals that she never got any importance ever since Joba got married to Param. She asks Joba to handover the statue and Joba does the same. Tandra mocks Joba and says how she made her a fool.To everyone’s surprise, Joba reveals it was her plan to meet Tandra face to face. She asks one of the men accompanying her to unmask himself. It is revealed that Suryashekhar is along with him. Joba also reveals she had instructed Koel to roam outside of her college so that Tandra’s men get a chance to abduct her. She further adds that everything was preplanned so that Joba can get Tandra arrested along with proof.

Title: Bengaluru: No more concrete in Cubbon Park revamp
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

BENGALURU: With Cubbon Park all set for a makeover as part of a project being executed by Bengaluru Smart City Limited, the focus will be on using eco-friendly material to preserve the park’s greenery. Deputy director of the horticulture department disclosed this after a consultation on the issue with walkers and joggers on Sunday.

Improved footpaths and walking/jogging tracks, nature trail paths, children’s play area and yoga centre will be built as part of Phase 2 of the Smart City project, said officials. The lotus pond inside the park will also be rejuvenated.

“The loudest demand at the public consultation was to put an end to concretisation and construction activities inside the park,” said Kusuma G, deputy director (Cubbon Park), horticulture department. “We, therefore, decided to place added focus on using only eco-friendly material in executing Phase 2 of the work,” she added.

Under Phase 1, smart display screens and LED lights equipped with motion sensor technology were installed at various locations inside the park. It was done by the horticulture department in coordination with Bescom.

Members of Cubbon Park Walkers’ Association, who were part of the consultation, demanded a boundary wall, more security and 365-day ban on movement of vehicles inside the lung space. The walkers said rules that apply to Lalbagh should be extended to Cubbon Park as well. They outlined their demands in a representation to chief secretary Vijay Bhaskar TM.

“Our main demand was no new construction or concrete structure must come up inside the park and its green cover be increased,” said S Umesh, president of Cubbon Park Walkers’ Association.

BBMP commissioner BH Anil Kumar, officials from the horticulture department and Bengaluru Smart City Ltd were present. Other works being executed under the smart city project include redevelopment of KR and Malleswaram markets, roads under TenderSURE model, clean-up of Ulsoor Lake and Sankey Tank and retro-fitting of KC General Hospital.

Title: Three held with banned psychotropic drugs worth over 1 crore
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative image.

JODHPUR: Three persons were arrested on Sunday for dealing in prohibited medicines used as narcotics and psychotropic substance. Police have also seized a huge haul of these medicines from four godowns of the dealer and registered three separate cases in two police stations under Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act.

According to a police official, there was a spurt in the sale of these medicines after a massive crack down against smack recently in the city.

"When it came to our notice, we began our investigation by interrogating many addicts in the city and busted this racket," the official said. An approximate worth of these medicines has been pegged over Rs 1 crore. Police have seized about 500 bottles of Codein syrup and 1.30 lakh tablets of tramadol etc. from three places, being used by the supplier as godowns.

Those arrested include dealer Ritesh Sharma and two aides Nitin Gaur and Mohammad Khalid, who had reached one of these godowns to unload the drugs during the presence of the police.

According the police, besides these medicines, many prohibited drugs had been stocked at these godowns, which could not be sold without prescription. A team of the drug control department also rushed to the spot and began investigation in the matter. According to the officials, these medicines had been brought from Ghaziabad.

"There was no record available with the chemist about these medicines. He was not having any license to deal with the medicines either", said an official.

The investigation revealed that chemist Sharma already had three godowns to stock these medicines and had recently hired one more place as there was an increase in demand for the drugs.

Title: ‘Raaji Achi’ from ‘Kora Paak’ is all about blossoming in love
Content: It’s the story of Dev and Priya who meet accidentally and fall for each other in no time. But here lies a twist; the couple has a problem between them. The rom-com promises to delve deep inside modern-day love stories.Dev and Priya can’t decide about their future together and whether they really feel for each other. So, Dev and Priya plan to stay away from each other for six months to find out where they stand. It’s a sweet romantic story which explores the issue of commitment phobia.This latest song ‘ Raaji Achi ’ from Souradip Banerjee ’s next ‘ Kora Paak ’ beautifully sums up the story and shows how love stories turn into thrill rides often. Santajit Chatterjee’s composition and Pralay Sarkar’ lyrics are backed by the refreshing rendition of Raj Barman Check out the melodious track here:Souradip’s rom-com promises to churn out a refreshing love story and the romantic track shows it again.The rom-com stars Paayel Sarkar and Sourav Das in the lead. It’s a romantic comedy which shows if one is true to his emotions and whether love survives despite the distance. Beside Sourav and Paayel, the film also has Anindya Chatterjee , Rii and others.Sourav, off late who has played some challenging characters, is also gearing up to form a musical band of his own as he starts his career as a singer.Meanwhile, Paayel’s latest release ‘Mukhosh’, a thriller directed by Argha Deep Chatterjee, has received critical acclaims.

Title: 'Basta' first look: Sayali Sanjeev looks like a dream in her bridal avatar
Content: Marathi cinema's popular actress, Sayali Sanjeev has been rocking the headlines with all the work she's been doing. Currently, the diva is set to bang 2020 with her three back to back films. Sayali's upcoming family drama 'Basta' motion poster has already created a buzz in social media. And to keep the excitement going, now the makers have unveiled the first look poster on their social media handle.In the first look poster, Sayali Sanjeev is seen dressed like a bride wherein she was seen wearing a nauvari saree with golden and red embroidery. She was indeed looking like a dream and it was difficult to take our eyes off her beauty in this bridal look.Sayali has always played a different kind of roles and characters with utmost ease and has the natural flair of emoting through her eyes. How will her sweetness bring profundity in character and intensity will be interesting to see and watch!.Tanaji Ghadge 's directorial 'Basta' is produced under the banner of Shri Ganesh Marketing and Films which is also produced by Sunil Phadtare . The film is slated to release on April 3, 2020.

Title: Curb consumption and get govt subsidy on rooftop solar plants
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representational Image

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: State government has cleared the Kerala state electricity board’s proposal to adopt plans that would limit the subsidy benefits for rooftop solar power units to consumers using only up to 200 units of energy a month.

The ministry of new and renewable energy (MNRE) has devised a Rs 11,814crore subsidy scheme for setting up 4,000MW of grid-connected solar roof top plants in the residential sector. The rollout of the proposed scheme is planned through state power utilities and is part of the central government’s target to achieve a cumulative capacity of 40,000MW from rooftop solar plants by 2022.

“From the national scheme, Kerala is set to receive assistance for 50MW capacity for 2019-20. KSEB can implement the project with indigenous schemes, provided the state government too agrees with it. Subsidy from the Centre would be passed on to eligible consumers interested in setting up rooftop solar plants in the size range of 2 to 3kWp. Though the allocation has been made for 2019-20, there would be an extension of the period for the project rollout, the nitty-gritties of which have recently been finalised,” said N S Pillai, KSEB chairman and managing director.

According to the scheme that got the state power department’s approval, benefit for consumers would be a financial subsidy ranging between 20 to 40% of the total cost.

For a 2 kWp plant with a project cost of Rs 1,08,000, MNRE subsidy would be Rs 43,200. While the consumer would contribute Rs 22,000 towards the project, the agency that sets up the rooftop plant would chip in Rs 36,000. KSEB would invest Rs 6,800 in a plant that makes 40% of its actual energy generation available for other consumers.

Depending on the capacity of the plant, there will be cascading changes in the subsidy benefits and investment. The life of a plant is expected to be 25 years.

Customer cost share would be 12%, 20% and 25%, depending on the plant size and scope. The board would soon start the process of choosing the beneficiaries. Consumers having monthly energy consumption from 150 to 200 units would benefit from the scheme.

Title: Young, enthusiastic volunteers begin greening Bangalore University campus
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Volunteers plant saplings as part of the Hero TOI Green Drive, at Jnana Bharathi campus of Bangalore Universit... Read More

BENGALURU: Morning walkers and joggers on Bangalore University ’s Jnana Bharathi campus were in for a surprise on Sunday. Hundreds of volunteers, mostly youngsters, who trooped into the fouracre vacant space behind the Sports Authority of India campus, were busy planting saplings.

The exercise was part of the Hero TOI Green Drive which added 20,000 saplings of different varieties on Sunday alone. Over the next seven days, more will be planted to make the campus richer by 1 lakh trees. In the coming years, the area will be transformed into a forest of sorts.

The volunteers were students from schools and colleges and members of NGOs and other organisations. Over 1,500 volunteers from Sant Nirankari Charitable Foundation took part in the drive and were led by their zonal in-charge Sunil Ratra.

An organiser said the saplings are desi varieties, including 30% fruit-bearing ones. “The idea is to develop the space into a biodiversity hub for birds and small animals. The saplings planted include guava, jackfruit, neem, golden shower and rain tree,” he added.

Vice-chancellor Prof KR Venugopal said the BU campus is spread over 1,162 acres and has around 12 lakh trees. “Still there are spaces that need greening. We are open to more such plantation drives,” he added.

Prajwal BP, student from an experiential learning school, said the city requires more trees for the simple reason that children like him need to breathe easy. “A biodiversity park like this enhances quality of life in a city which is fast losing its green cover,” he added.

Chandan Kumar Bhagat, a volunteer from SNCF, had come all the way from Ballari. “Planting a sapling is the greatest service one can do in today’s world,” he said.

The drive, which began in Delhi, has improved the greenery quotient of cities across the country.

After over 1 lakh saplings were planted across Delhi’s three biodiversity parks in 2015, the drive moved to Indore and Chandigarh where 2 lakh were planted in 2017. Next year, the drive covered Indore, Ahmedabad, Chennai and Delhi, and they went greener by 5 lakh trees. This is the first time that the drive is being held in Bengaluru.

During financial year 2019-20, over 2.3 lakh saplings were planted under the drive while from 2015 to 2019-20, the number was over 11.5 lakh.

Title: mark zuckerberg: This is what Facebook CEO says he will not do if had to start from scratch
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg in a discussion at the Silicon Slopes Tech Summit 2020 in Salt Lake City has said that if he were to start again, he will not pick Silicon Valley to establish his startup.

As per a report by CNBC, Zuckerberg said, “I do think, on balance, that if I was starting from scratch now I would not pick the Bay Area.” The report further ads that Zuckerberg feels that with things like Amazon Web Services , it has been made possible that tech companies can be build anywhere. Talking about the limitations of Silicon Valley, Zuckerberg said that lack of housing and a mono-culture make other regions more alluring.

At the same event, Mark Zuckerberg spoke about the direction in which the biggest social networking website of the world is heading. “We’re going to stand up for free expression. It’s unfortunate that this is such a controversial thing,” said Zuckerberg.

“This is the new approach, and I think it’s going to piss off a lot of people. But frankly the old approach was pissing off a lot of people too, so let’s try something different,” he added.

The said statement has been made in context to company’s stand on the political advertising where Zuckerberg clarified that Facebook is going to support free speech which essentially means that unlike other social networking websites like Twitter, Facebook is not going to ban them.

It is already known that Facebook CEO is done making New Year’s resolution and this year onwards, with a start of the new decade, Zuckerberg is going “to do something different.” Instead of making annual goals, Zuckerberg will now have long term focus which he didn’t really specify at the time. This was followed by his statement after the company announced quarterly earnings, ”My goal for this next decade isn’t to be liked, but to be understood. Because in order to be trusted, people need to know what you stand for.”

Title: ISRO Young Scientist Programme 2020: Registration begins today at isro.gov.in
Content:
The selection process for the ISRO Young Scientist Programme 2020 is based on academic performance.

Special weightage will be given special weightage for students from the rural area.

NEW DELHI: Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) has invited online applications for the second edition of Young Scientist Programme 2020 on its official website today i.e. February 3, 2020.The interested candidates can apply online for ISRO Young Scientist Programme 2020 through the official website of ISRO — isro.gov.in. The last date to submit applications for ISRO Young Scientist Programme is February 24, 2020.ISRO Young Scientist Programme 2020 is a two-week residential programme which will be held at four centres — Ahmedabad, Bangalore, Shillong and Thiruvananthapuram. ISRO has scheduled to conduct the Young Scientist Programme from May 11 to 22, 2020.Applicants should have completed class VIII and should be studying in class IXThe list of selected candidates will be announced by the last week of March.ISRO is conducting the Young Scientist Programme aiming at imparting basic knowledge on space technology, space science and space applications to students. Three students from each state/Union Territory will participate in the Young Scientist Programme every year from CBSE, ICSE and state boards.

Title: Anukunnadhi Okkati Aynadhi Okkati to release on February 7
Content: The release date of Anukunnadhi Okkati Aynadhi Okkati has been finalised by the makers. The film will now release in in Telugu, Tamil, and Kannada on February 7 , 2020.Written and directed by Baalu Adusumilli , the film will tell the story of four Hyderabad-based women who head to Goa for their friend’s wedding finds themselves unexpectedly involved in a crime. Dhanya Balakrishna , Tridha Choudhury, Siddhi Idnani and Komalee Prasad are the four women from Hyderabad. Raghu Babu, Himaja, Raghu Karumanchi, Sameer and others have supporting roles. Vikas Badija has composed music for this flick while Shekar Ganganamoni has cranked the camera. Manikanth will edit it. Hima Velagapudi and Vegi Srinivas have produced the film under B & W Pictures in association with Poorvi Pictures. Dhanya Balakrishna made her Tollywood debut with 2012’s Love Failure. She went on to star in films such as Seethamma Vakitlo Sirimalle Chettu, Run Raja Run, Chinnadana Nee Kosam, Raju Gari Gadhi, Bhale Manchi Roju, Nenu Sailaja and others. 4G and Flip and Flp are Dhanya Balakrishna’s other projects, which are in the pipeline.

Title: UKSSSC Forest Guard admit card 2020 released @ uksssc.in; Download link here
Content: NEW DELHI: Uttarakhand Subordinate Service Selection Commission, Govt. Of Uttarakhand has released the Admit Card for UKSSSC Forest Guard 2018 examination.Earlier, the Uttarakhand Subordinate Selection Service Commission (UKSSSC) has released the exam date and time on its official website.The Forest Guard (Post Code 102) examination will be conducted on Sunday, February 16, 2020 in two shifts - morning from 10:00 am to 12:00 noon and in afternoon from 02:00 pm to 04:00 pm. The examination for Sub-Inspector, Police Telecommunication (Post Code 119) will be held on Sunday, February 23, 2020 in single shift from 10:00 am to 12:00 noon.Candidates, who have applied for the examination, can download their admit card from the official website (http://www.uksssc.in/) by using candidate credentials like - candidate's name, father's name and Date of Birth or registered mobile number.The UKSSSC had invited applications for recruitment of 1218 vacant positions of Forest Guard.The selection will be done on the basis of Written Examination and PET/ PST. Those candidates who successfully clear the Physical Exam will have to appear for the Written Exam. The written examination will be of 100 marks. The duration of the exam will be two hours. The level of the examination will be intermediate (12th) level.Candidates should note that there will be a negative marking of 0.25 mark of every wrong answer. No mark(s) will be deducted if candidates do not attempt any question.1) Log on to the official UKSSSC official website - http://www.uksssc.in/2) On the homepage, a link is given in the middle of the page that reads: Forest Guard Written Exam Admit Card, the text is highlighted in red colour3) Click on the link, a new page will appear on your screen, now click on the download link given on that page. You will be redirected on another page4) Enter your name, Father's Name and Date of Birth or Reg. Mobile No. and click on the Submit button.5) Your Uttarakhand Forest Guard Admit Card will be appear on screen6) Download & Save it. Take printout for examination use.

Title: Mumbai: BEST restores services at JVLR bus stop
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

A BEST bus

MUMBAI: The BEST has restored bus service at one of its stops on JVLR on Monday morning after the water pipeline work was completed.

A BEST official said that the JVLR Road -- SEEPZ village -- bus stop was restored at 9.45am and services were resumed on Monday.

“SEEPZ bus stop for buses going towards Powai between Sariput Nagar and Reliance Energy bus stop was missed for route 461L, 459L, 469L, 524L, 492L, 425,428, etc. The water pipeline work was taken on a war footing and now all services have been restored,” an official added.

Title: Ajay Devgn's 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' inches closer to the Rs 250 crore mark; achieves a new box office milestone
Content: Ajay Devgn, Kajol and Saif Ali Khan 's period drama ' Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior ' seems to be unstoppable as the film has just been excelling in the domestic circuit in its fourth week as well. Not only is the film achieving several box office milestones but at the same time also shattering records which seems unbreakable. With another Rs 13 crore from the fourth weekend, 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' looks adamant to recreate box office history.According to the latest Box Office India reports, 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' has become the third film after ' Uri: The Surgical Strike ' and ' Baahubali 2: The Conclusion ' to surpass the Rs 10 crore mark over the fourth weekend. The Om Raut directorial has gone on to earn Rs 6.25 crore on Sunday which took its total weekend collection to Rs 13 crore. Now, the film has reached a stupendous total of Rs 244.87 crore and looks adamant to surpass the 250 crore mark by the end of this week.The film 'Tanhaji: The Unsung Warrior' is based on the life of Tanaji Malusare, unsung warrior of glorious Indian history and the military leader in the army of Chatrapati Shivaji Maharaj, founder of the Maratha Empire. Apart from Ajay, the audience has also hailed Saif's negative character a lot.Meanwhile, Ajay is currently gearing up for his next project which is a biopic on football legend Syed Abdul Rahim . The film is titled as ' Maidaan ' and Ajay's first look from the film has already become the talk of the town. Apart from that, he also has the war drama 'Bhuj: The Pride Of India' in his kitty.

Title: Danseuse's cellphone stolen in Ahmedabad
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative image

AHMEDABAD: Danseuse Mallika Sarabhai on Saturday filed a complaint with Vadaj police stating that her cellphone worth Rs 75,000 was stolen from her Darpana Academy in Usmanpura area of the city.

In her FIR, Sarabhai stated that she had gone to witness Jharkhand Festival at the academy at around 4pm on Saturday. At that time, her staff members were shooting the event and she also began watching the shooting and put her cellphone on a table.

At around 4.15pm, when she needed her cellphone, it was not there on the table. She had enquired with the people present there and searched for the cellphone for a while but did not find it. Later, she filed the complaint with Vadaj police.

Title: Chandigarh: Ticked off, teens took off for worse
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

CHANDIGARH: Reprimanded for not studying or berated for their love activities upsets some kids so much that they do not mind leaving the warm confines of their homes. Out of 1,026 children in the age group of 12 to 17 years who went missing from different parts of the city from January 1, 2015, to December 31, 2019, as many as 98% walked out owing to similar reasons, according to police.

Love, family fracas, financial crisis and pressure from parents for studies were the triggers behind children turning runaways (60% of them were girls). Luckily, police traced 924 children and efforts are on to find the rest of the 98 kids — a job that is not easy at all.

“The major challenge is that we have to start from scratch and sometimes these kids just do not want to return home,” cops said. Police have been running drives and forming teams to bring down the number. Nilambari Jagadale , SSP, said they run a special drive to trace missing children in January and July under ‘Operation Muskaan’ every year. The anti-human trafficking cell of UT police functions as a centralised unit to trace missing children and coordinates Muskaan too. NGOs have also been posted in the cell to strengthen it, the SSP said.

Special teams are being formed to trace missing minors under Muskaan on the directions of the ministry of home affairs since 2015. After getting a list of missing children, a Muskaan team reaches the house and takes details. The team circulates pictures of the missing child to neighbouring states and contacts shelter homes and NGOs to find the kids. The success rate has been high.

Data revealed that 16 police stations in Chandigarh registered complaints of 249 missing children in 2015, with cops being able to trace 236 children in that year itself. However, the figure came down to 196 in 2016, and 187 being traced. In 2017, police registered 201 cases and located 176 children. One child was brought back from outside the city. As many as 224 children disappeared from different parts of the city in 2018 and cops traced 198 of them. Last year, cops reunited 127 children with their families out of a total 147 missing children. Eleven children were traced from other states.

‘64 missing kids were found at railway station’

As many as 64 children who had gone missing landed up at the Chandigarh railway station and were reunited with their parents in the past one year. Rana said 41 of them were boys and the rest girls.

They were in the age group between 5 and 16 years. Rana said, “Most of the children said they had run away from their houses and reached the Chandigarh railway station. As many as 80% of these children belonged to Uttar Pradesh, Bihar and Rajasthan.”

Title: Punjab excise policy may set liquor prices soaring
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative image

MOHALI: The Punjab cabinet has approved the draft of new excise policy, which focuses on stability in liquor trade and revenue protection. But, the draft policy has a bad news for the Bacchus lovers, as it is likely to drill a hole in their pockets.

Liquor traders here feel that in the present form, the new excise policy will force a hike of Rs 40 to Rs 50 per bottle, and the prices of beer bottles and cans are likely to go up by Rs 8 to Rs 10 per bottle/can.

The Punjab cabinet led by chief minister Captain Amarinder Singh approved the draft of new excise policy 2020-21, with sustained focus on maintaining stability in the liquor trade while protecting the state's excise revenue.

The liquor traders said in this policy, the government has hiked the excise duty on retail, though the increase would be nominal (Rs 5 for PML, Rs 4 for IMFL and Rs 2 for beer). At wholesale stage, there is no increase in excise duty rates on PML. In the case of IMFL, the increase is approximately 5% and the duty has been enhanced from Rs 62 per bulk litre (BL) to Rs 68 for strong beer.

Liquor trader Sunny said, "The excise policy announced by the Punjab government will lead to marginal hike in liquor rates. We are more concerned about the regular brands like Royal Stag, Blenders Pride, Royal Challenge, ACP, RUM which are hot selling but the excise duty increase will hike the bottle price by Rs 40 to Rs 50. The interest of the trader as well as the customer must be look into."

The policy also reads that the fixed license fee of Rs 600 crore during 2019-20 will go up to to Rs 625 crore, while the additional fixed license fee of Rs 120 crore during 2019-20 is also to be increased to Rs 385 crore under the new policy.

Instead of any significant increase in the quota of different kinds of liquor, the increase has only been in the additional licence fee, because the licencees can lift quota of liquor according to their choice, out of this additional fixed licence fee.

Title: Ahmedabad: 'Ending DDT will add tax burden on HNIs'
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

From L: Vyas, Dholakia and Patel

AHMEDABAD: The Union budget announcement abolishing the dividend distribution tax (DDT), is expected to increase the tax burden on the high networth individuals ( HNIs ), according to eminent tax expert Mukesh Patel. Patel, along with former BJP minister, Jay Narayan Vyas; and former director of IIM Ahmedabad , Bakul Dholakia, presented the analysis of the Union Budget 2020-21 at Ahmedabad Management Association (AMA) on Sunday.

Highlighting the impact on HNIs, Patel said, "By abolishing the DDT, higher tax will be collected from the HNIs. Till now, there was a fixed rate of 20% for DDT and if one's earning through dividend is greater than Rs 10 lakh, there was an additional tax of 10%. Therefore, the effective tax came to 30%. However, the same has now been increased and surcharges will continue. Those who earn an income of more than Rs 50 lakh will end up paying more taxes. Overall, it will have an adverse impact on individual taxpayers."

Dholakia pointed out how the budget had little measures to curb the ongoing slowdown. "From a GDP growth rate of 8.1%, six quarters ago, we came down to 4.5%. This is a steep fall. However, clarity of vision is missing in the Budget as far as economy is concerned."

Vyas said, "Shortfalls are rampant in GST and direct taxes. This is expected to hurt government spending. To revive economy, it is important that the government spends but does so strategically and judiciously."

Title: Ahmedabad: Debtor drinks phenyl, loan shark arrested
Content:
This story is from February 3, 2020

Representative image

Ahmedabad: Cases of harassment by loan sharks continue to pour in, even though the city police have begun booking the Shylocks under PASA. Last Tuesday, one Mahesh Makwana, 33, of Behrampura was admitted in LG Hospital after he drank phenyl to commit suicide and thus escape loan sharks. Kagdapith police registered a case in the matter on Saturday under sections section of 387 and 502(2) and section 5, 40, 42 (a) and 42 (d) of Gujarat Money-Lenders Act against one Nathaji Ode of Behrampura, named as the accused by Makwana.

The accused was arrested on Saturday, the day the complaint was filed, said inspector U D Jadeja of Kagdapith police station.

"According to the FIR, about three years ago, Makwana had taken Rs 50,000 from Ode on 10% monthly interest. He has already paid back Rs 1,20,000. Even then Ode continued demanding money asserting that Makwana had only paid the interest," said a police official.

Last Monday night, Ode came to his house and threatened him to return his money.

Next morning, Ode again arrived at Makwana's home and asked him to pay Rs 50,000 - the principal amount. Makwana got frightened and drank phenyl in a suicide bid. "He was shifted to LG Hospital from where he was discharged on Saturday," said a police source.

Inspector Jadeja said, " The police commissioner's notification says that no one without a proper licence can lend money on interest and even if he has got a licence he should not charge more than 1.5% interest per month," said a police official.
